story:
terroir [ter-wahr] 

noun (French)-the environmental conditions, especially the soil and climate, in which a food is grown or produced, that give the food it’s unique characteristics

Hey there.

Thanks for stopping by. 

My name is Tere (it’s pronounced Tree). 

I am a mama, locavore, passionate foodie, activist, yogi, photographer,  personal coach for women, and ex-organic farmer. I had to leave farming when a shift in our family structure no longer allowed me to spend the necessary hours on the farm and be fully present with my children. I miss farming every day. I found meaning in that life, and still feel a deep connection to the naturalistic cycles and processes that farming brings. 

I have a profound appreciation for the amount of heart, soul and hard work that goes into each day on the farm, because I know it personally. I had an epiphany after visiting our local farmer’s market one day this winter. I felt a strong desire to give something back to our farmers, something to honor them, and show the communities support and appreciation for their hard work. I know how much it meant to me when a customer would return to the market to tell me how much they appreciated the tomatoes they purchased the previous week, or that they had an appreciation for all time went into growing that ONE tomato, or described the delicious dish they created with the food I grew. That is what makes it all the sweat worth it, knowing that your customers are close to their food, and feeling connected. 

With your help, I wish to create and publish an art quality photo journal of our local farms and farmers entitled "The Upstate Terroir Project:Cultivating Central New York". This book will feature small, mostly organic farms, taking an intimate look at the people, the crops, the animals, the landscape, the heart and soul of our farms...Documenting the essence of what it means to be a farmer in Central New York. This book will be a way of saying thank you to our farmers, and a means of raising awareness about how important our local markets and food systems are. 

So, why am I crowdfunding for this project? The project it seems pretty simple (and maybe it is), but there are some significant costs associated with it. The most major cost will be the actual publishing of the book. As I stated before, this will be a fine art quality printing, which will take up half of the proposed budget. Other expenses will be the cost of perks (excluding the books), upgrades to my equipment and technology, travel expenses, creating and maintaining an online presence, hiring help, Indiegogo’s fees and credit card fees. I am hoping to give myself a small percentage, after the fact, as I estimate this project to easily consume upwards of 500 hours to  complete. I gladly and willingly expect to donate most of those hours to the project without pay, as I am passionate about bringing this vision to life. The  humans and philosophy at the center of this project deserve to be honored, regardless of any financial gain on my end. Check out the info graphic below to see the breakdown of where your contribution goes. 

Let’s get to the good stuff...PERKS!!! I have some really neat incentives planned for you...with each contribution, you have the opportunity to cast a ballot to enter your favorite local farm in the book. If we reach a goal of over 100 votes for a particular farm, I will include it! Some of the other perks are notecards, limited edition prints, stickers and first edition print copies of the book. I am also organizing “The Taste of Terroir”, which will be an event bringing contributors and farmers together for an outdoor localvore feast, featuring our local farm’s unique offerings. You can even choose a perk that features your own private photo session with me....And the Grand Poobah....A most generous donation of $1,000 will allow you to “Buy the Farm”, and enter a farm of your choosing into the book. Please contact me before choosing this perk, as farms must meet certain criteria to be entered in the book. 

I am fiercely committed to seeing this project through to completion, even if the funding I am hoping to raise is not met. I am willing to adjust the plan, if that were to be the case, and still meet the end goal of publishing “Upstate Terroir” in some capacity. Perhaps the timeline for completion may be extended...Or I may have to find an alternate publishing house or medium to work with...I trust that there are enough humans in the community who care enough about local food and the people who produce it to help bring this project to life. 

So, what about this raising awareness you ask? Why are our local markets so important? Let’s first take a look at the benefits to local economies and communities...For one, food tastes better. It is fresher and healthier, picked at the optimal harvest time, instead of at an unripe stage to ensure shipping quality. Decentralized food production (e.g. apples from various local farms as opposed to one huge apple factory farm) reduces food safety risks, as long distance travel has higher potential for contamination along it’s travel route. Keeping it local serves to bring consumers closer to the source, creating a personal relationship with the food and food producer. Doesn't it just feel better to be connected? Direct retail-to-consumer marketing is growing exponentially in the local food markets, and benefiting local communities by keeping dollars within that community. Local economies benefit from job creation from farms and farmer's markets. 

Keeping it local has some pretty awesome environmental benefits as well...Local farms have a tendency to adopt environmentally friendly practices more readily than larger factory farms. Often, smaller farms use less pesticides, rebuild their soils with cover crops and compost, and support greater crop and insect diversity. Waste products from large livestock feedlots are incredibly degrading to the environment. Localizing the meat market often replaces the feedlot with smaller, grass fed or pastured livestock production. Keeping food local saves an incredible amount of fossil fuels in by decreasing the amount of 'food miles' on your plate at each meal.  In fact, conventionally produced foods travel about 1,500 miles in the United states, which accounts for about 11 times more CO2 than locally produced food. Eating foods that are in season, organic and less processed reduce your carbon footprint, and no better place to find those items than your local farmer’s market!

If you are not in a position to contribute financially to the Upstate Terroir Project, there are many other ways you can get involved. Come with me on a shoot to assist. Help me organize emails. Volunteer to wash dishes at the Taste of Terroir. I won’t be afraid to delegate tasks if you volunteer to get your hands dirty, so please...Shoot me an email, and let’s get down to it!

I want to extend a special THANK YOU to Wes Feuz for producing our campaign video. He totally rocked it. 

Also, thanks to BobCat and Al at Main Street Farms for letting us shoot the video there. 

And THANK YOU, for stopping by and supporting this endeavor.

story:
Español:
Hola! mi nombre es Álvaro Andrés Pinzón, soy Diseñador de profesión y fotoperiodista de Autos por convicción. Hace 6 años descubrí la fotografía y con ella me propuse la cultura entusiasta por los Autos. Hace dos años vendí mi auto clásico y emprendí un viaje, con el sueño de unir a los Latinos mostrando al mundo la riqueza cultural entorno al automóvil clásico de nuestra región. Con el privilegio de trabajar con medios de alcance global como Petrolicious he venido documentando los autos y las historias mas significativas de Latinoamérica como los Torinos del proyecto Fangio o los Pumas GT y vw sp2 Brasileros hasta los nuevos museos Chilenos dedicados al automóvil, o el ingenio del constructor de autos artesanales Badel en Colombia y que decir de los paisajes de Bolivia en un TVR chimaera! Para seguir con esta labor he creado este calendario en el he seleccionado las mejores 12 fotografías de 6 países durante un recorrido combinado de 15.000 km. 
Con tu ayuda podre seguir divulgando todas esas historias latinas a través de medios globales como Petrolicious, Octane, etc.

English:

Hi My Name is Alvaro Andrés Pinzón two years ago I sold my classic and started a trip, with the dream of uniting Latinos showing the world the cultural richness around the classic car of our region. With the privilege of working with global media such as Petrolicious I have been documenting the most significant cars and stories in Latin America such as the Torinos of the Fangio project or the Brazilian Pumas GT and vw sp2, to the new Chilean museums dedicated to the automobile, or the ingenuity of the artisanal car builder Badel in Colombia and what to say about the landscapes of Bolivia in a chimaera TVR !. to continue with this work I have created this calendar in it i have selected my best 12 photographs of 6 countries during a combined tour of 15,000 km.
With your help I will be able to continue spreading all those Latin stories through global media.

Portuguese:

Oi! Meu nome é Álvaro Andrés Pinzón, sou Designer de profissão e auto fotojornalista por convicção. Há 6 anos descobri a fotografia e com ela parti para difundir a cultura entusiasta dos carros. Dois anos atrás eu vendi meu carro clássico e comecei uma viagem, com o sonho de unir latinos mostrando ao mundo a riqueza cultural em torno do carro clássico da nossa região. Com o privilégio de trabalhar com a mídia global, como a Petrolicious, tenho documentado os carros e histórias mais importantes da América Latina, como o projeto Torinos do Fangio ou o Pumas GT e vw sp2 Brasileros, para os novos museus chilenos dedicados ao automóvel ou engenhosidade do construtor de carros artesanais Badel na Colômbia e o que dizer sobre as paisagens da Bolívia em uma quimera TVR! para continuar com este trabalho eu criei este calendário nas 12 melhores fotografias selecionadas de 6 países durante um passeio combinado de 15.000 km.
Com sua ajuda, poderei continuar a espalhar todas essas histórias latinas através de mídias globais como a Petrolicious, Octane, etc.

 

 

 

 

El calendario


"Autos Clásicos en Latinoamérica" Es un Calendario coleccionable que promociona a Latinoamérica como importante escenario entusiasta por los Autos clásicos, con fotografías en seis países de la región.

La selección cuidadosa de fotografías comprende autos representativos de nuestra región como los IKA Torino 380w de Argentina, participantes en las 84 horas de Nürburgring y que marcaron un hito en la historia latina automotriz en las carreras europeas, el Volkswagen Sp2 o el Puma GT ingenios brasileños creados durante una época en la que no se permitía importar autos del extranjero, las rarezas europeas como la Bugatti 57tt ganadora de Autoclásica o el Renault 8 ex Emerson Fittipaldi en las Mil Millas Brasileras,  pasando por La Carrera Panamericana el rallye de clásicos más importante y exigente de Latinoamérica hasta la travesía Pub2pub de Ben Coombs en la que llegamos hasta el salar de Uyuni en un TVR mientras atravesamos Sudamérica en medio de su travesía polo a polo.

A diferencia de un libro, un calendario estará más presente día a día en nuestras vidas durante un año, con ello quiero que conozcas y te apropies de nuestra región con todas esas gemas automovilísticas que un día marcaron la historia latina en torno a los autos clásicos, cada fotografía tiene una historia y de la cual puedes conocer más de cerca en los artículos que he escrito en Petrolicious https://petrolicious.com/author/alvaro-colombiano  o el Blog de mi pagina web www.andrespinzoom.com

No deja de sorprender todo lo que Latinoamérica tiene para ofrecer como escenario de esta pasión y de la que quiero empoderar la cultura y que nos apoyemos entre todos los hermanos latinos que activamente hacen parte de ella.

Durante estos dos años he retratado historias Latinas en más de 32  artículos y publicaciones impresas alrededor del mundo como Petrolicious, Octane Magazine, Speedhunters, BBC News, Sputnik, Finansavisen, Zen Garaje entre otros. Producto de un trabajo de investigación de campo y exploración de la cultura en cada uno de los países de la región.

 

Esto no habría sido posible sin la ayuda de todos esos amigos en cada país, familia y empresas que han aportado en esta loca idea. Comprando este Calendario contribuyes a que este sueño continúe con su misión de retratar y documentar los clásicos de nuestra tierra Latinoamericana.

Especificaciones técnicas

El calendario de autos clásicos 2019 presenta un diseño auténtico el cual consta de un marco de 31x31 cm rígido a modo de recuadro con láminas intercambiables por mes.

Son seis láminas con doce fotografías de autos representativos y auténticas rarezas en diferentes lugares y paisajes de 6 países de Latinoamérica. Impresas a doble cara, en litografía, papel de alta calidad de 300 gramos y aspecto Semi-brillante. En ella encuentras una fotografía junto con su descripción (auto, lugar y país) y calendario mensual.

Todo el conjunto de recuadro y láminas se empacan cuidadosamente en una caja de cartón micro corrugado que lo protege para su embalaje.

 

El presupuesto

Este proyecto necesita recaudar $6.000 dólares; los cuales irán destinados a la impresión, diseño y producción. Si sobrepasamos la meta el recaudo excedente se usará para poder llegar a las diferentes regiones que sean necesarias documentar y difundir más contenido de la cultura latina en torno a los clásicos.

Costos del material fotográfico:

Para producir este material fotográfico requirió una tremenda inversión económica, tiempo e investigación para llegar a los diferentes países, parte de estos costos los cubrí vendiendo mi auto, escribiendo artículos, sumando préstamos de familiares y amigos.

 

Riesgos y desafíos

El desafío más importante para el calendario son los tiempos de producción y entrega para ello cuento con la ayuda de Editorial Prince en la producción,  empresa experta en material impreso con más de 30 años de experiencia en el mercado.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si de una u otra forma no puedes contribuir adquiriendo el calendario Autos clásicos en Latinoamérica 2019, puedes echarnos una mano compartiendo y difundiendo en grupos y redes sociales, agradecemos enormemente tu apoyo!

story:
A FENCE? IN NEW MEXICO? 

Together, we can build a FENCE that doesn't divide, but rather encourages community engagement, dialogue, and celebrates our mutual love of photography. 

On July 9, we are bringing the national photography exhibit THE FENCE, and associated regional exhibit, THE FENCE NEW MEXICO, to the Santa Fe Railyard Park for a 3 month exhibit.

We are a community initiative sponsored by the New Mexico chapter of ASMP (American Society of Media Photographers), working with United Photo Industries (founders of THE FENCE) and the Railyard Stewards.

THE FENCE 2016 is an annual outdoor photography exhibition series with an audience of more than 3 million visitors. This summer, Santa Fe joins Brooklyn, Boston, Atlanta, Houston as an exhibition location.

Santa Fe is the western-most exhibit location for THE FENCE, and the smallest city - yet our historic legacy of photography and the award-winning venue of the Railyard Park makes it an ideal destination. 

THE FENCE brings powerful photographic narratives beyond the walls of a gallery and into the shared space of a public park, exponentially expanding the number of viewers. This exhibit never closes, and it costs nothing to see. This is public art. 

WE NEED YOUR HELP

This is a 100% grassroots community initiative. Of the 5 host cities for THE FENCE, Santa Fe is the only one that is sponsored by an organization - ASMP (American Society of Media Photographers) - without an established donor base or endowment to underwrite the exhibit. We have secured sponsorship funding from the regional business and art community, but we need your help, too. 

We need to raise funds to cover the cost of print production for the photography panels and for the rental of the temporary fencing used to frame the photography.

THE FENCE is about the power of public art: it’s an ambitious project to bring visual stories from around the world, and from around New Mexico, to a beautiful park, offering the opportunity for discovery and conversation. And we need your help to make it happen. 

How proud would you feel to walk through the park, and see the art that you helped bring there? 

THE BUTTERFLY EFFECT

If this project sounds exciting to you, share it with your friends, near and far. Be that butterfly, and flap your vivid wings. Every single share starts a new wave that can help us achieve our goal. One “share” click really can make a big, big difference. 

We also need volunteers the week of the installation, July 8, to help with installing the exhibit. It's a barn raising, art-style, and everyone is invited. Let us know if you'd like to pitch in!

And please join us for the opening in the Railyard Park on Saturday, July 9, 5-7pm. 

Learn more about our New Mexico photographers and join our newsletter on THE FENCE NEW MEXICO's website.

THE FENCE NEW MEXICO is a proud member of PhotoSummer, a collaborative initiative that represents and actively promotes historical and contemporary photography in New Mexico.
story_txt:
A FENCE? IN NEW MEXICO? Together, we can build a FENCE that doesn't divide, but rather encourages community engagement, dialogue, and celebrates our mutual love of photography. On July 9, we are bringing the national photography exhibit THE FENCE, and associated regional exhibit, THE FENCE NEW MEXICO, to the Santa Fe Railyard Park for a 3 month exhibit.

We are a community initiative sponsored by the New Mexico chapter of ASMP (American Society of Media Photographers), working with United Photo Industries (founders of THE FENCE) and the Railyard Stewards.

THE FENCE 2016 is an annual outdoor photography exhibition series with an audience of more than 3 million visitors. This summer, Santa Fe joins Brooklyn, Boston, Atlanta, Houston as an exhibition location.

Santa Fe is the western-most exhibit location for THE FENCE, and the smallest city - yet our historic legacy of photography and the award-winning venue of the Railyard Park makes it an ideal destination. 

THE FENCE brings powerful photographic narratives beyond the walls of a gallery and into the shared space of a public park, exponentially expanding the number of viewers. This exhibit never closes, and it costs nothing to see. This is public art. WE NEED YOUR HELP

This is a 100% grassroots community initiative. Of the 5 host cities for THE FENCE, Santa Fe is the only one that is sponsored by an organization - ASMP (American Society of Media Photographers) - without an established donor base or endowment to underwrite the exhibit. We have secured sponsorship funding from the regional business and art community, but we need your help, too. We need to raise funds to cover the cost of print production for the photography panels and for the rental of the temporary fencing used to frame the photography.

THE FENCE is about the power of public art: it’s an ambitious project to bring visual stories from around the world, and from around New Mexico, to a beautiful park, offering the opportunity for discovery and conversation. And we need your help to make it happen. 

How proud would you feel to walk through the park, and see the art that you helped bring there? 

THE BUTTERFLY EFFECT

If this project sounds exciting to you, share it with your friends, near and far. Be that butterfly, and flap your vivid wings. Every single share starts a new wave that can help us achieve our goal. One “share” click really can make a big, big difference. 

We also need volunteers the week of the installation, July 8, to help with installing the exhibit. It's a barn raising, art-style, and everyone is invited. Let us know if you'd like to pitch in!And please join us for the opening in the Railyard Park on Saturday, July 9, 5-7pm. 
Learn more about our New Mexico photographers and join our newsletter on THE FENCE NEW MEXICO's website.THE FENCE NEW MEXICO is a proud member of PhotoSummer, a collaborative initiative that represents and actively promotes historical and contemporary photography in New Mexico.

story:
ORIOL'S STOLEN CAMERA EQUIPMENT

(SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH VERSION!)

 

Sobre Mí

Soy Oriol, nací en Barcelona y mi gran pasión es la fotografía de paisaje, retrato y espectáculos. Esa pasión es una de las principales razones por las que viví durante un tiempo en Melbourne, para capturar en imágenes los paisajes increíbles que ofrecen Australia y Nueva Zelanda.

Actualmente viviendo en Europa, mi evolución como fotógrafo de paisajes me ha llevado a ofrecer parte de mi obra en una galería de arte ( FiftyDots ) y hacer algunos trabajos como fotógrafo freelance. Desafortunadamente, ésta carrera fotográfica se ha visto interrumpida de repente. Mi objetivo es seguir haciendo fotos compartiendo lo que mejor sé hacer.

 

 

¿Qué pasó y por qué hago esta campaña?

El pasado 31 de julio empecé un maravilloso viaje con mi amigo Héctor en su furgoneta Volkswagen. El objetivo del viaje era fotografiar Escocia conduciendo desde Barcelona hasta el extremo norte de Escocia. Fue un viaje increíble donde estuvimos en sitios realmente únicos y maravillosos.

Durante el regreso ya en Francia, en la última noche de nuestro viaje, paramos a dormir en una área de servicio cerca de Clermond-Ferrand después de un larguísimo día de viaje. Nos pusimos a dormir en la parte superior de la furgoneta, desplegando su techo abatible y cuando despertamos por la madrugada para seguir el viaje y llegar a casa, sentí lo peor que le puede pasar a un fotógrafo. Todo el equipo fotográfico que llevaba había desaparecido. Mientras dormíamos forzaron la cerradura sigilosamente y entraron rápidamente en la furgoneta para robar todo lo que estaba a su alcance. Me robaron unos 13.000€ en material fotográfico.

Después de presentar la denuncia a la policía y regresar a Barcelona, a fecha de hoy y después de muchas gestiones, correos y llamadas, ni el seguro del coche, ni de hogar ni de las tarjetas de crédito me permite recuperar un euro del material robado. Tampoco hay noticias del material.

Afortunadamente, no hay que lamentar daños físicos y no me pudieron robar lo más valioso, la pasión por la fotografía y todo lo que he aprendido en más de 15 años.

Actualmente ya he financiado con un crédito a 2 años para volver a empezar otra vez, una cámara y dos objetivos. Lejos de cubrir todo lo que se llevaron y con muchos sacrificios y renuncias detrás, es un pequeño paso para volver a compartir todas esas cosas preciosas que hay en el mundo.

Si queréis saber más sobre cómo ocurrió el robo, entrad al artículo que he publicado en mi blog.

 

¿Qué aportaciones puedes hacer y qué puedes obtener a cambio?

A continuación os ofrezco las distintas aportaciones que podéis hacer a la campaña. Con los beneficios de la campaña me ayudará a financiar una parte de las herramientas que me permitían sacar las fotografías que hacía. Personalmente ya estoy haciendo todos los esfuerzos para tener pronto una cámara para volver a empezar.

Lo mejor que un fotógrafo puede ofrecer es un trocito de esa pasión en forma de fotografía. He intentado crear una colección de contribuciones aptas para todos los bolsillos de quien quiera colaborar. Desde una aportación de 3€ hasta aportaciones de 1200€.

 

  • Wallpaper Pack: 3€. 5 Hermosas fotografías en resolución FullHD (1920x1080 píxeles en formato 16:9). Puedes ver los wallpapers en www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/wallpapers. Los fondos de pantalla se envían sin marca de agua.

 

 

  • 3 Panorama Postard's Pack: 9€. Se ofrece un pack de 3 postales panorámicas de 21x9,9cm con marco blanco cada uno en papel de más de 250 gramos. Solamente hay que elegir si quieres el Pack de postales en Blanco y Negro o el Pack de postales en Color enviándome un correo. Podéis ver las fotografías que se incluyen en cada pack en www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/panorama-postcards/

 

 

  • S Photo Print + Postcard's Pack: 25€. Se ofrece la impresión de una copia fotográfica de 20x30cm de una de mis fotos junto a un pack de postales panorámicas. (Consulta los detalles del pack de postales y el de Copias fotográficas para más detalles de cada uno).

 

  • S, M, L, XL Photo Print. Desde 20€. Impresión en laboratorio de fotografías en papel fotográfico. Podrás elegir qué fotografía quieres tener en papel dentro de la selección que hay en www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/photo-prints . El tamaño "S" solamente está disponible en fotos con formato 3:2 (30x20cm, horizontal o vertical) por motivos técnicos. Margen de la foto en blanco opcionalmente sin coste. Una vez hecha la donación, tendrás que enviarme por correo el nombre de la foto que has elegido.

 

  • S, M, L, XL Fine Art Print SPECIAL. Desde 40€. Impresión de fotografías en papel de alta calidad de algodón, especial para galerías! Incluye certificado de autenticidad firmado por el autor. Elije la fotografía que más te guste en www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/fine-art-prints . El tamaño "S" solamente está disponible en fotos con formato 3:2 (30x20cm, horizontal o vertical) por motivos técnicos. Una vez hecha la donación, tendrás que enviarme por correo el nombre de la foto que has elegido.

 

 

  • Portrait for CV or Tinder! 75€. Si necesitas una fotografía con estilo y saque lo mejor de ti para tu perfil de Linkedin, Curriculum o incluso para Tinder! Será una sesión de fotos de media hora en Barcelona y captaremos tu mejor perfil para que puedas compartir donde quieras. Se elegirán la 3 mejores fotos y se entregarán en alta resolución. Retoque básico y natural. Desplazamientos fuera de la ciudad con coste adicional.

 

  • Photoshoot / Sesión de fotos. 250€. Para verte genial, para hacer un regalo o para ofrecer tu trabajo con bonitas fotografías de retrato. Sesión de fotos de 2 horas en Barcelona y una selección con las mejores 10 fotos de la sesión en alta resolución, retocadas con delicadeza. En localización o estudio. Desplazamientos fuera de la ciudad con coste adicional.

 

  • Premium Photoshoot / Sesión de fotos Premium. 500€. Para quienes busquen algo más de una sesión de fotos de retrato. Para profesionales de la imagen y la moda como para un recuerdo muy especial. Sesión de fotos de 6 horas con maquillaje profesional incluido y una selección con las mejores 20 fotos de la sesión en alta calidad, retocadas con delicadeza. En localización o estudio. Hasta 4 estilismos distintos aportados por el cliente con 3 maquillajes distintos.

 

  • 1-Day Photography Training. 600€. Curso de Fotografía de 1 día. Si quieres aprender o mejorar tus conocimientos de fotografía te ayudaré a progresar y a sacar lo mejor de ti.  Puedes invitar a tu pareja o a un amigo/a. El curso es personalizado y privado, de 10h. Se puede hacer en un solo día o bien dividirlo en dos días. Solamente tienes que comentarme si te interesa aprender sobre la fotografía de retrato, paisajes o en la edición y haremos un curso a medida. Se impartirá en Barcelona ciudad (opcionalmente me puedo desplazar con coste adicional).

 

  • 3-Day Photography Workshop. 1400€. Curso de Fotografía de 3 días. Si quieres aprender o mejorar tus conocimientos de fotografía te ayudaré a progresar, a sacar lo mejor de ti y aprenderás mis secretos de fotografía.  Puedes invitar a tu pareja o a un amigo/a. El curso es personalizado y privado, de 10h por día. Se puede hacer en 3 días enteros o bien dividirlo hasta un total de 6 días. Solamente tienes que comentarme si te interesa aprender sobre la fotografía de retrato, paisajes, edición, etc y haremos un curso a medida!. Se impartirá en Barcelona ciudad (opcionalmente me puedo desplazar con coste adicional).

 

F.A.Q. (Preguntas Más Frecuentes)

  • ¿Porqué no se pueden comprar las fotos con marco? Después de valorar los riesgos y costes de embalaje y transporte, son tan grandes al tratarse de transporte de cristal, que decidí omitir la opción. Mi recomendación es hacer el enmarcado en alguna tienda local! Recomiendo esperar a recibir la obra antes de encargar el enmarcado.

 

  • Te gustaría otro tipo de producto para las fotografias? Contacta conmigo directamente y te haré una propuesta personalizada con otros productos como Aluminio Dibond, Cartón pluma o en lienzo.

 

 

    ¡Hay más formas de ayudar!

    Aunque no todo el mundo tiene los mismos recursos para participar en la campaña, hay otras formas de ayudar que serán más que bienvenidas:

    • Compartiendo la campaña en las redes sociales. En Facebook, Twitter, Instagram...recordad que desde aquí mismo ya tenéis algunas herramientas para compartir!
    •  Publicando en tu blog la campaña. Cuanta más difusión se haga, más alcance tendrá y seguramente más contribuciones habrá.
    • Comprando alguna de mis fotos en la galería de arte FiftyDots
    • Contratando alguno de mis servicios fotográficos fuera de campaña: Hago fotos de viaje, naturaleza, sesiones de fotos, reportajes...
    • Ayudando a localizar el material robado

     

    Si quieres contactar conmigo puedes hacerlo por correo o por teléfono:

    oriol@oriolmorte.com

    +34.653.060.996.

     

     

    Riesgos y desafíos

     

    Hasta ahora solamente había vendido alguna fotografía de forma muy individualizada. Las circunstancias y la necesidad me llevan ahora a trabajar duro para ofrecer mi trabajo más lejos que nunca y durante las semanas posteriores al robo que sufrí he estado preparando lo que os ofrezco ahora. He hablado con varios laboratorios fotográficos e imprentas y ya he realizado varios pedidos así como selección de muestras para comprobar cual tiene la calidad y excelencia que busco para todos los colaboradores que participen en la campaña.

    Algunos de los aspectos que se han tenido que valorar previamente a publicar la campaña para ofrecer los productos al precio más ajustado posible han sido:

    • Calidad del papel
    • Calidad de impresión
    • Selección de las fotografías
    • Costes de impresión
    • Costes de envío

     

    Una vez concluya la campaña, prepararé todas las fotos que se hayan solicitado en cada formato y lo enviaré a laboratorio para imprimir. Una vez recibido, comprobaré que no hubo ningún defecto de impresión y procederé al embalaje y envío con mucho amor!. Para mí será una gran y constructiva experiencia poder compartir lo que me apasiona hacer con vosotros.

     

    ////// ENGLISH VERSION /////////

     

    About Me

    I'm Oriol, born in Barcelona and my biggest passion is photography. Landscape, portrait and performances have been the main topics that I focused on photography. This passion is one of the main reasons why I had been living in Melbourne for a while, in order to capture beautiful landscape imagery that both Australia and New Zealand offers.

    Currently living in Europe, my evolution as a landscape photographer helped me to show and sell part of my work through an art gallery (FiftyDots) and also being hired for a number of photography assignments as a freelance photographer. Unfortunately, this photography career has been suddenly stopped. My main goal is taking pictures back again and keep sharing what I do best.

     

     

    What happened and Why am I doing this campaign?

    Last July 31st I did start a beautiful journey in company of my friend Héctor and his Volkswagen van. The purpose of the trip was taking pictures and video from Scotland driving all the way up from Barcelona to the north of Scotland by road. It was an incredible trip where we passed through stunning and unique places.

    During our way back to Barcelona, we spent our last night of the trip in the middle of France. Since we were already too tired to go on driving, we decided to overnight in a highway's service station's parking area near Clermond-Ferrand after a very long drive. We slept at the expandable roof of the van. When we woke up very early in the morning in order to keep driving and get home, I had the worst too-real nightmare a photographer could ever feel. Whilst we were sleeping, someone did break the van's lock silently and broke in. They got almost everything they found worthy including almost all my photography equipment. They stole me 13.000€ worth of photography equipment.

    After reporting to police and getting back to Barcelona, some phone calls, emails and bureaucracy, none of the insurances worked for recovering a cent of my stolen equipment. No news either of the stolen equipment from police.

    Fortunately, there was no personal damage and they couldn't steal what worths most: my passion and love for photography also everything that I learned over the last 15 years.

    I'm currently working hard and making big sacrifices in order to get back into photography again acquiring a camera and a couple of lenses through a 2-years credit. Everything focused on capture again all this beautiful things in the world.

    If you want any further information about the theft, visit my blog's article about it.

     

    What contributions can You do and what can You get in exchange?

    Ahead I do offer you  the different perks you can get in this campaign. The profit from this campaign will help me to get the tools I used to own that allowed me to take my best pictures. From my side, I'm already doing the biggest effort ever in order to begin again.

    The best that a photographer can give is a piece of this beautiful passion. I have created a collection of perks for everyone's budget who wishes to contribute. From a 3€ perk up to 1200€'s.

     

    • Wallpaper Pack: 3€. 5 Beautiful Photography Wallpapers on Full HD Resolution (1920x1080 pixels in 16:9 aspect ratio). You can check the wallpapers included at www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/wallpapers. The wallpapers will be sent without watermark.

     

     

    • 3 Panorama Postcards Pack. 9€. You will receive a pack of 3 postcards of stunning panoramas printed on +250g textured paper. The size is 21x9,9cm each postcard. Choose your Pack: Color or Black&White. Check the pictures included in the postcard's pack at www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/panorama-postcards/.

     

     

    • S Photo Print + Postcards Pack: 25€. A 20x30 photo print & a Postcard's Pack of your choice. Read the "Panorama Postcards Pack" and "Photo Print" section for further details.

     

    • S, M, L, XL Photo Print. Starting at 20€. Laboratory Photo Prints. You can pick the picture of your choice within the special dedicated gallery at http://www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/photo-prints. The "S" size is only available in 3:2 aspect ratio (30x20cm) size due to technical reasons. Once the contribution is done, you will have to send me the name of the picture you want.

     

    • S, M, L, XL Fine Art Print SPECIAL. Starting at 40€. Fine Art premium prints on gallery quality paper and certificate of authenticity signed by the artist. Get a picture of your choice from the dedicated gallery at www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/fine-art-prints. The "S" size is only available in 3:2 aspect ratio (30x20cm) size due to technical reasons. Once the contribution is done, you will have to send me the name of the picture you want.

     

     

    • Portrait for CV or Tinder! 75€. Do you need a stylish and nice picture for Linkedin, CV or even Tinder? A 30 minutes long photoshoot in Barcelona where we will get your best profile and share it wherever you want to. The best 3 photoshoot's pictures will be choosed and delivered in high-res files. Basic and natural retouch. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee.

     

    • Photoshoot / Sesión de fotos. 250€. If you wanna look awesome, for a special gift or showcase your work with beautiful portrait pictures. 2 hours photoshoot in Barcelona and a choice of the 10 best pictures, carefully retouched in hihgh-res files. Location or Studio. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee.

     

    • Premium Photoshoot. 500€. For those who are looking for something more from a portrait photoshoot. Either for fashion professionals or a very special memory. 6 hours photoshoot with professional make-up included. You will get the best 20 pictures in high-quality carefully retouched high-res files. Location or Studio. Up to 4 different looks provided by the client and up to 3 different make-up to match them. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee.

     

    • 1-Day Photography Training. 600€. Improve your photography skills or learn from the scratch. I will help you out on doing your best. You may invite your couple or a friend. This training is 10 hours long, customized and private. You can either choose the training in one day or split it in two days. Just need to know what is your first priority (portrait, landscapes or photo edition or a mix) and I will prepare a custom training. The training will be in Barcelona. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee.

     

    • 3-Day Photography Workshop. 1400€. 3 Days custom photography workshop. Improve your photography skills or learn from the scratch. I will help you out on doing your best and also learning my photography secrets. You may invite your couple or a friend. This training is 10 hours/day long, customized and private. You may take the workshop in 3 days or split it in 6 days. Just need to know what is your first priority (portrait, landscapes or photo edition or a mix) and I will prepare a custom training.The workshop will be in Barcelona. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee.

     

    F.A.Q. (Frequently Asked Questions)

    • Why can't I get framed pictures? Once evaluated either the risk, wrapping and shipping all of them are too much since glass shipping is so delicate. For that reason I preferred not to offer this option. My recommendation is by framing the picture in a local shop! I would also recommend to wait until the print is delivered before order the framing.

     

    • Would you like any other product for the pictures that is not listed? Contact me and I will offer you a custom product as Canvas, Aluminium dibond, Forex, Acrylic Glass and more!

     

    Other ways you can help

    • Since not everybody has the same resources in order to contribute to the campaign, there are other ways to help that will be more than welcome! Sharing this campaign on the social networks. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram...As a reminder, you may already share it from this website using the sharing tools!
    • Posting this campaign in your blog. The more widespread it is, the better range will have and probably more contributions will get.
    • Ordering any of my pictures on sale from FiftyDots's art gallery
    • Hiring my photography services out of this campaign: I take travel photography pictures, nature, portrait photoshoots, events, reports...
    • Helping me locate the stolen equipment

     

    You can contact me either by email or phone:

    oriol@oriolmorte.com

    +34.653.060.996.

     

    Risks & Challenges 

    So far I just sold a few pictures. Now, circumstances and need push me to work very hard in order to offer my work beyond than ever. During the time straigh after the theft I suffered I have been preparing all that I'm currently offering right now. I have talked to a number of laboratories and printing services and ordered a selection of samples. Offering the best quality and excellence was my aim and finding the right providers was very important.

    Some of the aspects that I had to review before releasing this campaign and also offering the best price possible are:

    • Paper's quality
    • Printing quality
    • Product design
    • Selection of pictures
    • Printing costs
    • Shipping costs

     

    Once the campaign ends, I will get all the pictures ordered ready and send them to the laboratory for printing. Once I will receive the prints, I will check every single print and will proceed the shipping with love! For me, this will be a huge and constructive experience in order to share whith you what I'm passioned about.

Solamente hay que elegir si quieres el Pack de postales en Blanco y Negro o el Pack de postales en Color enviándome un correo. Podéis ver las fotografías que se incluyen en cada pack en www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/panorama-postcards/
  
S Photo Print + Postcard's Pack: 25€. Se ofrece la impresión de una copia fotográfica de 20x30cm de una de mis fotos junto a un pack de postales panorámicas. (Consulta los detalles del pack de postales y el de Copias fotográficas para más detalles de cada uno). 
S, M, L, XL Photo Print. Desde 20€. Impresión en laboratorio de fotografías en papel fotográfico. Podrás elegir qué fotografía quieres tener en papel dentro de la selección que hay en www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/photo-prints . El tamaño "S" solamente está disponible en fotos con formato 3:2 (30x20cm, horizontal o vertical) por motivos técnicos. Margen de la foto en blanco opcionalmente sin coste. Una vez hecha la donación, tendrás que enviarme por correo el nombre de la foto que has elegido. 
S, M, L, XL Fine Art Print SPECIAL. Desde 40€. Impresión de fotografías en papel de alta calidad de algodón, especial para galerías! Incluye certificado de autenticidad firmado por el autor. Elije la fotografía que más te guste en www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/fine-art-prints . El tamaño "S" solamente está disponible en fotos con formato 3:2 (30x20cm, horizontal o vertical) por motivos técnicos. Una vez hecha la donación, tendrás que enviarme por correo el nombre de la foto que has elegido.  
Portrait for CV or Tinder! 75€. Si necesitas una fotografía con estilo y saque lo mejor de ti para tu perfil de Linkedin, Curriculum o incluso para Tinder! Será una sesión de fotos de media hora en Barcelona y captaremos tu mejor perfil para que puedas compartir donde quieras. Se elegirán la 3 mejores fotos y se entregarán en alta resolución. Retoque básico y natural. Desplazamientos fuera de la ciudad con coste adicional. 
Photoshoot / Sesión de fotos. 250€. Para verte genial, para hacer un regalo o para ofrecer tu trabajo con bonitas fotografías de retrato. Sesión de fotos de 2 horas en Barcelona y una selección con las mejores 10 fotos de la sesión en alta resolución, retocadas con delicadeza. En localización o estudio. Desplazamientos fuera de la ciudad con coste adicional. 
Premium Photoshoot / Sesión de fotos Premium. 500€. Para quienes busquen algo más de una sesión de fotos de retrato. Para profesionales de la imagen y la moda como para un recuerdo muy especial. Sesión de fotos de 6 horas con maquillaje profesional incluido y una selección con las mejores 20 fotos de la sesión en alta calidad, retocadas con delicadeza. En localización o estudio. Hasta 4 estilismos distintos aportados por el cliente con 3 maquillajes distintos. 
1-Day Photography Training. 600€. Curso de Fotografía de 1 día. Si quieres aprender o mejorar tus conocimientos de fotografía te ayudaré a progresar y a sacar lo mejor de ti.  Puedes invitar a tu pareja o a un amigo/a. El curso es personalizado y privado, de 10h. Se puede hacer en un solo día o bien dividirlo en dos días. Solamente tienes que comentarme si te interesa aprender sobre la fotografía de retrato, paisajes o en la edición y haremos un curso a medida. Se impartirá en Barcelona ciudad (opcionalmente me puedo desplazar con coste adicional). 
3-Day Photography Workshop. 1400€. Curso de Fotografía de 3 días. Si quieres aprender o mejorar tus conocimientos de fotografía te ayudaré a progresar, a sacar lo mejor de ti y aprenderás mis secretos de fotografía.  Puedes invitar a tu pareja o a un amigo/a. El curso es personalizado y privado, de 10h por día. Se puede hacer en 3 días enteros o bien dividirlo hasta un total de 6 días. Solamente tienes que comentarme si te interesa aprender sobre la fotografía de retrato, paisajes, edición, etc y haremos un curso a medida!. Se impartirá en Barcelona ciudad (opcionalmente me puedo desplazar con coste adicional). F.A.Q. (Preguntas Más Frecuentes)¿Porqué no se pueden comprar las fotos con marco? Después de valorar los riesgos y costes de embalaje y transporte, son tan grandes al tratarse de transporte de cristal, que decidí omitir la opción. Mi recomendación es hacer el enmarcado en alguna tienda local! Recomiendo esperar a recibir la obra antes de encargar el enmarcado. Te gustaría otro tipo de producto para las fotografias? Contacta conmigo directamente y te haré una propuesta personalizada con otros productos como Aluminio Dibond, Cartón pluma o en lienzo.  ¡Hay más formas de ayudar!Aunque no todo el mundo tiene los mismos recursos para participar en la campaña, hay otras formas de ayudar que serán más que bienvenidas:
Compartiendo la campaña en las redes sociales. En Facebook, Twitter, Instagram...recordad que desde aquí mismo ya tenéis algunas herramientas para compartir!
 Publicando en tu blog la campaña. Cuanta más difusión se haga, más alcance tendrá y seguramente más contribuciones habrá.
Comprando alguna de mis fotos en la galería de arte FiftyDots

Contratando alguno de mis servicios fotográficos fuera de campaña: Hago fotos de viaje, naturaleza, sesiones de fotos, reportajes...
Ayudando a localizar el material robado
 Si quieres contactar conmigo puedes hacerlo por correo o por teléfono:oriol@oriolmorte.com+34.653.060.996.  Riesgos y desafíos Hasta ahora solamente había vendido alguna fotografía de forma muy individualizada. Las circunstancias y la necesidad me llevan ahora a trabajar duro para ofrecer mi trabajo más lejos que nunca y durante las semanas posteriores al robo que sufrí he estado preparando lo que os ofrezco ahora. He hablado con varios laboratorios fotográficos e imprentas y ya he realizado varios pedidos así como selección de muestras para comprobar cual tiene la calidad y excelencia que busco para todos los colaboradores que participen en la campaña.Algunos de los aspectos que se han tenido que valorar previamente a publicar la campaña para ofrecer los productos al precio más ajustado posible han sido:
Calidad del papel
Calidad de impresión
Selección de las fotografías
Costes de impresión
Costes de envío
 Una vez concluya la campaña, prepararé todas las fotos que se hayan solicitado en cada formato y lo enviaré a laboratorio para imprimir. Una vez recibido, comprobaré que no hubo ningún defecto de impresión y procederé al embalaje y envío con mucho amor!. Para mí será una gran y constructiva experiencia poder compartir lo que me apasiona hacer con vosotros. ////// ENGLISH VERSION ///////// About MeI'm Oriol, born in Barcelona and my biggest passion is photography. Landscape, portrait and performances have been the main topics that I focused on photography. This passion is one of the main reasons why I had been living in Melbourne for a while, in order to capture beautiful landscape imagery that both Australia and New Zealand offers.Currently living in Europe, my evolution as a landscape photographer helped me to show and sell part of my work through an art gallery (FiftyDots) and also being hired for a number of photography assignments as a freelance photographer. Unfortunately, this photography career has been suddenly stopped. My main goal is taking pictures back again and keep sharing what I do best.  What happened and Why am I doing this campaign?Last July 31st I did start a beautiful journey in company of my friend Héctor and his Volkswagen van. The purpose of the trip was taking pictures and video from Scotland driving all the way up from Barcelona to the north of Scotland by road. It was an incredible trip where we passed through stunning and unique places.During our way back to Barcelona, we spent our last night of the trip in the middle of France. Since we were already too tired to go on driving, we decided to overnight in a highway's service station's parking area near Clermond-Ferrand after a very long drive. We slept at the expandable roof of the van. When we woke up very early in the morning in order to keep driving and get home, I had the worst too-real nightmare a photographer could ever feel. Whilst we were sleeping, someone did break the van's lock silently and broke in. They got almost everything they found worthy including almost all my photography equipment. They stole me 13.000€ worth of photography equipment.After reporting to police and getting back to Barcelona, some phone calls, emails and bureaucracy, none of the insurances worked for recovering a cent of my stolen equipment. No news either of the stolen equipment from police.Fortunately, there was no personal damage and they couldn't steal what worths most: my passion and love for photography also everything that I learned over the last 15 years.I'm currently working hard and making big sacrifices in order to get back into photography again acquiring a camera and a couple of lenses through a 2-years credit. Everything focused on capture again all this beautiful things in the world.If you want any further information about the theft, visit my blog's article about it. What contributions can You do and what can You get in exchange?Ahead I do offer you  the different perks you can get in this campaign. The profit from this campaign will help me to get the tools I used to own that allowed me to take my best pictures. From my side, I'm already doing the biggest effort ever in order to begin again.The best that a photographer can give is a piece of this beautiful passion. I have created a collection of perks for everyone's budget who wishes to contribute. From a 3€ perk up to 1200€'s. 
Wallpaper Pack: 3€. 5 Beautiful Photography Wallpapers on Full HD Resolution (1920x1080 pixels in 16:9 aspect ratio). You can check the wallpapers included at www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/wallpapers. The wallpapers will be sent without watermark.  
3 Panorama Postcards Pack. 9€. You will receive a pack of 3 postcards of stunning panoramas printed on +250g textured paper. The size is 21x9,9cm each postcard. Choose your Pack: Color or Black&White. Check the pictures included in the postcard's pack at www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/panorama-postcards/.  
S Photo Print + Postcards Pack: 25€. A 20x30 photo print & a Postcard's Pack of your choice. Read the "Panorama Postcards Pack" and "Photo Print" section for further details. 
S, M, L, XL Photo Print. Starting at 20€. Laboratory Photo Prints. You can pick the picture of your choice within the special dedicated gallery at http://www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/photo-prints. The "S" size is only available in 3:2 aspect ratio (30x20cm) size due to technical reasons. Once the contribution is done, you will have to send me the name of the picture you want. S, M, L, XL Fine Art Print SPECIAL. Starting at 40€. Fine Art premium prints on gallery quality paper and certificate of authenticity signed by the artist. Get a picture of your choice from the dedicated gallery at www.oriolmorte.com/indiegogo/fine-art-prints. The "S" size is only available in 3:2 aspect ratio (30x20cm) size due to technical reasons. Once the contribution is done, you will have to send me the name of the picture you want.  
Portrait for CV or Tinder! 75€. Do you need a stylish and nice picture for Linkedin, CV or even Tinder? A 30 minutes long photoshoot in Barcelona where we will get your best profile and share it wherever you want to. The best 3 photoshoot's pictures will be choosed and delivered in high-res files. Basic and natural retouch. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee. 
Photoshoot / Sesión de fotos. 250€. If you wanna look awesome, for a special gift or showcase your work with beautiful portrait pictures. 2 hours photoshoot in Barcelona and a choice of the 10 best pictures, carefully retouched in hihgh-res files. Location or Studio. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee. 
Premium Photoshoot. 500€. For those who are looking for something more from a portrait photoshoot. Either for fashion professionals or a very special memory. 6 hours photoshoot with professional make-up included. You will get the best 20 pictures in high-quality carefully retouched high-res files. Location or Studio. Up to 4 different looks provided by the client and up to 3 different make-up to match them. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee. 
1-Day Photography Training. 600€. Improve your photography skills or learn from the scratch. I will help you out on doing your best. You may invite your couple or a friend. This training is 10 hours long, customized and private. You can either choose the training in one day or split it in two days. Just need to know what is your first priority (portrait, landscapes or photo edition or a mix) and I will prepare a custom training. The training will be in Barcelona. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee. 
3-Day Photography Workshop. 1400€. 3 Days custom photography workshop. Improve your photography skills or learn from the scratch. I will help you out on doing your best and also learning my photography secrets. You may invite your couple or a friend. This training is 10 hours/day long, customized and private. You may take the workshop in 3 days or split it in 6 days. Just need to know what is your first priority (portrait, landscapes or photo edition or a mix) and I will prepare a custom training.The workshop will be in Barcelona. Availability outside Barcelona for an additional fee. F.A.Q. (Frequently Asked Questions)Why can't I get framed pictures? Once evaluated either the risk, wrapping and shipping all of them are too much since glass shipping is so delicate. For that reason I preferred not to offer this option. My recommendation is by framing the picture in a local shop! I would also recommend to wait until the print is delivered before order the framing. Would you like any other product for the pictures that is not listed? Contact me and I will offer you a custom product as Canvas, Aluminium dibond, Forex, Acrylic Glass and more! Other ways you can help
Since not everybody has the same resources in order to contribute to the campaign, there are other ways to help that will be more than welcome! Sharing this campaign on the social networks. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram...As a reminder, you may already share it from this website using the sharing tools!

Posting this campaign in your blog. The more widespread it is, the better range will have and probably more contributions will get.
Ordering any of my pictures on sale from FiftyDots's art gallery
Hiring my photography services out of this campaign: I take travel photography pictures, nature, portrait photoshoots, events, reports...
Helping me locate the stolen equipment
 You can contact me either by email or phone:oriol@oriolmorte.com+34.653.060.996. Risks & Challenges So far I just sold a few pictures. Now, circumstances and need push me to work very hard in order to offer my work beyond than ever. During the time straigh after the theft I suffered I have been preparing all that I'm currently offering right now. I have talked to a number of laboratories and printing services and ordered a selection of samples. Offering the best quality and excellence was my aim and finding the right providers was very important.Some of the aspects that I had to review before releasing this campaign and also offering the best price possible are:
Paper's quality
Printing quality
Product design
Selection of pictures
Printing costs
Shipping costs
 Once the campaign ends, I will get all the pictures ordered ready and send them to the laboratory for printing. Once I will receive the prints, I will check every single print and will proceed the shipping with love! For me, this will be a huge and constructive experience in order to share whith you what I'm passioned about.

story:
Who am I and Why am I doing this?

My name is Alex Manchev, I am a fine art photographer capturing the wildness, raw beauty and freedom of female nudity. My photographic series entitled The Freedom Project strive to empower women. I wish to break away from many dogmas and stereotypes that have been built into our concept of community.

I had a serious health condition several years ago. I received a second chance by receiving a kidney transplant. Then I’ve made a decision to life my live in a way that will contribute to positive changes in people’s hearts, minds and perceptions.

I’m a feminist. I see women not as a sexual object but as a form of art and as the goddess of creation. It’s my dream to make an exhibition and try to change the way society as a whole sees and perceives women, their bodies and souls. I want to change the norms of society that define what it is like to be a woman.

To make this exhibition possible I need funds for the framing and printing of my photographs. So I decided to turn to you. I hope that you’ll like my work and support my mission. And if you do, I’m kindly asking you to fund it by purchasing one of the perks and help my dream come true in 2017.

What is The Freedom Project?

My series entitled ‘Freedom’ is a collection of 30 images, capturing intangible emotion through the physicality of both the body and its surroundings.

Each image is a study of a woman, exposed within her private space, where she is free to reveal her true, unrestrained self, for that sole moment unaffected by the constraints routinely imposed on her by societal restrictions. My photographs capture female nudity in its purest form - sensual, effortless, wild and above all else superior.

In my work, I hope to move away from merely depicting the female body as a visually appealing and sexualized object. Rather, I strive to empower women and present them as independent individuals and the foundation of our society.​ I see the nude, uninhibited body as the ultimate form of character expression, able to convey emotion in a single gesture. I view it further as capable of liberating both the sitter and the viewer, as their lived physical experiences inform each photograph I frame, continually placing it in a novel context.

I aim to reflect the ephemeral, archetypal timelessness of the female body and energy. Further, I wish to elevate my sitters both as women, in their cultural significance and role in society, and individuals, with their personal markers of strength, assertiveness, sensuality and playfulness.

 

How Can You Help?

In order to make the exhibition come true, I need funding to frame and print my photographs. Have already agreed partnership for the location and the exhibition will be located in a gallery in Sofia, Bulgaria. In return you will receive some of my artwork in form of different perks, which you can find below.

Postcards

Calendar

Coffee-table Book

10 Posters Pack

 

High-quality Prints

Another Way You Can Help – Spread the word

I know a lot of people out there are excited about this project and want to get involved but don’t have the financial resources to do so. Believe me, I know. I’ve taken my camera to many charity auctions, art shows and fundraisers because I knew I couldn’t afford to support the cause with my wallet. I supported with my time instead, as well as the promotional power of my camera.

If you can’t support this project financially, I would be grateful if you would help me promote it by sharing this project with your friends on social media.

story:
Introduction

Hi, my name is Matt Grayson and I'm the Editor of Steampunk Journal (www.steampunkjournal.org) which is currently the most popular online steampunk magazine in the World.

I grew up in Sheffield, UK and I took an interest in photography from an early age. In fact, I have over 20 years of experience. I can turn my hand to any type of photography, but my passion is portraiture.

My campaign is to raise funds to build a subscription based website by steampunks, for everyone interested in this amazing science fiction inspired by the 19th century aesthetic.

The Hellfire Club will feature galleries of photoshoots up to artistic nude level. They will have models of all genders in various situations that will always sport a steampunk or Victorian theme to them. Not being gender specific is something that hasn't been done before on a website like this and will reinforce the steampunk ethic of inclusivity. I will also look to take on shoots from steampunk photographers and steampunks from the community who wish to model.

Members will have to pay a monthly fee to access the site and all the shoots that are available to see in the gallery. Everyone involved in producing a shoot will get paid in some way.

By contributing to the success of The Hellfire Club, you will be expanding a business that is already on the rise. My magazine, Steampunk Journal, is the most popular steampunk magazine in the world. I already have campaigns in place to help the community, such as Steampunk Write, Steampunk Read. It's designed to give independent authors some exposure of their novel right into the faces of the people that they want to read it. I champion supporting independent artists and always look to help them as much as possible. With an arm of the business bringing in finances, I can maintain the Journal as a free resource for steampunks and even expand to some other projects I've had to shelve due to costs.

I'm looking to raise £13,000 in order to fund the bulk of the outlay to get the Hellfire Club started. In order to have something for people to subscribe to, the site needs to have shoots accessible from the time of launch. I wouldn't be happy paying a monthly subscription for an empty website, so I can't expect anyone else to. I predict that having 20 shoots to upload will be good number with ten online at launch. That gives a buffer of another 10 shoots should I run into delays or other problems.

The cost of a single shoot is broken down typically into the following sections*:

Model hire £135

Make-up artist £180

Studio: £45

Clothing hire £50

Props travel costs £35

Retouching £205

Total: £650

*prices are for half a day shooting (approx 4 hours)

Perks for investment

The amount that you decide to contribute will determine the perks that you get and I've thought long and hard about what to award the lovely people that help me. Based on an estimate of a monthly cost of around £12 a month to join the site when it's live, I decided to give some discount to Indiegogo investors. Therefore, for just £10 investment, you will get 1 month access to the site. This will increase by a month at £10 intervals and from Level Three of investment I'll start giving away images that will be of a scene from your favourite shoot. At Level Five, the pictures will be printed and signed by the photographer, making a unique artwork even more rare as these will only happen for investors of the initial launch!

As the levels of investment rise, the pictures will become albums and you'll even be invited to input your creative ideas into a shoot at the top tier investment level.

I've also included three special stages especially for businesses. These will range from sponsorship of shoots with 12 month access, to full creative control of the shoot, to including company branding in photographs and advertising on Steampunk Journal.

Should not all the funds be raised, I will use what I have to get as many shoots done as I can. I've not included myself in any totals as I will be financing part of the project myself and I don't think it would be proper. I'll also be funding and building the site myself while the shoots are taking place.

However, if the target gets smashed and we go over, I will be able to expand the benefits such as a custom made website for ultra smooth viewing and a book of images if we do really well. Anything we have spare will either go to more shoots or I'll get some little goodies made up to hand out to people who have helped in the campaign.

One of my aims for the site is to empower the people who pose for the camera. This won't be a seedy website with naked girls. The site will have a variation of clothing removal which will be completely at the request of the model. I want the Hellfire Club to do what burlesque has done whereby it gives people self confidence. That's why the people taking part will be all genders, skin tones and orientations. Any adult who wants to take part will be welcome to be in front of my camera.

Aside from the confidence boost that people can get, they'll also get paid a reasonable wage for working for the Hellfire Club. There's a great deal of angst at the moment surrounding artists and how they feel that people are taking advantage of them under the banner of "exposure".

Risks and overcoming objections

I'm a regular guy in a regular life, so obviously not everything will go right. Problems rose from the start before I even started planning the campaign. I contacted 30 people who I thought may be interested in working with me and I only received 5 replies. Eventually I managed to find more people and I have a good number of people looking forward to working with me. The biggest risk is people's reliability. However, people working on a shoot for money are much more likely to show up than those working for free. That's another reason I knew I had to raise the funds to pay them.

I expect to run into issues with the site build. I'll be using an entirely new system which is why I'll be starting from when shooting begins. That way I'll have a good 20-30 weeks to get it up and running. I ran into build issues with Steampunk Journal though but it's a smooth running, attractive and bright website now.

I'm a grafter, I currently work on a farm delivering goods and that can be up to 1.5 tonnes a day. I also look after my two children on my own and run the magazine when I'm not doing either of those things, so I'm not averse to hard work. I'm also more determined about this project than anything else I've done. I've even made a video! With me talking on it!

I've been taking pictures for over 20 years now and I know how the industry works, so I'll always have a back up plan. I also worked for a large magazine for two years, so I understand how to make the website popular in the ranks. That's why searching general steampunk terms brings Steampunk Journal either to the top of the list, or within the top three:

  1. Steampunk news: 2 (after steampunknews.co.uk)
  2. Steampunk reviews: 1
  3. Steampunk articles: 1
  4. Steampunk interviews: 1

This demostrates how seriously I take my work, how reputable I am and how focused I am to make my projects the best they can be.

What you can do

I really hope by now you can see what an amazing website this could grow to be. I also hope that this is something that you want to invest in. Simply click the preferred box in the top right corner.
 
I know what it's like to have little or no money, but still have the compassion to want to help with a project you believe in. Don't feel that if you can't spare any funds that you can't help. I need as many people as I can get to spread the word about the Hellfire Club. I need people who can see this is going to be a success to help me make it the success they desire it to be. I will still reward people who help in these ways, even if it's like a Bookmark or a CD or something. I will find a way to say thank you.
So share this project, tell people about it, register your interest on the Steampunk Journal Landing page where I'll update by email. Liking and sharing posts extends the organic spread of posts on social media, so anything like that which can help with will be gratefully received.
 
Please accept my advance thanks for reading about my project and I hope that I've convinced you that this is a wonderful investment opportunity. If you have any other questions, though, please feel free to get in touch.
