story:
Nuestra historia / Our story

La idea de CovenGirls nació en el año 2014 en un grupo de amigos con la intención de armar una serie de fotografías macabras y/o eróticas que tuvieran en cuenta los detalles que muchas veces se pasan por alto, excepto claramente, para los nerds. Nuestro concepto básico es que las modelos elijan las temáticas de las sesiones por cosas que conozcan, para poder tener un resultado más fiel a las fuentes. Así empezamos a tener sesiones basadas en películas, cómics, mitología y literatura con un grupo de modelos no profesionales que demuestran que la clave de la sensualidad, es la actitud. //

The idea of CovenGirls started back in 2014 with a group of friends that wanted to shoot a series of macabre and/or erotic photos that had in mind the little details that usually get ignored, except of course, for nerds.  Our basic concept is that our models choose the themes for their sets based on things they know so we can have results that are true to the subject. That's how we started our sets based on movies, comicbooks,mythology and literature with a group of non-profesional models that prove that the key to sensuality, is in the attitude. 

 

Star Wars

Hacer un set temático de Star Wars es la fantasía de cualquier geek. El problema es que requiere de muchos recursos que por más creatividad que tengamos no están a nuestro alcance. 
Queremos aprovechar la oportunidad de llevar nuestras sesiones a otro nivel, y usar las ganancias para financiar nuestro propio sitio web donde van a haber: 

  •  Sets a pedido para los seguidores
  •  Foros para los miembros y las modelos 
  •  Recompensas para cada set con envíos por correo
  •  Descargas de material exclusivo 
    //

Doing a Star Wars themed set is the fantasy of every geek. The problem is that it recquires many resources that are far within our reach.
We would like to take on the opportunity to get our sets into a whole new level, and use our profits to finance our own website which will include:
 

  •  On demand sets for users
  •  Members and models forum
  •  Rewards for every set
  •  Exclusive material downloads  
 

Por qué lo hacemos // Why we do this   

La fotografía erótica no es todo fenómenos.
Defendemos la expresión artística y el valor de poder hacer lo que a uno le gusta, especialmente cuando transmite un mensaje de aceptación del propio cuerpo y los gustos que nos hacen únicos. Se requiere de coraje para posar frente a una cámara y se requiere de mucha pasión para adaptar y retratar un tema que nos haya marcado en la vida, desde un personaje hasta un concepto o un videojuego. Nuestro Aquelarre celebra nuestras diferencias y ofrece un espacio donde los fans puedan encontrar fotos hechas con fuerza y amor por chicas iguales a ellos.
// 
Erotic photography is not all about freaks. 
We defend artistic expression and the value of doing what you like, specially when it puts out a message of acceptance of your own body and the preferences that makes us unique.
It takes courage to pose in front of a camera, and it takes passion to adapt and portray a theme that changed our life; whether it's a character, a concept or a videogame. Our Coven celebrates our differences and offers a place where fans can find pictures made with love and fierceness by girls just like them.
 

Riesgos // Risks

No existen.
Cualquier mínima donación que puedan realizar suma mucho a nuestro presupuesto y a nuestras posibilidades de seguir avanzando. Con su ayuda tendremos la chance de complementar nuestras historias con mejor maquillaje, utilerías, estudios, todo!
Si no llegamos a la meta, todo lo recaudado va a ser usado para igualmente terminar éste set y cumplir las recompensas de la campaña, sea cual sea el resultado. 
//
There aren't any. 
Any donation you can afford would help our budget and our chances to keep moving forward. With your help we'll be able to complement our stories with proper makeup, props, photo studios, the whole thing! 
If we don't reach our goal, everything collected will be used to finish this set and send all the rewards from the campaign, whatever the result.
 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar // Other ways you can help

La difusión lo es todo para el arte. Si no pueden colaborar con donaciones pero les agrada nuestra iniciativa o conocen a alguien que le pueda interesar, compártanlo en sus redes sociales o coméntenselo a quienes puedan. Si Star Wars no es particularmente lo suyo, ¡no se preocupen! tenemos muchos sets más para ver en nuestro perfil de Patreon y en Facebook.
¡Ustedes nos pueden ayudar a hacer una diferencia! 
//
Diffusion is everything for art. If you can't collaborate with donations but you like what we do or you know someone who might, share it in your social networks or mention it to whoever you can. If Star Wars is not particularly your thing, don't worry! we got plenty of other sets to look at on our Patreon and Facebook profiles.
You can help us make a difference!

story:
My name is Eliana, I'm a photographer and I'm from Montevideo, Uruguay.
Two years ago I decided to photograph people from 100 countries who were living in my city in order to show that it is becoming a home to people from all around the world.At the beginning, my family and friends were not very positive about the idea; to them, that number was just impossible to achieve. My enthusiasm was stronger than their opinion so I started to contact the Embassies, Consulates and Cultural Centers presenting the project and asking for their collaboration. Fortunately, I got a very good response from all of them, they put me in contact with foreigners willing to participate and that was the beginning of this incredible journey. When I reached 65 portraits, I published the pictures on social media hoping that people would like the challenge and help me finish it. Once again, the answer was more than positive: people got really excited about showing this new multicultural face of Montevideo. What started as a personal project turned into a collective one and, with effort and perseverance, I finally reached the goal.In "Montevideo: Crisol Cultural" you will find portraits of 53 women and 47 men, between ages 18 and 92, from all socio-economic levels and, as you can imagine, with 100 different stories to tell.Fortunately, the project had a remarkable repercussion with the press, was exhibited and I had the honor to be invited to give a TEDx talk to tell about the whole experience. But most important, it touched people's hearts, they got really excited about seeing this new multicultural face of Montevideo. 
You can find the whole work on my website: www.elianacleffi.com.uy, Facebook (Eliana Cleffi) and now I'm posting the pictures on Instagram: @montevideo_crisol_cultural.

CRISOL CULTURAL: LINKING STORIES

Now I'm preparing the second part of this adventure:
In the first chapter, each picture was taken at their favorite locations around the city.
What I plan to do next is to take a picture of their favorite spots in the cities they were born.
As they are living here, the person who will pose in front of my camera will be chosen by them: it can be a family member, a friend, whoever they feel that would be able to finish telling the story.
I want to bring them and their most special people and places together to complete the puzzle. 
The idea is to do a three-day report in each city, in 26 countries (across the five continents) and in a period from 6 to 8 months. I will be sharing the whole journey through a blog and social media. After that, I will work on an ebook showing the 26 new portraits, other selected pictures and, of course, writing about the best stories and experiences.Where will I go?  Zimbabwe, South Korea, Macedonia... You can check the complete route in FAQ section!

Why do I ask for your support?

As you can imagine, this is a very ambicious project and I will need at least 38.000 USD to realize it.

My expenses are explained below:
Plane Tickets                       35%
Accomodation                    20%
Land Transportation         15%
Campaign Costs                 13%
Food                                          7%
Unexpected Expenses        5%
Visas/Insurances                 5%

I have various long-distance flights; that will cost me a considerable amount of money. I will have some land trasportation since not all the participants are from the capital of their countries. Apart from covering accomodation, food and visas I need to be aware of the unexpected expenses that I can face during the journey.

A flexible campaign

I don't need to reach the entire amount of money to begin the journey. I've calculated how much do I need to cover at least the first part of the project. From there on, I can continue exploring other ways to finance the second part: 

South America                   18%

America (complete)         30%

America and Europe         50%

 

Perks:

I consider I have some really good perks to offer you!

 10 USD
 Exclusive 'Backers Only' email updates from the road, including pictures and text.

25 USD
Exclusive 'Backers Only' email updates from the road, including pictures and text.
You will receive the Crisol Cultural: Relating Stories E-book

50 USD
Exclusive 'Backers Only' email updates from the road, including pictures and text.
"Crisol Cultural: Relating Stories E-book"
A 8x12"/20x30cm print of the available pictures shown on my reward page. (Professional Luster photo paper - Fuji or Kodak)

 75 USD
Exclusive 'Backers Only' email updates from the road, including pictures and text.
"Crisol Cultural: Relating Stories E-book"
Two 8x12"/20x30cm prints from the available pictures shown on my reward page. (Professional Luster photo paper - Fuji or Kodak)

100 USD
Exclusive 'Backers Only' email updates from the road, including pictures and text.
"Crisol Cultural: Relating Stories E-book"
One 8x12"/20x30cm print from the available pictures shown on my reward page. (Professional Luster photo paper - Fuji or Kodak)
One 12x18"/30x45cm print from the available pictures shown on my reward page. (Professional Luster photo paper - Fuji or Kodak)

175 USD
Exclusive 'Backers Only' email updates from the road, including pictures and text.
"Crisol Cultural: Relating Stories E-book"
3 signed postcards from the available pictures shown on my reward page. 
Two 12x18"/30x45cm print from the available pictures shown on my reward page. (Professional Luster photo paper - Fuji or Kodak)

250 USD
Exclusive 'Backers Only' email updates from the road, including pictures and text.
"Crisol Cultural: Relating Stories E-book"
5 signed postcards from the available pictures shown on my reward page. 
Three 12x18"/30x45cm print from the available pictures shown on my reward page. (Professional Luster photo paper - Fuji or Kodak)

 500 USD
Exclusive 'Backers Only' email updates from the road, including pictures and text.
"Crisol Cultural: Relating Stories E-book"
10 signed postcards from the available pictures shown on my reward page. 
Three 12x18"/30x45cm print from the available pictures shown on my reward page. (Professional Luster photo paper - Fuji or Kodak)
One 12x18"/30x45cm print from the available pictures shown on my reward page. Hahenmule mate photo rag paper, 308g.

The Impact

Besides the artistic part and proving that a woman can travel on her own to any part of the world, I also want to highlight how much can we enhance our lives through cultural diversity.

Risks & Challenges

I know this is not always going to be an easy ride. This kind of projects requires a lot of logistics and I'm sure there will be very stressful situations and exhausting days.

This is not my first solo-trip: I have travelled by land from Morocco to Senegal (crossing Western Sahara and Mauritania). I repeated the experience in Turkey and Iran. I have the best memories from those journeys. 

Hopefully, I will build better memories with this new adventure and bring you all with me.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you can still can help me sharing my campaign on your social media. You can use the Indiegogo share tools for that!

Website: www.elianacleffi.com.uy  

Instagram: @crisolcultural_linkingstories

Facebook: Eliana Cleffi

Last but not least: you can contact me at ecleffiphoto@gmail.com if you have any doubts or questions.

Thank you so much for your attention!
story_txt:
My name is Eliana, I'm a photographer and I'm from Montevideo, Uruguay.Two years ago I decided to photograph people from 100 countries who were living in my city in order to show that it is becoming a home to people from all around the world.At the beginning, my family and friends were not very positive about the idea; to them, that number was just impossible to achieve. My enthusiasm was stronger than their opinion so I started to contact the Embassies, Consulates and Cultural Centers presenting the project and asking for their collaboration. Fortunately, I got a very good response from all of them, they put me in contact with foreigners willing to participate and that was the beginning of this incredible journey. When I reached 65 portraits, I published the pictures on social media hoping that people would like the challenge and help me finish it. Once again, the answer was more than positive: people got really excited about showing this new multicultural face of Montevideo. What started as a personal project turned into a collective one and, with effort and perseverance, I finally reached the goal.In "Montevideo: Crisol Cultural" you will find portraits of 53 women and 47 men, between ages 18 and 92, from all socio-economic levels and, as you can imagine, with 100 different stories to tell.Fortunately, the project had a remarkable repercussion with the press, was exhibited and I had the honor to be invited to give a TEDx talk to tell about the whole experience. But most important, it touched people's hearts, they got really excited about seeing this new multicultural face of Montevideo. You can find the whole work on my website: www.elianacleffi.com.uy, Facebook (Eliana Cleffi) and now I'm posting the pictures on Instagram: @montevideo_crisol_cultural.
CRISOL CULTURAL: LINKING STORIES
Now I'm preparing the second part of this adventure:In the first chapter, each picture was taken at their favorite locations around the city.What I plan to do next is to take a picture of their favorite spots in the cities they were born.As they are living here, the person who will pose in front of my camera will be chosen by them: it can be a family member, a friend, whoever they feel that would be able to finish telling the story.I want to bring them and their most special people and places together to complete the puzzle. The idea is to do a three-day report in each city, in 26 countries (across the five continents) and in a period from 6 to 8 months. story:
*Melona Bar, Choco Pie, Shin Ramyun, Bibimbap, and Hibiscus Perk Levels can be claimed an unlimited number of times*

----------------

Dressed In Layers: A Hanbok Project

안녕하세요! 반갑습니다~ 

Hi there! Thank you for being here. We (Erin and Harriet) are so happy you're here.  We're two Korean-Canadians living in Toronto, working on this passion project using art and stories to bridge our experiences of home, memory, and family.  

Dressed in Layers: A Hanbok Project is a grassroots project that explores the relationship that members of the Korean-Canadian diaspora hold between this land and the homeland, as well as the many spaces in-between.

Our first big initiative is a portrait series featuring members of the Korean-Canadian diaspora wearing the Korean traditional hanbok (traditional Korean attire). Subjects are photographed in places and spaces that are self-selected and hold particular meaning for them. 

Rosel Kim, Christie and Bloor Koreatown, 2019. Photographed by Harriet Kim.

We see arts, education, and personal reflection as centrally interrelated, and hope to use a variety of initiatives to explore this work in the future. We also emphasize that any critical reflection on “home” and “place” in the diasporic context cannot exist without a critical reflection on the history of Canada, its colonization, and our relationships and responsibilities with this land - thus this project is also one of learning and solidarity. 

We hope that this project sparks dialogue not only within the Korean-Canadian community but in the many other communities of diaspora in Toronto and beyond. As just two dorks who are passionately pursuing a project from our hearts, we are SO grateful for your support with this work!

Click on the perks on the right side of the screen to see what gifts you'll get for your support! <3 

Follow us on instagram: @dressedinlayers_TO

 

Our Premiere Exhibit

As part of our first initiative, we are launching a premiere exhibit from April 16th - April 26th, at the Northern Contemporary Gallery. The exhibit will feature portraits taken by Harriet Kim of Korean-Canadians wearing hanbok in places that are meaningful to them. Stories and experiences are also highlighted in this exhibit. 

Event page for launch party, April 16th - 7-9 PM - TBA!

We will also be hosting events and workshops during our 10-day exhibit, which we'll announce here. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

As a grassroots project, we are creating art through the magic of hustle, collaboration, and love. This project has already created so much connection and community between the folks who have been involved so far, and with some extra support we can accomplish so much more! 

Our goal is to raise $3500 to support the first collection in the Dressed in Layers series. This will roughly look like:

  • $2000 in exhibition costs (venue, display hardware, transportation)
  • $1000 in honouraria for models 
  • $500 for photo editing and administrative support

Though this will not cover all of ours costs, we hope to raise more funds through events and merchandise sales. All of the funds we use will be to directly support the project and compensate people who have been involved in its creation!

We're so excited to offer some really cool gifts in exchange for your support. Our perks include stickers, luggage tags, postcards, and small-batch kimchi*! <3 

*available in Toronto only

Click on the perks on the right side of the screen to see what gifts you'll get for your support!

 

All About Community 

To us, this is not simply a portrait series - it represents hundreds of points of connection for those in the Korean-Canadian diaspora, and much beyond. Through the combination of visual and oral storytelling and a variety of artistic media, we seek to encourage intergenerational, intersectional dialogue. 

As settlers on this land, our personal missions are also to use this opportunity to learn, educate each other, and practice solidarity with the original inhabitants of this land. We believe that such dialogue must happen first within our own communities, and in ways that bridge the myriad experiences we each hold. This exhibit is one step towards this journey and we would love you to come along with us! 

 

How to Support in Non-Monetary Ways 

We are so grateful for any and all support! We'd love if you would consider:

  • Sharing our campaign with your friends and networks
  • Sharing your time by volunteering during our exhibition (e.g. supporting at events) 
  • Attending our events!

 

Land Acknowledgement 

Dressed in Layers would like to acknowledge that our work and presence are situated on the traditional territories of many nations including the Mississaugas of the Credit, the Anishnabeg, the Chippewa, the Haudenosaunee and the Wendat peoples and is now home to many diverse First Nations, Inuit and Métis. We also acknowledge that Toronto is covered by Treaty 13 with the Mississaugas of the Credit, and that as settlers we benefit from the colonialism that created this nation. It is our commitment to continuously and eternally learn, educate, and stand in solidarity with the Indigenous peoples of this land. 

Solidarity Statement: Asians in Support of Wet'suwet'en Jurisdiction and Governance - https://asiansinsupportofwetsuweten.water.blog/ 

In Korean: https://asiansinsupportofwetsuweten.water.blog/...

story:
Over a year in the making, The Big Book of Pit Bull Headshots from Hollywood was true labor of love. Now we need all of our fellow Pit Bull Lovers to help us share it with the world! Your support and backing will help with printing and shipping costs, but don't worry, even if we don't raise enough to keep it on Indiegogo, the book will be available after the campaign is over on our website- pitbullheadshots.com

THANKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT PIT BULL LOVERS!

 

Our story...

I adopted my Pit Bull, Daisy nearly ten years ago and she has been the best dog anyone could ask for, bringing so much joy and happiness to my life. Technically, Daisy is an American Staffordshire Terrier, but Pit Bull is the term generally used to describe her and dogs like her. Unfortunately, when people hear Pit Bull, they often envision something mean and scary, which is a terrible stereotype and why so many of them end up in shelters. It's this mis-perception that I and my fellow Pit Bull advocates are striving to change and what this book represents. When I rescued Daisy along with her puppy from the street I really didn't know where to turn, but luckily I found the amazing Karma Rescue. The work they do to save and educate people about this largely mis-understood class of dogs is nothing short of heroic and I will be forever grateful to them for their love and support. The team at Karma, led by the incredible Rande Levine, guided me through every step of the process from fostering and training to final adoption to her "forever home" and Daisy has been by my side ever since. 

How this project started...

I'm a Los Angeles based commercial photographer and one day when Daisy came with me to the studio I thought it would be fun to do some headshots of her, so I sat her in front of a backdrop and snapped off a few quick shots...

My Daisy and the pictures that started it all.

I posted the pictures online and the response was amazing! I started getting requests from other rescued Pit Bull parents wanting headshots of their dogs too. That was my "Aha" moment and the idea for a book of happy Pit Bull headshots promoting Pit Bull positivity was born. I started posting invitations to shoot on my @pitbullheadshots Instagram and Facebook pages...

Over the next twelve months it was steady stream of Pitties, Staffies, Bullies, Pocket Pits and Low Riders...that's what they call a Pit-Basset Hound mix. From all over the southland they came, with names like Piglet, Porkchop, Banksy and Biggie. There was a Django, a Snooki, a Snickie and two Ripleys. Some even brought the whole posse @bubbas_crew. More than 100 Pit Bull owners brought their pups to my West Hollywood studio to participate and we had a blast! Huge Thanks to LARPBO, for helping spread the word.

Family photos of some of the awesome folks who answered the call...

At first, I thought I'd stop at 100, but I was having so much fun and I was meeting so many amazing dogs and their equally amazing owners, I just kept shooting until I had 200! Then came the challenge of putting them all in book form. I knew that the only way to do it was with offset printing, as print on demand services like Blurb would make it too expensive. Working in Adobe InDesign, we went through a number of designs and layouts until finally...drum roll please, it's ready to go to the printer!

How the money will be spent...

The money raised will go towards printing and shipping the minimum 1000 copies required for offset printing a hardcover book of this size. We've learned that the best approach is to use a US print broker who works with an offshore printer. This will insure that the printing will be overseen domestically, providing the necessary quality control, while the cost to print will be significantly lower than if we printed in the US.

 

See an excerpt here- The Big Book of Pit Bull Headshots from Hollywood

Galleries organized by name are here- Pit Bull Headshots Gallery 

 

A final thought...

From the very beginning this project was about much more than a book of Pit Bull headshots. It's a symbol of compassion and way to break the negative stereotypes so people can see that these dogs should be loved and not feared. The more people we can reach with that message, the fewer will end up in shelters or worse. With your support this book will just be the beginning and we'll be able to continue our crusade with books from other cities around the country and eventually worldwide!

This book is dedicated to all those who give their time, energy and love so these amazing animals can have a second chance at the happy lives they deserve. 

Thank you so much! 

-Peter and Daisy

 L.A. area Pit Bull rescues we support include-

Karma Rescue

Angel City Pits

Best Friends NKLA

Downtown Dog Rescue

This will insure that the printing will be overseen domestically, providing the necessary quality control, while the cost to print will be significantly lower than if we printed in the US. See an excerpt here- The Big Book of Pit Bull Headshots from HollywoodGalleries organized by name are here- Pit Bull Headshots Gallery  A final thought...From the very beginning this project was about much more than a book of Pit Bull headshots. It's a symbol of compassion and way to break the negative stereotypes so people can see that these dogs should be loved and not feared. The more people we can reach with that message, the fewer will end up in shelters or worse. With your support this book will just be the beginning and we'll be able to continue our crusade with books from other cities around the country and eventually worldwide!This book is dedicated to all those who give their time, energy and love so these amazing animals can have a second chance at the happy lives they deserve. Thank you so much! -Peter and Daisy L.A. area Pit Bull rescues we support include-Karma RescueAngel City PitsBest Friends NKLADowntown Dog Rescue

story:
We are a group of Christian photographers with a passion for participating in, documenting and bringing awareness to global missions. This Summer, we will be sending out a group of 7 or more photographers to 7 different countries on mission trips to photograph and tell the story of the people, places and projects we encounter along the way!  

Our ultimate goal is to bring more awareness to these Christian outreaches, by creating a unique photography, experience and testimony driven book of the different mission trips in such a way that you will feel like you were personally a part of each one!  We want to be able to create a passion for missions that will stick with people far beyond their initial experience, and positively impact the people and places we meet through prayer, exposure and financial support.

To raise awareness and train photographers for Christian based mission trips around the globe.  Within that, we have 3 primary objectives:

  • Raise up and train future photographers who have a heart for missions
  • Use photography as a tool for interacting and witnessing in the mission field
  • Bring awareness and exposure to each mission trip; prayer requests, support & volunteer opportunities.


This Summer we will be participating in 8 different mission trips from June - August through the MVMNT Missions organization to the following countries:
  • Thailand
  • United States
  • Cambodia
  • Zambia
  • Haiti (2 different trips)
  • Panama
  • Scotland
Our goal is to expand this to train and send out more photographers to more nations through even more organizations following the success of this campaign for 2016!

We are needing to secure funds for 3 main purposes, all equally important!  Each contribution has a reward offer tied to it that we are happy to provide, and will go a long way towards the following areas of need:

  1. Photography Equipment.  Each of the photographers have a varied set of personal equipment, but we are raising funds to fill in those gaps and have a specific set to use for future trips & ministry opportunities.  
  2. Travel Expenses.  To photograph and document each trip, we've got to get there first!  Each photographer has already committed to paying their way if necessary, but with much of our group being college age to young professionals, financial assistance is always a huge help!  Plus this will make it much more viable for future missions, as covering their cost will be a large part of our ministry!
  3. Book Printing Costs.  In order to create the gorgeous coffee table books with the stories and pictures from each of the trips, we need to print a minimum of 50 books, and the more we order the more affordable we can offer them in the future!


Here are all the amazing rewards we are proud to offer as a thank you for your contributions!  

  • Digital Wallpapers - Our top 25 hand selected images from the trips will look amazing as your desktop or social media background!
  • Postcard - Digitally signed, printed and delivered from your selected trip!
  • E-Book - A collection of photos, stories and testimonies from the trip told chronologically to make you feel like you were right there with us!
  • Poster - Display our photographers choice top voted photo on your wall proudly!
  • Coffee Table Book - Beautiful display-worthy lay-flat photography style hardback coffee table book you'll be proud to own + your name acknowledged as a contributor in the back!
  • Personalized Photography Session - A 2 hour personal portrait or family photography session with your choice of one of the seven 7 Nation Summer photographers!  To be redeemed from August 2015 - December 2015 unless otherwise agreed upon.
  • Limited Edition Archival Print - A Signed & Numbered 24 x 36" fine art archival print, exclusive to IndieGogo, of your photo of choice from a personal gallery of all images used in the book.  Each photo will include a personal message on the back from each of our photographers thanking you for your support!
If you're looking to combine multiple rewards, simply add up the total cost of the rewards you are interested in, contribute that custom amount, and we will contact you once the campaign has ended to verify your selections!

The largest risk will be in the way successfully photographing and documenting each trip, by way of human error or possible equipment failure.  We are doing everything we can to train and issue backup equipment and backup photographers for each trip to avoid such issues, and don't forsee them being an issue!  Each trip will present it's own unique challenges, whether it be from weather, equipment use, restrictions, travel difficulties and delays, and other circumstances out of our control, but we will have dedicated prayer teams and are confident God has a plan for us, allowing us to make the most of our opportunities!  

We absolutely understand if you aren't in a place to contribute financially, and even if you are, we would love your assistance in any of the following ways if possible!

  • Prayer:  Please pray for the regions we will be visiting, the missionaries we will be supporting, the photographers we will be sending and the ministries we will be bringing light to!
  • Sharing:  Please assist us in sharing this campaign (sharing tools up top), along with any of our website, facebook, instagram and twitter pages, and/or the MVMNT Missions website, facebook, instagram and twitter pages.  We hope to use each of these pages as both a way of keeping people informed, prayer requests and updates!
  • Sponsoring & Other Donations:  Interested in contributing photography related equipment, airline miles, or other possible needs we might have to help further our ministry or cut down on costs?  Please email us at info@7nationsummer.com with your message and we would love to hear from you!

We appreciate you taking the time just to hear about our project, and thank you in advance for anything you're willing to do to help further the ministry!  We will be providing updates along the way and looking forward to taking this journey together!

story:
Before picture– the camera I used when I was Younger

Short Summary

Hi, this is Jonny, when I was younger I always loved to play with my father's camera and thought to myself ... "maybe one day I will do something meaningful and creative with it." Years and years later I started doing Photoshop and photo restoration which I really love, but, I sill felt as a part of my creativity was missing.  I went to visit my father recently and we went on a family trip to Dumbarton Oaks in Washington DC. I  got a chance to play with the old camera again... like old times. I amplified the pictures in Photoshop because the camera was very old! and could not capture the colors/lighting very well. It inspired me to get serious about my passion for photography, and finally add "the missing" link into my skill set! It also got me thinking I could do video as well so that I can co-create a new business with my partner Niki, she does beauty makeup and helps people in spiritual transformations. She is going to be launching a new campaign soon that we are working on together! With your support, I would be able to realize my passion and create a business that would fulfill both me and my partners dream to inspire the world through our vision of love, light, and creativity together. If you would like to check-out the website I created for her and the pictures I retouched in her portfolio, please go to www.manavi-promakeup.com

What We Need & What You Get

I have researched the camera equipment and the lighting. The video equipment and accessories for the shoots I am looking to do will cost $5,000 or more. I am offering some perks for complementary Photoshop work for any business project, head shot, or creative shoot that you may need pictures for, I can make them look better and bring them to life– as a thank you gift. If I don't reach my exact goal I will still be more than happy to receive as much assistance as I can for my new business endeavor!

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate you spreading the word even if you are not able to assist me right now, I totally understand. I would be more than grateful if you can let others know about what I am doing. Thank you so much! Happy Thanksgiving in advance and have happy upcoming holidays! 

Love,

Jonny and Niki

MyWork


Before

After– My father Who inspired me not only in my interest in photography but also to explore the beauty of nature.

Before

After



Cover page i made for my partners website  www.manavi-promakeup.com

Before

After

I finally captured my first real full moon photograph using a real camera and not my cell phone lol. It was a real relief for me! Also, this was the first full moon on Christmas since 1977.

More Photos Soon...

story:
Who We Are and Where We Are Going

Just who are we and what are we doing here?

•Laura Isaac is an interdisciplinary visual artist living and working in Kansas City. With a background in printmaking she now uses installation, performance, digital imagery, drawing, and fibers to create her projects.

•Matt Hopper is a Kansas City native and accomplished jazz guitarist who has been active in Kansas City’s music-scene since he was 20 years old. He teaches guitar to K-12 students at Pembroke Hill and plays in multiple music projects. 

•Maritza Ruiz-Kim is an artist in the San Francisco Bay Area. By researching subject matter such as anthropology and technology, she examines underlying social themes using drawings, writing, painting, photography and video.

Where I Am is an extension of the collaborative project You Are #NotHere by Laura & Maritza. In the Springs of 2013 and 2014 Laura & Maritza explored various cities vicariously through the other. Their interactions and the experiences of the psychogeography of the locations were posted live to Twitter with photography and video works remaining as the evidence of the project.

The collaborative team of Isaac & Ruiz-Kim initially came together through Twitter in 2010. Since that time, our working relationship and personal friendship has deepened and our interactions have moved to more private forms of interaction: texting, phone calls, and letters. Where I Am follows this progression by taking the concepts of You Are #NotHere into a more private, personal, and analog experience.

The Project

In May of this year, Laura will be following her partner, Matt, to the cities of Porto Alegre and Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. Matt, will be teaching Brazilian musicians, music students, and local children Kansas City-style jazz in the traditions of Count Basie and Charlie Parker. He will also play in local music venues with Brazilian musicians blending Kansas City jazz standards, Matt’s original compositions, and Brazilian styles of music. Laura will record conversations with their Brazilian hosts, interviews with the local musicians, and the musical exchanges that Matt and the Brazilian musicians have. This music and snippets of the conversations will be compiled into an audio CD. 

Each day over the course of our two weeks in Brazil, Laura will open a handwritten letter from Maritza which will share personal stories and guide her into exploring various aspects of her experience; exploring the displacement of her hometown into this new-to-her setting and culture. Does the familiar still feel comforting and familiar when it is out-of-context? Laura will document the experience through photography, video, and personal essays while creating original handmade collage works capturing the sights and sounds of following her heart to another continent.

Tying long-distance friendship, the displacement of culture, and travel-with-a-romantic-partner together into an introspective on-the-move residency, Where I Am will challenge Laura and Matt to create deeply personal work that hones-in on what it means to be from Kansas City.

What We Need & What's In It For You

Taking this project international and recording a live album is no small task. Our hosts in Brazil are helping us with what they can, but the costs of travel to Brazil, recording, and CD production still leave us with quite a bit of funding to cover. We’ve set a minimum funding goal of $4450 in order to really make this project happen. But we have an IDEAL goal of $6500 which would allow us to realize an even better CD package packed with photos and stories, but more exciting than that… we would be able to bring one of our Brazilian hosts, guitarist Antonio Flores, back to Kansas City to give a special concert with Matt! This would be AMAZING!

We know that when you back someone’s work, it’s making a strong statement of faith in what we do. We take that show of support very seriously. We’ve come up with some special incentive packages for you for helping us realize this project! (Including an evening playing tunes and sipping yerba mate with us out of traditional calabash mugs we will bring back for you from Brazil!)

Risks & Challenges

Although Laura and Maritza have done their You Are #NotHere project in Kansas City, San Francisco, St. Louis, and Oakland… taking it international and to Brazil is a big step. And while Matt is no stranger to playing and recording music, having performed on multiple albums and produced his own album, recording the live sessions in Brazil while on the move will be a unique challenge. Thankfully, we like to overthink things and plan ahead:

•Technology. Well we certainly have the technology but having it all work on-the-move in Porto Alegre and Rio? We’re doing our research and getting all of Laura’s tech equipment set up with backups, extra storage, and all the necessary international adaptions. We’re stopping just short of making Laura herself bionic. (Although we haven’t entirely ruled that out.)

•Lost. We will fully admit it. We are Americans and we will be lost in Brazil… at least we would be IF we didn’t have amazing hosts there who will be with us every step of the way. We won’t be tourists; our team is taking us into their schools, homes, and lives.

•Ambition. Yeah, we know this is a really big undertaking. Art and travel and recording and producing a CD… what can we say, we like to do ALL THE THINGS. But if you look at our individual track records, we find ways to make it happen. This is a huge opportunity for us to create great art, deepen our study of Brazilian music, and share Kansas City with a special corner of the world. 

Other Ways To Help

Share our project with your friends. Follow our journey on our social media feeds. Help us connect with anyone you know who would be interested in this Kansas City/Brazil arts & music cultural exchange. The greater the circle of friends… the closer home will feel, even when we are far away. Obrigada!

story:
Short Summary

I'm seeking your help to fund a photography book showcasing the life work of an Estonian photographer Arnold Karl Rammo.

When Arnold passed away in 1999 he left me, his grandson, a huge collection of photo negatives. I estimate there is more than 150 000 photos shot between 1955 - 1993. 

The photos picture Estonian life during the cold war behind the Iron Curtain. There are portraits, cityscapes, landscapes, machinery, art, everyday life, events etc. on these photos.

Arnold was a punctual man so all the negatives are well preserved and indexed. I know exactly when they were taken and what are on the photos. 
So far I have managed to digitalise about 15000 of them.

Where your donation will go

Your generous contribution will go a long way to covering the expenses of printing the book and large prints for the exhibition. A breakdown of the expected costs is below.

  • Book design €400
  • Book printing €3400
  • Postcards €300
  • Posters €300
  • Exhibition prints €2100
Total: €6500

What you'll get

I've put together a list of thank you items to acknowledge the generosity of those who contribute. These perks range from a postcard, poster and framed prints of various sizes and a copy of the book.
Whatever your contribution, it will be greatly appreciated.

By pre-purchasing a copy of the book, with your permission, your name will be printed on a list at the back of the book as  a contributor to this publication.

The Impact

The communist times were fascinating in Estonia. Trying to build something so grand by throwing away your paradigms is an effort to recognise. On these photos we can see how it all turned out.  As Soviet Union was a rather closed country, these photos might reveal something never before seen in the western world.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not in a position to contribute, no worries. There are other ways you can help such as:

  • Sharing this campaign with your social networks using the share tools
  • Brainstorm further ideas, what to do with the photos
  • Introduce me to people who might find these photos interesting
  • Following @arnoldrammo on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter

story:
Hello, everyone!

I`m Maryna ( Merien Morey is my artist name ) based in Kyiv, Ukraine. 

20 years old and completely devoted to photography, I've been dreaming about my first photo exhibition, which is to be held on the 4th of December in my lovely hometown Kiyv. 


Photography is my passion from childhood and now I am ready to share this passion with the others! 

This photo exhibition is a chance to show results of my work that I gave my soul. It will be the first serious step in my career of a photographer, so I`ve been working on ideas for this project for a long period of time. 


Ballet became a source of inspiration for me and I want you to feel it as well. 
When I first time came to this place http://artprichal.org understood that it was the location of my dream and my photo exhibition should take part exactly in this place! 


2 000 dollars (900$ - printing expenses, 1100 $ -rental) in total will help me to realize this project. And I truly believe that you can help me! 

For 1 $ (a price of a cup of coffee in Kyiv), I'll write your name next to the entrance to the exhibition hall. 

My original postcard for every 20$.
Printed photo for every 100$.

Click here  to see some of my photos  
You're more than welcome to contact me via Facebook, I'm always happy to answer your questions! Click here  to do so.

Great dancers are not great because of their techniques, they are GREAT because of their PASSION! Not their movements, but their great passion - that's what I want to express on my photos.

story:
{deutsche Version des Textes siehe unten}

Hi!

my name is Eva-Marlene, I’m a freelance photographer from Munich and focus my work on conceptual fashion-photography. Although fashion photography essentially strives to show and sell products, my work intends to reveal my subject’s raw humanity.

"Menschen, die behaupten sich zu lieben #36/4" This image from series four of the project has been awarded with the “upcoming masters” award held by the Deutsche Gesellschaft für Photographie (DGfP) in cooperation with the Leica Kamera AG and was shown at the photokina 2016. (hair, make-up and flower-magic by Sarah Schwickart http://sarahschwickart.com)

What is love?

Three years ago my heart was broken. This was nothing new to me at the time, I was an expert of being heart-broken, but still that time it was different. I didn’t want to wallow in my own self-pity or drink my feelings away (ok, maybe at first…), but then I needed to express my pain differently. I started to analyze, talk, think, read about the subject, not only about heartbreak or rejection, but about understanding and love. I became almost obsessed and started to create first little visual tests. I shot nude portraits of my male friends, I gave friends in relationships disposable cameras to shoot each other and I created a found footage photo book based on the personal archive of my grandparents.

But then I wanted to imagine a broader project with this theme. I wanted to create my own picture of love, but how? How do you show this feeling of all feelings in a motionless picture, how can you capture that moment? Well, I gotta tell ya, you really can’t. So I decided I wouldn’t. I wouldn’t try to take THAT picture, I would take many pictures and tell stories, create moments and possibilities. Show the ugliness, the hurt, but also the beauty and strength it gives.

"Menschen, die behaupten sich zu lieben #14/2" (set-design by Franz Töricht, selected outfits and home accessories hej store Dortmund)

So I did and I did with the help of many great people that I love! First there was William whose plays really gave me the essential inspirations for my characters and then there was Roland whose way of thinking gave me the courage to get real and create something imperfect and honest (I’m talking about William Shakespeare and Roland Barthes).

And then I fell in love. I randomly and miraculously met a person from the other side of the world, in a country at the other end of Europe. And all of a sudden I stopped thinking about love and just lived it, in the project and my personal life. So heartbreak may have born the project, but love encouraged the realization. 

"Menschen, die behaupten sich zu lieben #22/3" (fashion by Mario Keine)

Menschen, die behaupten sich zu lieben

people that claim to love one another

Nowadays we are overwhelmed with pictures of love, but they are mostly vapid and shallow realties created by a self-conscious social media society combined with the never sad faces from the advertising world. I tried to create in fact fictitious but at the same time lively and honest characters that you can relate to, that you can find parts of in yourself. I question reality and authenticity of a feeling which construction is as omnipresent as ever and accept it in all its sincerity and absurdity.

With the indispensable help of an army of talented, sharp and generous contributors I was lucky enough to create a body of work that makes me proud. A book containing seven stories, 14 protagonists and a total of 62 pictures was developed. But these characters were only able to completely come to life because of Sibylla who wrote new brilliant dialogs between the personalities and made them whole in their own reality. And where would I be without Sarah who not only, helped me to make a total of six protagonists shine through her talent for looks, but in the end gave her own body to be captured by the camera. I would love to name everybody here, but I will just say, there were incredible fashion designers, make-up artists, stylists, set designers, fellow photographers, filmmakers and fearless (by the way mostly non-professional) models that made the project possible. Apart from the still pictures I developed a video short containing nine episodes. I will publish approximately two of the episodes online during this campaign, but the rest will only be shown at the exhibition and sent out exclusively with the artist edition of the book.

"Menschen, die behaupten sich zu lieben #54/7"

I need you!

But my pride and joy is the oversized hand-bound artist edition of the book in a format of 289 x 380mm (11.38 x 14.96 inches), with a silver clad hard cover, sliver endpaper and a total of 104 pages. Because of the big format the stories are especially tangible and combined with the witty and creative dialogs the flipping through the book becomes an experience. The images develop an independent force while the texts create concentrated insights in emotional worlds through extreme reduction and the open layout leaves room for inner pictures. The book is limited to 25 copies, dated and signed. Although the original language is German, I will develop an English translation that can capture Sibylla’s whit and unique style so my international supporters can enjoy the dialogs. 

"Menschen, die behaupten sich zu lieben" limited artist edition; page 70/71; styling by Anne Wencelides, make-up/hair by Lucille Rohmer

I also created a more imperfect and nostalgia-inspired newspaper edition that can’t reach the quality of the book but still contains all the content and is desirable in its fragility. Finally, I designed a DIN-A3 (11.69 x 16.54 inches) infinite calendar that can carry 13 selected images of the project on your wall forever and a 5-piece postcard collectors-set. The first public exhibition is planned for the 4th of April, 2017 in Munich, a poster and a flyer will be produced.

With this campaign I hope to finance the production of the artist edition and the gifts, as well as the exhibition that all supporters are warmly invited to. Right after the end of this fundraising I will go into production and send out the gifts or hand them over with a big hug at the vernissage. 

"Menschen, die behaupten sich zu lieben" limited artist edition; page 18/19, dialogs by Sibylla Hirschhäuser

Spread the love!

Thank you so much for reading and showing interest in my project! Feel free to ask any questions, if you want to know more. And if you want to make me especially happy, please tell your friends and even your enemies about my project, write about it on social media or create a blog article! Share it on Facebook, Twitter or Instagram - spread the love! If you want to see more of my work just visit my website: www.eva-marlene.com  

"Menschen, die behaupten sich zu lieben #51/6" + still from video Kleo & Toni

I love you, bye.

 

Hi,

mein Name ist Eva-Marlene, ich bin freie Fotografin (M.A.) und lebe in München. Mein professioneller Schwerpunkt liegt auf konzeptioneller Modefotografie. Obwohl Modefotografie meist im Grunde ein Produkt abbilden soll, möchte ich in meiner Arbeit stets den Menschen in den Vordergrund stellen.

Täglich erleben wir Inszenierungen der Liebe. In den Medien kursieren Unmengen an gespielten Bildern glücklich verliebter Menschen. Soziale Netzwerke sind voll davon, die Werbung malt das Bild noch schöner. Ist das die Wirklichkeit, sieht Liebe so aus? Einerseits ist die Liebe das höchste Gut... andererseits scheint sie niemand tatsächlich zu thematisieren. Reichen uns diese Stereotype? Geben wir uns damit zufrieden?

In meiner Arbeit beschäftige ich mich mit romantischer Liebe als allmächtiges, aber ungreifbares Gefühl zwischen zwei Menschen. Ich thematisiere dabei den Blick der Liebenden aufeinander, auf sich selbst und auf die Beziehung von außen. Ich hinterfrage Realität und Authentizität eines Gefühls, dessen Inszenierung allgegenwärtig ist und erkenne sie in ihrer ganzen Ernsthaftigkeit und Naivität an.

Es sind sieben Strecken mit 14 Protagonisten und insgesamt 62 Einzelbildern entstanden, die verschiedene Beziehungsstrukturen oder mögliche Momente zwischen zwei Liebenden darstellen. Die Strecken werden mit Dialogen von Sibylla Hirschhäuser kombiniert. Der visuellen Inszenierung dienten Paare aus Theaterstücken von William Shakespeares als Inspirationsvorlage. Das Projekt wurde tatsächlich erst durch die zahlreichen talentierten Modedesigner, Make-Up Artisten, Stylisten, Set-Designer, Filmer, Models und vielen weiteren Unterstützern möglich gemacht! Begleitend habe ich einen Film entwickelt, der aus neun Episoden besteht.

Die konzeptionelle Arbeit erscheint in einem handgebundenen, großformatigen Hardcover-Buch (Umschlag 3mm Karton, aufkaschiertes Silberpapier, 104 Innenseiten) im Format 289 x 380 mm. Die Auflage ist limitiert und handsigniert, das Buch erscheint in deutscher Sprache. Musterbücher sind erstellt (siehe Bilder), unmittelbar nach Abschluss des Crowdfunding gehen wir im Eigenverlag in Produktion. Eine Ausstellung der Arbeit wird am 4. April 2017 in München eröffnet.

Hochwertige Bücher wie diese werden aufgrund der hohen Kosten selten produziert. Das große Format macht die künstlerische Arbeit für den Betrachter besonders erlebbar. Die Motive entfalten ganz eigenständige Wirkung, die Texte werfen durch ihre extreme Reduktion starke, nachhaltige Schlaglichter auf private Gefühlswelten und das offene Layout bietet Freiräume für innere Bilder.

Mit eurer Hilfe soll sowohl der sehr aufwendige Buchdruck finanziert werden, als auch die Ausstellung und Geschenke, die ich als Dankeschön in dieser Kampagne anbiete. Ihr könnt mir auch durch die Verbreitung der Kampagne durch E-Mail, Facebook, Twitter und Instagram weiterhelfen, oder indem ihr einfach euren Freunden davon erzählt! Mehr Infos zu mir finden Sie auf meiner Website: www.eva-marlene.com

Danke!

story:
This year I was able to publish my first photobook, titled El Mal.

This book is about a strange but deadly disease known as Huntington's disease or Mal de San Vito. In my country Venezuela specifically in the town of Barranquitas in the state Zulia, is the greatest genetic focus of the disease in the world.

Is a hard work on part of the reality of my country, it is a story that deserved  to be told.

After a great effort this photographic essay became book, thanks to the editorial RM and the fusion of two small publishers Mal de Ojo and Ecléctica.

In November will be the presentation of the book at the Paris Photo festival and a have a invitation to present my book in London. 

Unfortunately, I do not have the capital to cover the costs of airline tickets and accommodation.

That is why I appeal to you to try to raise the capital I need.

 

 

Este año se publicó mi primer fotolibro, titulado El Mal.

Este libro trata sobre una extraña pero letal enfermedad que se conoce con el nombre de la enfermedad de Huntington o Mal de San Vito.

En mi país Venezuela específicamente en el pueblo de Barranquitas en el estado Zulia, se encuentra el mayor foco genético de la enfermedad en el mundo.

Es un duro trabajo sobre parte de la realidad de mi país, es una historia que merecia  ser contada. 

Después de un gran esfuerzo de este ensayo fotográfico se convirtió en libro, gracias a la editorial RM y la fusión de dos pequeñas editoriales Mal de Ojo y Ecléctica.

En noviembre se hará la presentación del libro en el festival Paris Photo, también tengo una invitación para presentar el libro en  Londres. 

Lamentablemente no dispongo del capital necesario para cubrir los costos de los billetes de avión y alojamiento.

Por eso recurro a ustedes para intentar recaudar el capital que necesito.

story:
Short Summary

If you watched the video before moving down the page to these words, you may be wondering what an interview with brothers in the jungle of Peru has to do with helping orphans in Iraq.

In 2012, I went to the Amazon jungle with Selva in Action, an American-Peruvian medical organization, and photographed their medical clinic in the jungle. Some of these images can be seen at this link. Additionally, I have an ongoing personal project about what it is like to be a teen around the world - click to visit this project site.

One organization I am currently volunteering for, the Alalusi Foundation, has invited me to accompany them to Iraqi Kurdistan in order to document their work with orphans. At this time, it is estimated that we will depart in late October 2017. This Indiegogo fundraiser is to ensure that I can fulfill my commitment to Hesham Alalusi and the many individuals who work very hard to provide for the care of now over 1,500 children orphaned by events - both violent and economic - in Iraq.

Now about the program that I will support with my photography in October:

Our signature program, the Iraq Orphans Project (IOP) works within – not against – cultural and religious norms for a working solution to one of Iraqs’ most intractable problems – an estimated 2.5 to 5 million orphans. Instead of adoptions or orphanages – frowned-upon last resorts – the Foundation supports families who have taken on the responsibility of caring for the children of deceased loved ones. Food, medicine, and material support reach the families through a network of on-the-ground distribution and validation partners, including three of the oldest and most respected charitable organizations in Iraq. Through them and others, we are supporting over 1,500 orphans (with one-year sponsorships) in locations from Mosul to Basrah, the Orphans’ Khayrat al-Mosul Village, the Dar Al Amin Iraqi Safe House for Orphans in Sadr City, and individual families of widows and orphaned girls.

If you've done this before, why have a crowdfunding campaign?

In 2009 I purchased my camera - the first generation Canon 5D - and I bought it second hand. In the eight years since, this workhorse has taken many wonderful images, but it also has shown its limitations and now is showing its age. To continue photographing for such organizations as the Valentino Achak Deng Foundation and Alalusi Foundation, it is time to repair and replace some of my gear.

So, to answer that question, with your support I will be able to create more films, like the one above, highlighting not just the problems that NGOs work to alleviate every day, but the people behind their work.

The results of my documentation work will be put on the Alalusi Foundation website both in still and video form. In addition to documenting the work of the foundation, I intend to interview some of the youth touched by the foundation's generosity so that we can  bring their struggles and hopes to a wide audience. 

The output of this crowdfunding will not end with Alalusi, but continue on with other organizations I work with currently, and ones that I plan to build a relationship with.

 

What I Need

Where will the money go?

  • Canon 5D Mark III - This is not the newest generation, but is two generations better than the one I currently use. - $2,500
  • Audio Recorder - While the 5D will replace my 11 year old video camera, but when filming a separate audio recorder is needed to ensure quality sound. - $250

  • Microphone - $250

 

Impact

Everyone has heard the expression, "A picture is worth a thousand words." In the NGO community, usually only the very big have the capacity to create professional quality visual documentation of the work they do, while smaller organizations often lack the resources to invest in it.

Volunteering to accompany and document NGO work is a valuable asset to the organizations and to the people they serve. With images I create, descriptions of their services come alive in the minds of potential donors, be they foundations or individuals. Photo and video productions have been shown to increase giving, allowing foundations to do more in their target communities.

 

What You Get

What you get are great perks including original prints from my art portfolio. Drop by TSP to see what you can get a copy of. Start off in the Shop and then mosey over to the Portfolio section. Pretty much any photo on my site is available to receive as a perk. Experiencing option paralysis? Let me know what you are interested in and I will propose some options.

 

Risks & Challenges

What happens if I don't make the goal before the Iraq trip?

I have committed to going and still will despite the result of this fundraiser. I simply will be forced to do less than I hoped for as my current equipment is not up to the task due to age and quality.

I see in the news reports about conflict between the government of Iraq and Iraqi Kurdistan. What happens if the trip to Erbil is cancelled due to instability?

This is unlikely. But, if the foundation cancels their aid trip to the capital of Iraqi Kurdistan, they will divert their attention to other projects they have in the works and I will accompany them. This crowdfunding is not just for this one trip, but for many volunteer opportunities into the future where solid dependable photo equipment is needed. I will update on this page any changes to my plans as well as additions in the future.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute funds, that doesn't mean you can't help. You can still use Indiegogo’s share tools to get the work out!

Thank you for reading this far. I hope you will help me get the proper equipment so that I can continue supporting the work of great humanitarian organizations!
story_txt:
Short Summary
If you watched the video before moving down the page to these words, you may be wondering what an interview with brothers in the jungle of Peru has to do with helping orphans in Iraq.
In 2012, I went to the Amazon jungle with Selva in Action, an American-Peruvian medical organization, and photographed their medical clinic in the jungle. Some of these images can be seen at this link. Additionally, I have an ongoing personal project about what it is like to be a teen around the world - click to visit this project site.
One organization I am currently volunteering for, the Alalusi Foundation, has invited me to accompany them to Iraqi Kurdistan in order to document their work with orphans. At this time, it is estimated that we will depart in late October 2017. This Indiegogo fundraiser is to ensure that I can fulfill my commitment to Hesham Alalusi and the many individuals who work very hard to provide for the care of now over 1,500 children orphaned by events - both violent and economic - in Iraq.
Now about the program that I will support with my photography in October:
Our signature program, the Iraq Orphans Project (IOP) works within – not against – cultural and religious norms for a working solution to one of Iraqs’ most intractable problems – an estimated 2.5 to 5 million orphans. Instead of adoptions or orphanages – frowned-upon last resorts – the Foundation supports families who have taken on the responsibility of caring for the children of deceased loved ones. Food, medicine, and material support reach the families through a network of on-the-ground distribution and validation partners, including three of the oldest and most respected charitable organizations in Iraq. Through them and others, we are supporting over 1,500 orphans (with one-year sponsorships) in locations from Mosul to Basrah, the Orphans’ Khayrat al-Mosul Village, the Dar Al Amin Iraqi Safe House for Orphans in Sadr City, and individual families of widows and orphaned girls.
If you've done this before, why have a crowdfunding campaign?
In 2009 I purchased my camera - the first generation Canon 5D - and I bought it second hand. In the eight years since, this workhorse has taken many wonderful images, but it also has shown its limitations and now is showing its age. To continue photographing for such organizations as the Valentino Achak Deng Foundation and Alalusi Foundation, it is time to repair and replace some of my gear.
So, to answer that question, with your support I will be able to create more films, like the one above, highlighting not just the problems that NGOs work to alleviate every day, but the people behind their work.
The results of my documentation work will be put on the Alalusi Foundation website both in still and video form. In addition to documenting the work of the foundation, I intend to interview some of the youth touched by the foundation's generosity so that we can  bring their struggles and hopes to a wide audience. 
The output of this crowdfunding will not end with Alalusi, but continue on with other organizations I work with currently, and ones that I plan to build a relationship with.

 
What I Need
Where will the money go?

Canon 5D Mark III - This is not the newest generation, but is two generations better than the one I currently use. - $2,500
Audio Recorder - While the 5D will replace my 11 year old video camera, but when filming a separate audio recorder is needed to ensure quality sound. - $250

Microphone - $250


 
Impact
Everyone has heard the expression, "A picture is worth a thousand words." In the NGO community, usually only the very big have the capacity to create professional quality visual documentation of the work they do, while smaller organizations often lack the resources to invest in it.
Volunteering to accompany and document NGO work is a valuable asset to the organizations and to the people they serve. With images I create, descriptions of their services come alive in the minds of potential donors, be they foundations or individuals. Photo and video productions have been shown to increase giving, allowing foundations to do more in their target communities.
 
What You Get
What you get are great perks including original prints from my art portfolio. Drop by TSP to see what you can get a copy of. Start off in the Shop and then mosey over to the Portfolio section. Pretty much any photo on my site is available to receive as a perk. Experiencing option paralysis? Let me know what you are interested in and I will propose some options.

 
Risks & Challenges
What happens if I don't make the goal before the Iraq trip?
I have committed to going and still will despite the result of this fundraiser. I simply will be forced to do less than I hoped for as my current equipment is not up to the task due to age and quality.
I see in the news reports about conflict between the government of Iraq and Iraqi Kurdistan. What happens if the trip to Erbil is cancelled due to instability?
This is unlikely. But, if the foundation cancels their aid trip to the capital of Iraqi Kurdistan, they will divert their attention to other projects they have in the works and I will accompany them. This crowdfunding is not just for this one trip, but for many volunteer opportunities into the future where solid dependable photo equipment is needed. I will update on this page any changes to my plans as well as additions in the future.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute funds, that doesn't mean you can't help. You can still use Indiegogo’s share tools to get the work out!
Thank you for reading this far. I hope you will help me get the proper equipment so that I can continue supporting the work of great humanitarian organizations!

story:
Summary

Hello my name is Sylvester Finch and I am a NYC photographer and creative. This campaign was started to help support my work trip to Cameroon, Africa. I started out my independent journey in photography in 2015 and be using the equipment I gained along the way. However for this next adventure in my life, I am heading on a month long trip to Cameroon, Africa for behind the scenes photography on an upcoming film.

I am looking to use funds raised in this campaign to support me getting more equipment to better facilitate this trip. I am also planing on getting involved with the community of Cameroon to see how I can give back to a community that's welcoming me.

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for four-thousands dollars to aide this campaign. Some of the items I'm looking to pick up for this trip are a steady cam for DSLR camera, external hard-drives, memory cards, a new lens, & additional chargers, just to name a few. Some of the perks I have create for this campaign include ending video project special mention, signed prints with thank you message, souvenirs from Cameroon, and producer credit to name a few. In the event I am unable to reach my entire goal funds will go to purchasing as much of the equipment listed above as possible. Like memory cards which are very important for this trip.

The Impact

Your contribution to this campaign is valuable because you will be supporting a young entrepreneur first big project ever! The success of this campaign will allow me to better create a platform for myself whereas I can pay it forward to help other crafts for people. It is also important as it will enable people to have a different look at another country in Africa. I am hoping the impact made during this trip will turn into aide the country of Cameroon and its future endeavors. .

My time in photography profession is young but I feel this is the first step to really establishing myself in this field. This opportunity does not come about everyday and I do not want to waste it. I'm truly just a guy who realize he wanted more out of life than a 9 to 5 for 60 years until I retire. I want a life full of passion, purpose, people, and excitement. I'm taking a chance on life and hoping you will take a chance on me.

Challenges

The fact that I am first in my family to have been given this opportunity truly makes me want to succeed. I want to show my loved ones, friends, peers, and strangers that if you truly give something your all you can make it happen. The invitation alone to Cameroon, Africa is something I will always celebrate for the rest of my life. Now its time to "Do The Work!"

Other Ways You Can Help

While I hope you can donate and get behind this project I am fully aware that not everyone can. In those cases I hope you are at least inspired to share this campaign to get the message out. I would also love to hear you folks story too in case there is someway I can also help you in return in the future.

Remember to use Indiegogo sharing tools

story:
Short Summary

I've been dabbling in nature photography for as long as I can remember.
I remember vividly once as a child telling someone that my goal was to one day be skilled enough to take beautiful pictures of birds, I was told that birds are too difficult and that I should try for something easier... I think that's why my birds shots are the ones I am the most proud of.
Though I don't think I would ever photograph birds exclusively, that is my main focus.

The goal of this campaign is to build a foundation from which I can expand my photographic pursuits.

What's a home without art?
Who says fine art has to cater exclusively to  the rich?
I will strive to provide affordable pieces of scenery for any household.

By supporting an independent photographer like myself  you will brighten your life and home with natural scenes of beauty while helping me get on my feet as an artist.

What We Need & What You Get

All money donated to this project will go specifically towards funding prints to sell in galleries, art spaces, and online; making calendars for 2018 (which are available here as well). And to expand my portfolio for future projects.

For each contribution level there are different, sometimes themed, perks available.
These perks correlate with images in the "Photography Start-up Selection" photo album on the Stevie Drayson Photography page on Facebook that you can use for reference on the items with multiple options.
With the holidays coming up, these would also make great gifts for your friends and family!

The perks will be shipped out in batches as stock is made available throughout the campaign. the campaign ends Dec. 4 therefore the absolute final day anything will be shipped out will be Dec. 5. If you are planning to give away your perks as a gift, please keep this in mind.

The Impact

By supporting this project you will be helping promote 'art for the every-man,' affordable art made on my own terms for anyone, not just expensive galleries or the artistic elite. You'll be supporting an independent artist with a different perspective and be able to engage with art that has a focus on the everyday beauty of the natural world around us that some may forget to have noticed otherwise (though this specific project has a bit more of a worldly focus than usual)

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign on your social media!! (and with your friends IRL)

Follow:
Facebook.com/steviedraysonphoto

Contact:
steviedraysonphoto@outlook.com
