story:
A Thousand Moments

What I seek is not a scoop, but an ordinary and beautiful moment of life.

 

Travel by train, Nanu Oya, Sri Lanka.

 

Hello! I am Julie Mayfeng, a Korean-born photographer living in Seoul, South Korea. I have been traveling and taking photographs for more than 15 years, have visited about 60 countries. 

 

Blue house, Jodhpur, India.

 

I take pictures of big and small moments of life that I encounter while traveling. Those moments are sometimes ecstatic, sometimes mysterious, sometimes warm, sometimes sweet, and sometimes solitary. My heart trembles when I find a glittering moment in the ordinary life. It keeps me on the road and that's what I want to share with you.

 

Cheese factory, Varanasi, India.

 

10 years, 1000 moments

 

To meet a beautiful moment in life and to photograph it, it is a task that I have long wished for and been practicing. I started this project in 2009. I plan to create a book tentatively entitled A THOUSAND MOMENTS (hardcover book, hope to be published in 2020, after my journey) that will have a total of 10 years of work. It is not enough to make a book yet. So I need your help and support. 

 

Gateway of India, Mumbai, India.

 

Life is a sequence of moments. I do not know what moments will be unfolding before me, and what moments I will photograph. So I'm more excited, and that's the charm of this project. 

 

Lake Phewa, Pokhara, Nepal.

 

About my previous journey

 

Starting in India and Nepal in 2009, I have traveled the third world countries such as Israel, Palestine, Jordan, Burma, Laos, Cambodia, Vietnam, Sri Lanka, Indonesia, Malaysia etc. I am interested in the disappearing scenery. The world is rapidly changing and modernizing so that we can not remember yesterday. I am so sad with it. Sometimes I felt hopeless and a lot of doubts about life. That's why I am visiting less civilized and old-fashioned places. When I travel around such places, I can meet what I've missed. And I can see what we have lost and what we need to recover and preserve. I am afraid that everything will disappear if I am a little late. I am also afraid that we can see these beautiful moments only in photographs in the future.

 

Monks’ luncheon, Mandalay, Burma.

School rickshaw, New Delhi, India.

Stilt-fishermen, Weligama, Sri Lanka.

Monsoon, Kolkata, India. 

 

Plan for the next journey

 

To collect enough images for publishing the book, I have to travel around one more year or longer. So I really need your support and help to do this journey. 

 

Church of the Holy Sepulchre, Jerusalem, Israel.

Taj Mahal, Agra, India.

 

I plan to visit Asia, Africa, East Europe and South America in 2018~2019. I will visit mainly the third world countries such as India, Iran, Pakistan, Cuba, Peru, Tibet, Morocco, Egypt, Mongolia etc. Please recommend me a country or a region that you want me to take photos. I will reflect your opinions on my route.

 

Arabian Bakery, Jerusalem, Israel.

 

Costs for continuing project

 

The financial part has always been a stumbling block. Until now, I have done with my small savings. I usually travel to shoot once or twice a year depending on budget and time. Even though I am a budget traveler, it is not cheap to do photographic journey around the world for a whole year. To complete this project for 1 year, it takes about US$ 37,000 at least. For 2 years, it would cost twice as much as that. My budget for the project is as follows: 

 

 

I will need about 15-25 plane tickets including long & short distance. Also I will need ground & marine transportation, accommodation and food. Besides, it has to cover insurances, visa fees and unexpected expenses.

 

Sandstorm, Thar Desert, India.

 

Sometimes I will need a fixer or a guide, and need to donate to the community or people. And I have to prepare my photo gear such as external hard drives and two secondhand cameras (the same one I have) for emergency and one DSLR for filming the long journey. And little part of my budget has to cover the productions of the perks, Indiegogo fee and bank charges too. 

 

Ebony eyes, Agra, India.

Holy bath, Amritsar, India.

 

Impact of the project: selection of media outlets that published my photos and stories

 

My photos and stories have been featured in major publications of the world including CNN and NATIONAL GEOGRAPHIC. I would like to create a touching story once again with your support.

 

 

Risks and challenges

 

I had many difficult moments while traveling. I have struggled with heavy backpack, hard work, tight schedule, bedbugs, flu, food poisoning, sexual harassment etc. But I would like to do it again with hope. Based on my past experiences, I will be more confident to keep my journey moving forward to new countries and will do my best in cooperation with you. 

 

Horsemen at Bromo, Java, Indonesia.

Sleeper class, Jhansi, India.

Woman praying, Udaipur, India.

 

Rewards for your contribution

 

Any contribution will help me. Also support me by sharing my story with your friends.

 

Going home, Bandar Lampung, Sumatra, Indonesia.

Ready to go to school, Hampi, India.

 

For 2, 5, 10 USD, ​you will received a 'THANK YOU' e-mail in a few days.

For 30 USD, a copy of e-book by e-mail in a few days. It contains about 230 pages of photos and stories from my previous journey.

For 60 USD, a copy of e-book by e-mail in a few days, a postcard during my journey.  

For 100 USD, a copy of e-book by e-mail in a few days, a postcard during my journey. And your name will be written on the first edition of ‘A Thousand Moments’.  

 

On the mount of Olives, Jerusalem, Israel.

 

For 200 USD, a copy of e-book, a postcard and your name will be written on the first edition of the book(the hardcover book that will be published in 2020, after my journey). Besides, 1 signed premium print <Monsoon>. (Limited Edition of 100, 12x18)  

For 300 USD, a copy of e-book, a postcard and your name will be written on the first edition of the book(the hardcover book that will be published in 2020, after my journey). Besides, 1 signed book and 1 signed premium print <Monsoon>. (Limited Edition of 100, 12x18)  

 

Indian Coffee House, Shimla, India.

Girl in the class, Padang, Sumatra, Indonesia.

Watch out, Angkor Wat, Cambodia.

 

For 600 USD, a copy of e-book, a postcard and your name will be written on the first edition of the book(the hardcover book that will be published in 2020, after my journey). Besides, 1 signed book and 3 signed premium prints ; <Monsoon> & 2 any photos you want. (Limited Edition of 100, 12x18) 

 

Bookstore, Shimla, India.

 

For 1,000 USD, a copy of e-book, a postcard and your name will be written on the first edition of the book(the hardcover book that will be published in 2020, after my journey). Besides, 1 signed book and 3 signed premium prints ; <Monsoon> & 2 any photos you want. (Limited Edition of 30, 16x24) 

 

Elder sister, Lake Toba, Sumatra, Indonesia.

The end of land, Ayeyarwady River, Burma.

Chicken for sale, Kathmandu, Nepal.

Misty night, Sapa, Viet Nam.

Tea gardens at night, Darjeeling, India.

 

Even though I have been on this photo journey for 8 years, but it's still hard, uneasy and lonely. Of course it's my favorite job, but now I think I need more power. I hope to share you more beautiful moments of the world. 

 

Going home, Lake Inle, Burma.

 

Thank you very much for your support!

Chicken for sale, Kathmandu, Nepal.

Misty night, Sapa, Viet Nam.

Tea gardens at night, Darjeeling, India.
 
Even though I have been on this photo journey for 8 years, but it's still hard, uneasy and lonely. Of course it's my favorite job, but now I think I need more power. I hope to share you more beautiful moments of the world. 
 

Going home, Lake Inle, Burma.
 
Thank you very much for your support!

story:
Those of us who have been sexually assaulted often have out-of-body experiences.  The violence we have gone through leaves us feeling disconnected with a lack of autonomy over our physical selves. To symbolize this sense of physical alienation, participants in A Serpent’s Voice are coated in 3 layers of liquid latex representing the abuse and pain that each participant has carried for years. It is a painful yet cathartic process to rip off this dead layer as an act of reconciliation and reconnection with our bodies. These photos capture a moment of reflection and empowerment as we choose to peel away the damage in our pasts. When it is presented in gallery settings this photo series will be accompanied by audio of participants telling their stories and jars containing the latex “skin” they removed.

https://www.serpentsvoice.com/

We are Alexandra Dietz and Heather Ross.  Alexandra is an award-winning documentary photographer, Fulbright Scholar, and survivor who has traveled to over thirty countries documenting the fallout of sexual violence.  Heather Ross is a highly involved activist, a product manager for a game company, and survivor who learned to find catharsis through various forms of art.

Contributors will help us cover the cost of the expenses for making this series and getting it into galleries for people to experience firsthand.  The more we raise the more we will be able to do and the more lives we will be able to touch.  If you want to impact change through art, contribute. 

We are asking for $5,000 to cover the costs of latex, photo editing, audio editing, film editing, research, gallery submissions, gallery-quality prints, and travel. The latex needed to create this series is a significant expense, with the materials costing approximately $100 per shoot (this does not include time and costs of editing or printing). The more we raise, the more participants we can afford to include and the more stories will be heard.  A portion of print sales will go to The Kind Clinic PrEP program who enthusiastically supports A Serpent's Voice.  The Kind Clinic is a full-service sexual health and wellness clinic dedicated to the treatment and prevention of sexually transmitted infections, including access to the HIV prevention drugs commonly known as PrEP and PEP.  Kind Clinic is dedicated to providing state-of-the-art sexual health and wellness services to all members of the LGBTQ community and allies, regardless of race, creed, gender or sexual orientation. https://kindclinic.org/

If we don't reach our full goal, the funds will be used to cover the expenses we have already incurred, and to continue making the series to the extent possible depending on the amount raised while we look for other funding options.

 

The Impact

A Serpent’s Voice prints are potent images of confronting the past and choosing your future self. With a print of your own, you’ll be reminded of the power of healing and renewal, as well as your part of making this project happen.

Have dinner with us and get to know us better! We would love to share our experiences with you, learn about you and why you’ve chosen to support us. We look forward to meeting you! 

Art impacts everyone.  We live and breathe it.  Help us share it with the world.  

 

Risks and Challenges

We are queer women speaking out about our experiences with sexual violence. In doing this, we risk losing friends and family, job opportunities, and being trolled or doxed online.  Most people in this project have not shared their stories so publicly before and we support each other throughout this process and beyond.  We have invested our own money, time, effort, and energy into bringing A Serpent’s Voice to life. It is so incredibly important to us, we believe in it passionately and hope that you do too. Help us change the world through art. 

No matter what, we will be there for each other and conquer any hurdles that we face.  We are a part of an amazingly strong and supportive community.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share our campaign on social media as often as possible using the Indiegogo share tools!  You really can't share it too much.

Talk about it with everyone you know!  

Email people encouraging them to support A Serpent's Voice to help us get it funded ASAP. 

Post comments and words of encouragement on our IndieGogo and FB pages!

story:
Trans-Siberian Express


I went back to Russia to visit my family and friends after more than 10 years living in the United States. I felt like I was a child who took off on a journey of his dreams. Everything was so exciting and familiar, all the stops along the way, villages, towns and cities, amazing scenery through the window, sunrises and sunsets,  music from the radio and the sound of the train.
Babushkas selling piroshki (fried buns), drinking tea from the glass in a metal holder (traditional train tea cup), going to a train restaurant and eating borsh. Talking to strangers who become your friends on the way... and so much more brought back many memories from my childhood when I traveled by train with my mom. 

I am so excited to share my experience with you and I invite you to join me on a lifetime journey across Russia. 

What We Need 

75% - Printing of the book and recording of a Soundtrack

15% - Shipping 

5% - Packaging - This involves shrink-wrapping the books, purchasing the boxes for distribution, packing. 

5% - Indiegogo Fee - The fee kickstarter takes for hosting a project. 

Risks & Challenges

This is my second Coffee Table Book, so I am familiar with the self-publishing process!!! As soon as we reach the goal, you will get your book with the soundtrack, prints and whatever you would like!!!

story:
The Newark Artists Photo Documentary Project documents established and emerging visual artists in the City of Newark,NJ creating an archive of their contribution to the dynamic arts and cultural scene that has defined Newark’s artistic community for the past century. Utilizing vintage Jem Jr. box cameras manufactured in Newark in the 1940s, photographer Colleen Gutwein O’Neal captures artists’ personalities in fuzzy, mysterious images that emerge against a backdrop of vanishing architecture, forgotten places and artists’ workspaces threatened with demolition or redevelopment. Manufactured using the simplest form of photographic technology, the Jem Jr. images are created in conjunction with modern, digital portraits depicting the artists in their studios or homes.   The project's website, acting also as a digital archive, provides a unique networking resource for the community at large.  The contrasting polarity of the historic vs the modern offers a provocative commentary on the place of the artist in today’s society and the importance of honoring and preserving forever their contributions to the creative life of New Jersey’s largest City.  

I am seeking to raise $20,200.00 in completion funds for this project.  The funds will be used to finish production of 90-100 photoshoots of individual artists created with the traditional Jem Jr. camera for exhibition and conservation, post production of the remaining digital images for each artist’s profile on the project’s website, keeping the website  active for a minimum of 3 years, and producing a limited run of artist made Risograph catalogs of the black and white images. All work will be completed and publicly available online and in exhibition by October 2018.  

 

 

THE JEM JR. CAMERA:

The medium format Jem Jr. box camera is an integral part of the project and was chosen for reasons both geographical and conceptual. Manufactured in Newark in the 1940s, the Jem Jr. operates as an antithesis to the modern digital camera’s portraits, also used in this project. Initiating the viewer into a world seeming of both past and present, the Jem Jr. links the long lineage of Newark with the city’s current working artists. The blurred and distorted quality of the medium format film beckons the audience to experience more than a photograph. Through the imperfections and ghostly silhouettes in the printed images, this format provides an opportunity to connect with unknown elements hidden within the crags of the viewers own psyche.

 

 

THE DIGITAL ARCHIVE:

The goal of this project expanded as artists pointed to the lack of an available visual artists directory, and expressed a desire to connect with one another. After seeing this void firsthand, a website became a logical and necessary component of the project.  The website, www.newarkartsphotodoc.com  fills this void and has become one of many aspects of the project to garner exposure for the artists. Aside from connecting artists to one another, the website is a way for curators, galleries, collectors, and visitors of Newark to learn about the city’s rich artistic history and vast  number of talented artists. A link to each artists personal website is provided to connect inquisitive parties directly to the artist. The site also serves as an inspiration to the young people of the community showing that becoming an artist can be a career path and that there are many practicing artists within their own community.  As the city is constantly promoting itself as an artist forward city, this project aims to include these artists in their own story.  

 

WHAT WE NEED:

$20,200.00 in completion funds, and here is the breakdown: 

WHAT YOU GET:

As if  that warm fuzzy feeling you get knowing that you are part of something bigger than yourself wasn't enough.... I have some special perks available only during the fundraiser. 

At the $50- level you can score yourself an editioned Risograph print... only available on Indiegogo! 

At the $250- level and above, you can get one (or all) of five of my favorite Jem Jr. images.  These will be a limited edition of 8x10 silver gelatin prints made specifically for donors to this project. This size will not be made again

And at the $2,500- level  you’ll get to find out what its like to be an artist in the documentary when we meet at your favorite Newark location to do your photoshoot with the same cameras.  You will also receive digital images and a silver gelatin print from your photoshoot.   

I have created really unique perks to fit any budget starting at $5, so check out the list!  

And finally, Index Art Center, a local non-profit gallery, have been wonderfully supportive of this project and are my fiscal sponsor... making your donation tax-deductible*! 

* please contact your accountant for tax details when receiving perks

 

 

WHAT IF I DON'T HIT MY GOAL? 

If I haven’t hit my goal of $20,200- and you are reading this…please donate!!!

I will be raising funds on this platform as well as the project’s website, and fundraising events hosted by friends and organizations that really want to make this happen. 

I know that together we can do it!

 

IMPACT: 

The change and growth of Newark over the past decade alone has left portions of the city unrecognizable, and the constant influx of new people has somewhat obscured those who came before. The project’s intent is to preserve this particular place in time amidst the social and political change enveloping the city.  It is also to celebrate visual artists, past and present, so their work and stories, and the places they dwell are not lost.  

Your donation ensures that not only we, but future generations, can reflect upon and learn from today’s artists of Newark, and the everchanging landscape of the city.  

 

 

ABOUT ME:

In 2005 I graduated from MSU with a degree in photography.  Since then I have trained under and assisted a number of photographers, and now run my own freelance photography business, as well as mentor, train, and support other photographers in my community.  My work has been consistently shown in galleries and published since 2005, and I am currently a Community Partner-at-large with Shine Portrait Studio, part of Express Newark.  To see more of my work or my extended CV,  please visit: colleengutwein.com

 

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP:

If you can’t contribute cash, you can still help!

Please share this campaign with your friends on social media, or email a friend you know would love this project.  

Use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
Short Summary

  • Environment Europe is a sustainability think tank based in Oxford. It has been instrumental in providing cutting-edge research and education in sustainability, the programme of executive Summer and Winter Schools in Ecological Economics has been attended by participants from 53 different countries, including Canada, USA, Mexico, Ecuador, Costa Rica, Brazil, Colombia, Peru, Argentina, UK, France, Germany, Austria, Switzeland, Spain, Italy, Malta, Portugal, Belgium, the Netherlands, Czech Republic, Slovakia, Denmark, Sweden, Iceland, Norway, Serbia, Bosnia, Croatia, Albania, Latvia, Ghana, Nigeria, Jordan, Lebanon, Sri Lanka, China, India, Bhutan, Taiwan, Thailand, Philippines, and Australia. The participants of our programmes included representatives of UNEP, UNDP, ILO, WWF, OECD, IUCN, European Commission, GGGI, GIZ, government departments, companies and leading universities.
  • We are aiming to raise £10000 to start production of 'Ecosystems', a beautiful coffee-table photo album that will communicate the complexity and diversity of world's ecosystems and illustrate a simple idea that we entirely depend on the ecosystems and the natural world and that money cannot be a measuring rod to assess its value..
  • The required funds will go towards producing the first 500 copies of the book.

What We Need & What You Get

  • The £10000 we seek will go towards producing the first 500 copies of the album many of which will be distributed in universities, libraries and NGOs all around the world.
  • The following packages are available:
    • £99 This subscription package will entitle you to one copy of 'Ecosystems', signed by the author (upon request);
    • £499 This subscription package will entitle you to one copy of the book, 'Ecosystems', signed by the author (upon request) plus a 60x40cm framed print on paper of any of the images from the book (you will be able to communicate your wish after receiving your copy). Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website.
    • £999 This subscription package will entitle you to one copy of the book, 'Ecosystems', signed by the author (upon request) plus a museum quality 60x40cm print on aluminium under acrylic glass of any image from the book. Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website ;
    • £4999 This exclusive package will entitle you to one copy of 'Ecosystems', signed by the author, plus a 180x120cm museum quality unique print on aluminium under acrylic glass of any image from the book. Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website in a special section.
  • If we do not reach the entire goal we will start with a smaller number of copies (100-200).

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Our project is hugely valuable to the world because ecosystems are under threat, half of the world's biodiversity has been lost according to WWF in the past 40 years. The photographer, Dr Stanislav Shmelev has worked for the International Union for Conservation of Nature and proposed a new way to assess ecosystems and biodiversity using multi-criteria tools.  This book will illustrate the multiple dimensions of what ecosystems 'do', from oxygen production to water purification, production of food, generation of soils, carbon sequestration and pollination but also inspiration for artists and cultural and educational values.
  • Dr Stanislav Shmelev (stanislav.photography) is an award-winning photographer and ecological economist and has been leading Environment Europe since its foundation in 2004. He is the author and editor of bestselling books, 'Ecological Economics: Sustainability in Practice' (Springer, 2012): https://www.springer.com/gb/book/9789400719712 and 'Green Economy Reader' (Springer, 2017): https://www.springer.com/gb/book/9783319389172. Dr Shmelev exhibited his photography in Austria, Dubai, Germany, Peru, Russia, Spain and the UK at venues, which include the United Nations, Global Landscapes Forum, Royal College of Art, Price Galitzine Library, Brighton Photo Biennial, Fotonoviembre de Tenerife, Format, St Ives Arts Club, Debut Contemporary, O3 Gallery etc.
  • The endorsements from the leading environmentalists the 'Ecosystems' photobook received already include:
  • “The great challenge of our time is to build and nurture human communities that honor, respect, and cooperate with nature’s inherent ability to sustain life. To do so, it is critical to understand how ecosystems work — not only intellectually, but also emotionally and spiritually. Artists have an essential role to play to foster such deep, multidimensional understanding, and Stanislav Shmelev’s magnificent book succeeds admirably in this task.”    — Prof. Fritjof Capra, author, The Tao of Physics (1975), The Web of Life (1996), The Hidden Connections (2002), Learning from Leonardo (2007), coauthor, The Systems View of Life (2014).
  • “Our life depends on our ability to protect the home, which so generously hosts us. We should all contribute to our best. Sharing the captured moments of intrinsic beauty is certainly one of the most effective ways to raise awareness”, Janez Potočnik, former European Commissioner for the Environment, co-chair of the International Resources Panel, UN Environment.
  • "Stanislav Shmelev displays consummate skill in combining both art and science to produce his exquisite and captivating photo album, describing the essence of sustainability." Prof. Mohan Munasinghe, Vice Chair of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC-AR4), joint recipient of the 2007 Nobel Prize for Peace.
  • “This stunning array of images well illustrates nature's aesthetic value and its intrinsic value too”. Prof. Robin Attfield, Professor of Philosophy, Cardiff University.
  • “Visualizing ecosystem services is perhaps the most effective way of popularizing this important concept”, Prof. Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker, PhD, Co-President, The Club of Rome.
  • “In this book Stanislav Shmelev, an ecological economist and an artist, goes far beyond the environmental social sciences and even the environmental humanities by appealing through photography to the incommensurable values that humans hold towards the environment”, Prof. Joan Martinez-Alier, Autonomous University of Barcelona, Past President of the International Society for Ecological Economics;
  • 'Ecosystems’ by Stanislav Shmelev takes us through a journey of ecosystem services. Captured by a lens of a remarkable artist, who is also an expert, the colourful details bring to life the text describing the links between sustainability and the ecology surrounding us. As a Colombian, I enjoyed the clear message from wilderness to the scent of a cup of coffee generously provided by nature.” Prof. Juan Armando Sánchez, Professor of Biological Sciencies, Universidad de los Andes, Bogota, Colombia;
  • “This splendid collection exhibits an amazing rainbow of colours in scenes from around the globe, expressing the photographer's profound concern for the state of the Earth, while also celebrating the intense and astonishing exuberance of human and biological diversity in some of the world's most beautiful ecosystems. Shmelev's inspired structure leads us along a carefully selected series of contexts and themes, showing clearly the importance of maintaining the stability and productivity of natural processes through global and local commitment for planetary survival in the face of global change”, Prof. Peter H. May, PhD, Professor of Ecological Economics, Federal Rural University of Rio de Janeiro

Risks & Challenges

  • We have already finished book design, for which I am very grateful to the University of Reading and the MA in Book Design, and especially to designers Rebecca Burlow and Charlotte Ham.
  • An ISBN number has already been assigned to the book.
  • We will thoroughly review the first test copies and meticulously correct all the issues that emerge before shipping the final copies of the book.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • There are many ways you could help, which includes sharing this campaign and information about our Summer, Winter and Spring Schools on social media: Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn .
  • You can always use Indiegogo share tools to repost this campaign so more people could see it!

Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website.
£999 This subscription package will entitle you to one copy of the book, 'Ecosystems', signed by the author (upon request) plus a museum quality 60x40cm print on aluminium under acrylic glass of any image from the book. Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website ;
£4999 This exclusive package will entitle you to one copy of 'Ecosystems', signed by the author, plus a 180x120cm museum quality unique print on aluminium under acrylic glass of any image from the book. Your name or the name of your organization will be mentioned on our website in a special section.


If we do not reach the entire goal we will start with a smaller number of copies (100-200).


The Impact
Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

Our project is hugely valuable to the world because ecosystems are under threat, half of the world's biodiversity has been lost according to WWF in the past 40 years. The photographer, Dr Stanislav Shmelev has worked for the International Union for Conservation of Nature and proposed a new way to assess ecosystems and biodiversity using multi-criteria tools.  This book will illustrate the multiple dimensions of what ecosystems 'do', from oxygen production to water purification, production of food, generation of soils, carbon sequestration and pollination but also inspiration for artists and cultural and educational values.
Dr Stanislav Shmelev (stanislav.photography) is an award-winning photographer and ecological economist and has been leading Environment Europe since its foundation in 2004. He is the author and editor of bestselling books, 'Ecological Economics: Sustainability in Practice' (Springer, 2012): https://www.springer.com/gb/book/9789400719712 and 'Green Economy Reader' (Springer, 2017): https://www.springer.com/gb/book/9783319389172. Dr Shmelev exhibited his photography in Austria, Dubai, Germany, Peru, Russia, Spain and the UK at venues, which include the United Nations, Global Landscapes Forum, Royal College of Art, Price Galitzine Library, Brighton Photo Biennial, Fotonoviembre de Tenerife, Format, St Ives Arts Club, Debut Contemporary, O3 Gallery etc.
The endorsements from the leading environmentalists the 'Ecosystems' photobook received already include:
“The great challenge of our time is to build and nurture human communities that honor, respect, and cooperate with nature’s inherent ability to sustain life. To do so, it is critical to understand how ecosystems work — not only intellectually, but also emotionally and spiritually. Artists have an essential role to play to foster such deep, multidimensional understanding, and Stanislav Shmelev’s magnificent book succeeds admirably in this task.”    — Prof. Fritjof Capra, author, The Tao of Physics (1975), The Web of Life (1996), The Hidden Connections (2002), Learning from Leonardo (2007), coauthor, The Systems View of Life (2014).
“Our life depends on our ability to protect the home, which so generously hosts us. We should all contribute to our best. Sharing the captured moments of intrinsic beauty is certainly one of the most effective ways to raise awareness”, Janez Potočnik, former European Commissioner for the Environment, co-chair of the International Resources Panel, UN Environment.
"Stanislav Shmelev displays consummate skill in combining both art and science to produce his exquisite and captivating photo album, describing the essence of sustainability." Prof. Mohan Munasinghe, Vice Chair of the Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC-AR4), joint recipient of the 2007 Nobel Prize for Peace.
“This stunning array of images well illustrates nature's aesthetic value and its intrinsic value too”. Prof. Robin Attfield, Professor of Philosophy, Cardiff University.
“Visualizing ecosystem services is perhaps the most effective way of popularizing this important concept”, Prof. Ernst Ulrich von Weizsäcker, PhD, Co-President, The Club of Rome.
“In this book Stanislav Shmelev, an ecological economist and an artist, goes far beyond the environmental social sciences and even the environmental humanities by appealing through photography to the incommensurable values that humans hold towards the environment”, Prof. Joan Martinez-Alier, Autonomous University of Barcelona, Past President of the International Society for Ecological Economics;
'Ecosystems’ by Stanislav Shmelev takes us through a journey of ecosystem services. Captured by a lens of a remarkable artist, who is also an expert, the colourful details bring to life the text describing the links between sustainability and the ecology surrounding us. As a Colombian, I enjoyed the clear message from wilderness to the scent of a cup of coffee generously provided by nature.” Prof. Juan Armando Sánchez, Professor of Biological Sciencies, Universidad de los Andes, Bogota, Colombia;
“This splendid collection exhibits an amazing rainbow of colours in scenes from around the globe, expressing the photographer's profound concern for the state of the Earth, while also celebrating the intense and astonishing exuberance of human and biological diversity in some of the world's most beautiful ecosystems. Shmelev's inspired structure leads us along a carefully selected series of contexts and themes, showing clearly the importance of maintaining the stability and productivity of natural processes through global and local commitment for planetary survival in the face of global change”, Prof. Peter H. May, PhD, Professor of Ecological Economics, Federal Rural University of Rio de Janeiro


Risks & Challenges

We have already finished book design, for which I am very grateful to the University of Reading and the MA in Book Design, and especially to designers Rebecca Burlow and Charlotte Ham.
An ISBN number has already been assigned to the book.
We will thoroughly review the first test copies and meticulously correct all the issues that emerge before shipping the final copies of the book.


Other Ways You Can Help

There are many ways you could help, which includes sharing this campaign and information about our Summer, Winter and Spring Schools on social media: Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn .
You can always use Indiegogo share tools to repost this campaign so more people could see it!

story:
All of the Lights

My name is Jeff Ligonde, and I inspire others to imagine new possibilities through visual means.

...let me explain

ETHER MEDIA is a platform that specializes in producing digital content for creative minds and brands. This digital content is used to highlight and accentuate innovation through decor pieces. We focus on providing artwork that can be infused into any space, and transform it into something extraordinary. From canvas wall prints for your home or office, to social media campaigns and projects – we strive to provide one of a kind products and experiences. With that said…I’m extremely excited to introduce you to a special project I’ve been working on – “All of the Lights”

The IDEA

All of the Lights is a photo experience that encapsulates the art of still photography with the motion, the speed, and most importantly – the illuminating ambience of a dynamic city atmosphere. There are times you may not notice it, but we are instinctively attracted to sources of light. Each photograph in this collection represents the feeling a person receives when light is embraced; even the smallest flicker of light can provide a feeling of warmth, optimism, and hope.

Can you describe the feeling of looking up at an enormous Ferris Wheel, during a calm evening carnival? Have you ever experienced a sunset while being surrounded by some of the tallest skyscrapers in the world? Have you ever noticed the luminous reflection of a mile-long suspension bridge against a calm river? Choose to locate light...magnify it...let its energy fill you - in spite of any darkness that may surround it.

The GOAL

My goal is to create a photo book that captures beautiful scenes containing various light sources from my personal perspective. In order to do that, I'll need your help! I'm looking to raise a total of $8,000 to produce, publish, and distribute All of the Lights. Each contributor to the production of a photo book will receive a signed premium hardcover book. These limited edition copies are 12" x 7.5" in size and has a smooth glossy finish throughout. In other words...this piece is perfect coffee table book!

In addition to All of the Lights, you also have the option of purchasing one of our canvas print selections from the Ether Media portfolio. Creating the best quality home environment is something I'd like to provide each and every one of my supporters. Canvas sizes are: Large (24" x 16") or XLarge (36" x 24"). Museum quality canvas that are laminated ad stretched by hand. You can choose from any one of the featured photos in "All of The Lights" or we can work together to create something that is truly special to YOU! Whether you choose one of my pieces or a commissioned piece, these canvas prints will be perfect for any living area, office, studio, or bedroom. A one of a kind item that last for generations. Don't miss the chance to own something special!

 The INSPIRATION

The inspiration for this book comes from a place of wanting to connect more. Before this spring (2020), I believe I took the feeling of being outdoors for granted. As human beings, we're meant to be outside - we're meant to interact with our environment - and most importantly, we're meant to interact with each other. Each image in the All of the Lights photo book represents an authentic scene. I share my authenticity of that scene through this camera lens experience.

A shared experience is also meant to discussed. I want the images in this book to strike  conversion between family, friends, and associates. Where is this place? What time of day is it? How was this shot taken? In a time where social distancing has, and will probably become the norm, this book is something that can bring us together!

The EXPERIENCE

This book represents the human experience. It represents the feeling a person has when he or she steps out the door each and every day. This book represents the passion, connection, and authenticity I bring through this lens. If you can appreciate that perspective, please contribute to this campaign in any way you can.

Let's get the word out and make some noise about this photo book! Sharing is caring, so follow myself and Ether Media and let me know if any of my stuff is dope!

Respect.

www.ether-media.com

IG: @ether_media | @ethe_royale

Twitter: @ether_media | @ethe_royale

story:
El Libro / The Book

Contribuya a este proyecto, ayude a contar la historia de América Latina en la pandemia y garantice su copia del libro de fotos RED FLAG a un precio promocional de 30 dólares.

[EN] Contribute to this project, help tell the story of Latin America in the pandemic, and get your copy of the RED FLAG photo book at a promotional price of $30!

 

 

“En 2020, desde el original esfuerzo de servir de testigos de la pandemia mientras esta arrasaba con el hemisferio, nueve mujeres y nueve hombres en América Latina se juntaron para formar un nuevo colectivo, Covidlatam. Trabajaron acercándose a la crisis a su manera, dando lo mejor de sí. En catorce países, desde México a Argentina, registraron lo que vieron a su alrededor, y en algunos casos, dentro de sus propios hogares. Pero este no es un libro sólo sobre catástrofe. Hay dolor y muerte aquí, pero también hay vida nueva y el ocasional destello de esperanza. ” Jon Lee Anderson és periodista, corresponsal de guerra, escritor de la revista The New Yorker y firma el texto de introducción del libro.

[EN] “In 2020, in an original endeavour to bear witness to the pandemic as it surged across the hemisphere, nine women and nine men around Latin America came together to form a new collective, COVID-Latam. They then went to work, each approaching the crisis in their own way, as best as they were able. In fourteen countries, from Mexico to Argentina, they chronicled what they saw around them, and in a few cases, within their own homes. But this is not a book only about a catastrophe. There is pain and death here, but there is also new life and an occasional glimpse of hope.” From the introduction by Jon Lee Anderson,  journalist, war correspondent, and writer for The New Yorker magazine.

 

 

El Fotolibro Red Flag nace como resultado del premio obtenido en la Convocatoria del FotoEvidence con WorldPressPhoto.​ En esta campaña tienes la posibilidad de apoyar el trabajo del colectivo Covid Latam y conseguir uno de los 1000 ejemplares del libro Red Flag a un valor promocional de preventa de $30 dólares, un 45% menos que el valor de venta que el libro tendrá en mostradores a partir de mediados de Abril. 

[EN] The Red Flag was the winner of the FotoEvidence Book Award with WorldPressPhoto. In this campaign you have the possibility to support the work of the Covid Latam collective and get one of the 1000 copies of the Red Flag book at a promotional pre-sale value of $ 30 dollars, 45% less than the retail price of the book when it comes off the press in mid-April.

 

Cuando la pandemia de COVID-19 llegó a Santiago de Chile, la fotógrafa Tamara Merino pasó 146 días totalmente encerrada en su apartamento, junto con su hijo y su madre. Santiago de Chile. 28 de marzo de 2020.

A un mes de iniciada la pandemia en Costa Rica, nos enteramos que nuestra familia aumentaría en número, mi proceso de gestación estuvo acompañado de incertidumbre, miedo y lejanía, pero al mismo tiempo de esperanza, conexión y pausa. Diciembre 2020, por Glorianna Ximendaz

 

En América Latina, el coronavirus ha puesto al descubierto la desigualdad extrema en la región, y un símbolo de esa desigualdad es la bandera roja en Colombia. Los colombianos empobrecidos cuelgan un trozo de tela roja fuera de sus casas cuando ya no tienen comida; es un llamado de ayuda y un recordatorio de que muchas personas viven de lo que ganan en el día a día, sin una red de seguridad. Si bien algunas familias pueden ponerse en cuarentena de manera segura, muchas otras corren el riesgo de pasar hambre y ser desalojadas si dejan de trabajar incluso por un día. Aquellos que cuelgan la bandera roja fuera de sus hogares dependen de la ayuda y solidaridad de los demás para sobrevivir.

[EN] In Latin America, coronavirus has laid bare extreme inequality in the region, and one symbol of that inequality is the red flag in Colombia. Impoverished Colombians hang a piece of red fabric outside their homes when they no longer have any food – it is a call for help and a reminder that many people live off what they earn from one day to the next with no safety net. While some families can quarantine safely, others risk hunger and eviction if they stop working even for a day. Those who hang the red flag outside their homes depend on the generosity of others for survival.

 

Una mujer y su hijo miran por la ventana en la que cuelga un trapo rojo como señal de que no tienen dinero ni comida y no pueden salir a trabajar por la pandemia. Medellín, Colombia. Federico Ríos Escobar.​

Trabajadores del cementerio cargan el féretro de una persona fallecida por COVID-19, durante su entierro en el cementerio “Mártires 19 de Julio”, en Comas, en las afueras de Lima, Perú, el miércoles 8 de julio de 2020. Foto: Rodrigo ABD

 

Quien somos / Who We Are

Países / Countries:
Argentina, Brasil, Uruguay, Chile, Bolivia, Perú, Ecuador, Colombia, Venezuela, Costa Rica, Guatemala, El Salvador, Cuba and México. 

Fotógrafes / Photographers:
Federico Ríos Escobar, Tamara Merino, Rodrigo Abd, Fabiola Ferrero, Fred Ramos, Glorianna Ximendaz, Pablo Piovano, Matilde Campodónico, Ale Cegarra, Ana Carolina Fernandes, Rafael Vilela, Andrea Hernández, Daniele Volpe, Johis Alarcón, Iván Valencia, Sara Aliaga, Sebastian Gil Miranda, Victor Moriyama y Eliana Aponte. 

 

El libro fue editado por Musuk Nolte y diseñado por Ramón Pez Studio, Jon Lee Anderson escribió la introducción, en tanto Alice Driver y Marcela Turati contribuyeron con textos y entrevistas. 

[EN] The book is edited by Musuk Nolte and designed by Ramón Pez Studio, Jon Lee Anderson writes the introduction, while Alice Driver and Marcela Turati contribute texts and interviews.

Martina Veranea Rodriguez, 87, shows a collage she made of her family members in her apartment in Caracas, Venezuela, on May 8, 2020.  Foto: Andrea Hernánez Briceño

Residents of the Copan Building, the most traditional building in São Paulo built by architect Oscar Niemeyer, bang pots against Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro when many people were already in self-quarantine because of the Coronavirus. Victor Moriyama

 

Covid Latam y FotoEvidence piden tu apoyo a Red Flag porque somos el primer colectivo que recibe el Premio del Libro de FotoEvidence y 18 fotógrafos contribuyen a un libro más grande y la necesidad de más copias.  Únete a nosotros como patrocinador de esta importante reflexión humanista sobre el impacto regional de la pandemia.

[EN] Covid Latam and FotoEvidence are asking you to back Red Flag  because we are the first collective to receive the FotoEvidence Book Award and 18 photographers contribute to a larger book and the need for more copies.  Join us as a backer of this significant humanistic reflection on the regional impact of the pandemic.

 

 

Un hombre lleva a una mujer para cruzar el río que divide la frontera entre Colombia y Venezuela. A pesar del cierre del puente, diariamente entran unos 450 venezolanos con intención de quedarse en Colombia, y 200 migrantes que regresan a Venezuela. Fabíola Ferrero.

story:
+modern

Our name is +modern and for the past three years we have been studying  photography at Blackpool & The Fylde Creative College of Art. For our final major project of our degrees we are going to be showcasing a variety of our work in the Menier Gallery which is situated within central London. As photographers, having our work shown in a gallery in London will be a very big achievement not just as a group but for each one of us as individuals. The last three years of our photographic practice haven't always been easy and having a big exhibition in London will be an amazing send off, and a brilliant way for us to end our time in higher education and we will be extremely grateful if you can help us make this happen.

You scratch our backs, we'll scratch yours.

The amount of money we are asking for is £1000 and this will be used for paying for the gallery space, framing costs, transportation of the photographic prints and other equipment for the exhibition, along with refreshments for the opening night. 
The perks that are up for grabs are a thank you letter, an invite to the opening night of the exhibition, a postcard pack made up from images which will be shown at the exhibition, a guided tour of the exhibition, an A3 signed print from your chosen artist, and finally one of the perks offers free unlimited drinks for the entirety of the opening night.
If we don't meet our desired goal of £1000 we will still use what ever money that gets donated to our campaign and will still provide our contributors with their perks, we will move mountains to have this exhibition because it means that much to us, so even if we're a little short off our goal we will make the exhibition happen.

The Impact

Your contribution to this exhibition could mean the difference between one of our talented photographers becoming noticed within the British photographic industry or not. Exhibiting in London is a big deal for artists who are trying to break through because it just needs the one right person to be distracted by their work and it could be you who helps them further their career within the world of photography.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you're not in a position to help fund us we still value the time you have taken to read this article, if you could follow us, share us, retweet us, promote us, talk about us, we would really appreciate it. The links for all of our social medias are further down the page. 

Thank You

You scratch our backs, we'll scratch yours.

The amount of money we are asking for is £1000 and this will be used for paying for the gallery space, framing costs, transportation of the photographic prints and other equipment for the exhibition, along with refreshments for the opening night. 
The perks that are up for grabs are a thank you letter, an invite to the opening night of the exhibition, a postcard pack made up from images which will be shown at the exhibition, a guided tour of the exhibition, an A3 signed print from your chosen artist, and finally one of the perks offers free unlimited drinks for the entirety of the opening night.
If we don't meet our desired goal of £1000 we will still use what ever money that gets donated to our campaign and will still provide our contributors with their perks, we will move mountains to have this exhibition because it means that much to us, so even if we're a little short off our goal we will make the exhibition happen.   The Impact Your contribution to this exhibition could mean the difference between one of our talented photographers becoming noticed within the British photographic industry or not. Exhibiting in London is a big deal for artists who are trying to break through because it just needs the one right person to be distracted by their work and it could be you who helps them further their career within the world of photography.   
Other Ways You Can Help

 Even if you're not in a position to help fund us we still value the time you have taken to read this article, if you could follow us, share us, retweet us, promote us, talk about us, we would really appreciate it. The links for all of our social medias are further down the page. 
Thank You

Thank you so much!!!

story:
“You are important because you exist and your circumstances do not define you.”

This has been the motto and foundation to our classes since Picture Change began in 2011. 

In April and May of 2015, Picture Change founder Kate Gazaway will be in a community near Chichigalpa, Nicaragua in partnership with New Song Mission Nicaragua. 

Many of the people in this area suffer from Chronic Kidney Disease, resulting in sickness and early death. This is a major contributor to the extreme poverty in the region. International media has been covering this epidemic for the past few years, but, for the first time, we are providing an opportunity for those living in the affected communities to share their perspective.

Picture Change will be providing local high school-age students with digital storytelling resources, eight weeks of photography training, and access to social media platforms to share the reality of their lives and community. This will not only foster confidence and leadership skills within the students, but also provide a pro-active way to play a role in how their story is told.

Students will have the opportunity to use their new skills in a “Giving Back Day,” where they will the provide the photography for family portraits in the community at no charge. Near the end of the project, we'll host two Gallery Shows of the students’ photography: one in the city of León, a major tourist location and university area, and the other in the students’ home town of Chichigalpa. This is a tangible way for the students to be celebrated and treated as professional photographers in addition to making their family and neighbors proud.

For the final week of training, the students will travel out of the area (some, for the first time) to the northern mountains of Nicaragua and participate in a creative service project utilizing their new photography skills to help others.

When I discussed this project with the communications director at a local aid organization, I said “We are going to teach them a new way to tell their own story.”

He replied, “That’s just it: no one has asked them to tell their story. It won’t be a new way, it will be the first time anyone has asked.”

Give the gift of story. Give the gift of hope. This project has the opportunity to become the gift of a better life for the youth of Chichigalpa.


What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of $7,800 to make this project happen. This will cover Kate's living expenses in Nicaragua and conducting this project at no charge to the students.


Consider sponsoring:

  • Camera and Training for a Student ($450/per student): This supports the costs surrounding the donated cameras, transportation, renting a classroom in the community, a translator, and maintenance of our gear for our students.
  •  Uniforms ($35): Give one, Get one. We are providing a “uniform” (t-shirt) for each of the students and staff on this project. This is a step to promote confidence and participation amongst the students and community. If you buy one for yourself, it will provide a t-shirt for our team in Chichigalpa.
  •  Family Portrait Day in Chichigalpa ($150): The students will use their new photography skills to provide free family portraits in the area.
  • Gallery Show in Leon ($350): Leon is the closest city to Chichigalpa. It has a growing arts scene and is a destination for tourists. This cost covers renting a gallery space, printing photos, food, advertising, and transportation of students’ families to the city.
  • Gallery Show in Chichigalpa ($175): This is a gallery show in the students’ community displaying photos from their service project in the northern mountains of Nicaragua. It is a tangible way to celebrate the students and give their families something to be proud of.  Cost covers printing photos, food, advertising for the show, and the students get to keep their photos after the gallery.
  • Field Trips ($250): Covers transportation and food. Our students rarely, if ever, get out of these affected communities surrounded by a sea of sugarcane. These field trips to the ocean and nearby city will allow them to experience an entirely different view of their own country, give them the opportunity to use their new photography skills in a “safe” place away from their everyday life, and encourage a new perspective on life by having a little fun.
  • Service Trip ($375/per student): In May, we are traveling to a coffee farm in northern Nicaragua, and partnering with Comunidad Connect, an organization doing amazing work in community development for the area. The students will create a media campaign to raise funds and awareness for Comunidad Connect.


The Impact

This trip serves many purposes:
     Empowerment:  These students may live below the poverty line, but they have a voice. Picture Change is merely providing the resources and opportunity to use it, allowing them to give of their own talents instead of receiving charity. 

     Employment: Rosa, one of our former students from 2011, has started her own business providing much-needed photography services to her community, whether it's ID photos or event photography. These students will be trained to do the same. Also, due to the flow of journalists and tourists to this area, students will have the opportunity to be employed as assistants or photo-guides, providing an income for their families and serving as ambassadors to their community. 

Confidence: We have witnessed the transformative power of digital storytelling in our students since 2011. Through photography and social media platforms, the students play a direct role in creating better lives for others and acting as the documentarians for their community, sharing their story with the world.

     Hope: How powerful are the words, "I see what you are going through and I hear what you have to say," ? Instead of focusing on the poverty and death that thrives in Chichigalpa, our class will focus on life, family bonds, dreams for the future, and the natural beauty that surrounds these students. Profits from the students' photography sales go directly back to them and their families, thus the work they create can literally save lives by putting food on their table, funding education, or providing medicine. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Picture Change has never purchased a camera and has operated these past four years through the generous camera donations of so many. 

We are still in need of:

Gear

  • iPhones: We are teaching the students how to incorporate their art and stories into social media, and an iPhone is a valuable asset to that. In addition to the camera quality, we use them to record audio interviews to incorporate into our media. 
  • Macbook Air or small laptop computer: This will be used by Kate for uploading, editing, sharing, and teaching with the students. She will be traveling back and forth from the community and around the country with all of the camera gear, so something small and lightweight is tremendously helpful. 
  • Compact photo printer: this will be donated to the local partner organization after the project is completed so they can continue to photograph and print families in Chichigalpa.
  • Compact point and shoot cameras. We are looking for cameras 6megapixels or above. Please include all chargers, memory cards, etc. 
  • Fuji Instax Camera/ Film: when we travel to rural areas, it is a tremendous gift to be able to give photos instead of just taking them. 
Skymiles
  • One of the biggest expenses is the plane ticket for Kate to get to Nicaragua. If you have Skymiles with Delta that you are able to transfer to Kate, please contact us for the next step. Picture Change can reimburse the cost of transferring them if necessary. 

Awareness

Do you interact with other humans? Do you use the internet? Do you like what Picture Change is doing?

Then talk about it! We at Picture Change love our students and love what we do, and the more people who hear about what's happening the better! Maybe you don't have money or gear, but you have a voice and that is very powerful.  

Use the IndieGoGo Share Tools to raise awareness of the work Picture Change is doing. That has an enormous impact on our mission!


Thank You. Gracias. 

For real. None of this could happen without you. This world has become so small and so connected via the internet, and what affects our friends across the world affects us here at home whether we know it or not. We are grateful for your encouragement and support, and I know our students will be too.
So thank you. Let's stay in touch and change the world, or at least our corner of it.

story:
Lawrence Community Photo Studio and Darkroom Facility


Hello and thank you for looking at our funding campaign.

My name is Jay Keim. I am a long time Lawrence Resident  I am a Musician, Photographer, Father and I am passionate about our wonderful town. Lawrence, Kansas is an oasis and the new Art District is an example of why this city is listed often as one of the best small cities in America.  And one main thing that is missing from the Art District and the City is a place for up coming and established photographers  to have Studio Space and Darkroom facilities for their use.   And for young photographers our High Schools are closing down their darkrooms.  Film, Like vinyl records, is making a very strong comeback as aficionados of the Art know there  is really nothing quite like it.  We need a professional quality Darkroom Facility in town for people to use.

We won't be just for the Film users. We plan to have all the needs for the Digital Photographers and Video Artists to use including computers loaded with the proper software, Professional quality  printers and workstations. The studio space can also be set up with a green screen for the videographers in the area to use.

The Studio space will be very important as there is never a space like this for the public to use.  The have access to a Professional Studio, complete with lights and backdrops, is every new Photographers dream come true!  This will be an amazing space!

Plus the space we have picked has a very large Gallery area.  Lawrence has a Final Friday event where  on the last Friday of every month the town opens it's doors to the Artists in town to show off their Art.  We will be right in the middle of the Lawrence Art District and the Gallery space will be a highlight for Photographers to show off and sell their Art.


What we are looking for to get this project up and running is a beginning budget of Twenty Thousand dollars. With this amount we can buy the equipment needed to begin and pay as much rent in advance as possible. Much of the equipment, especially the Darkroom equipment, is very reasonably priced and a complete large Darkroom can be set up for just a few thousand dollars. We are hoping for donations of equipment too such as Film and Digital cameras that be rented or checked out for students to use. We have carpenter friends lined up who will donate their time and skills if anything like that is needed.

We know that the key  to this project is sustainability.  We will offer memberships,  rent the studio space and offer classes and workshops in Photography, Darkroom, Printmaking, Video Production and more. Plus the Gallery space. All of this will, we are certain, be enough to sustain this project. The Art Community here is large and Vibrant and the community is very supportive of the Arts.

And with enough funding we will be able to offer all of our services to those who cannot afford it.


Look at the perks we will give you for your donation!


Your Donation and the creation of this facility will bring to Lawrence a space for young and old alike to have a professional quality photographic studio for their own use. Nothing like it exists!  The impact to the community could easily be the next great young photographer!


II have been a part of this community for over 30 years. I Owned a popular Music Store in town throughout the '90s and most everyone knows me.  I know Photography and with my contacts in the community and past business experience  I feel confident about the future of this project.  And if after this fundraiser is finished and if we did not meet our goal we will either re-asses the type of space we need to get started or donate the funds to another Art Project in The Art District in town. 

And remember, It is almost as important to share this campaign with your friends as it is to donate! So please, we hope you do both!


Indiegogo has share tools for you to use!


Thank You!

story:
About the Project

American Exile is a series of photographs and interviews documenting the stories of immigrants who have been ordered deported from the United States, as well as their family members – often, American citizens – who suffer the consequences of the harsh punishment of exile. The catalyst for this project was the five months Graham spent in immigration detention in 2010, facing deportation because of a misdemeanor conviction – despite living in the U.S. as a legal permanent resident since 1999. After winning his case, he and his partner Susan began gathering stories of families caught up in deportation proceedings, including asylum seekers, green card holders and immigrants trapped in the bureaucracy of adjusting a visa. Our goal is to show the wide range of people affected when someone is deported, including spouses and children who remain in the U.S., separated from a parent or partner living in exile.

Upcoming Exhibition 

American Exile will be displayed at Photoville (www.photoville.com) in Brooklyn Bridge Park from Sept. 10-20, 2015. One of the largest photographic events in the U.S., Photoville is free to attend, hosting 60 exhibitors and expecting more than 70,000 visitors this year. Our exhibit will combine Graham’s photographs of deportees and their families, as well as individuals  fighting deportation cases,  alongside quotes from Susan’s interviews, letting the people in the pictures speak for themselves. More info at:

http://www.photoville.com/2015-exhibitions/american-exile-detained-deported-divided/
 

Why We're Fundraising

The cost to exhibit our project at Photoville is $6,000, which includes rental space, electricity, labor, insurance, security etc... but it gives us the amazing opportunity to present 20 families' stories. Your contribution will support the expenses for the exhibit, including the shipping container rental, postcards and printing.

Help Spread the Word

Please help us get the word out about our campaign using social media and Indiegogo's share tools.

story:
Ben Winkler and his 'Faces of Silver' campaign was interviewed and became a feature on NBC Charlotte on 5/4/18:  https://www.wcnc.com/article/news/health/faces-...

'Faces of Silver' campaign encourages women to embrace their natural beauty

"How do we have the audacity to judge women by what their age is, who are are we to tell them what's right what's wrong?"

Author: Meilin Tompkins

Published: 5:00 PM EDT May 4, 2018

Updated: 6:04 PM EDT May 4, 2018

CHARLOTTE, NC -- Women all across the nation are taking a stand against what society has deemed, "beautiful."

Thousands of women are ditching the hair dye for a more natural approach.

Ben Winkler, a Los Angeles-based photographer, has been traveling across the nation documenting those beautiful women.

"It's basically a project to bring the awareness to society at large," Winkler said. "How do we have the audacity to judge women by what their age is, who are are we to tell them what's right what's wrong?"

Winkler's movement called "Faces of Silver" has given women the confidence to go gray.

"How can we show that there's still that radiance and that luster in there, and that gray does not mean doubt," Winkler said.

Winkler's project began two years ago. He used the photos he took and turned them a book to be published as a coffee table book.

His campaign had a large impact on one Charlotte woman.

"It doesn't have to be about age," Priscilla Walters said. "Everyone is really special and it doesn't mean that you have aged it means that you have saged to me. It means that you have beauty and we have to embrace it."

Winkler has created an IndieGoGo to help fund his "Faces Of Silver" book, click here to donate. Share your photos of your silver hair with us using #Facesofsilver.

 
Ben writes:  
Our story began on my boat in the Florida Keys while scheduling my travel for glamour and beauty photoshoots.  I myself was greying  at 17, my mom at 14 and those experiences have a way of showing up, when there's something whose time is come.  Ready to be born from us, memories turn into flourishing projects and enter our awareness with synchronicity messages and good feelings.  That was my experience as I was moving more and more into that passion of "Silver Hair, Don't Care" photoshoot scheduling and loving every minute of it.  Many (might I say triple digit) subjects later and 60 worldwide beauties now featured in 'Faces of Silver', the book, roughly 120 page book began with me, what is now a movement.  This project is now in manuscript book form and with baited breath awaiting to be published, 'Faces of Silver'.  And as I say, "It's not over until me and the Silver Women get to sing and you have your 'Faces of Silver' book."  Yes, we are inviting you to be included in this movement, this cause! Become a part of this movement, get your book and share with others!   BW

A recent "Celebrate Women" video on 3/22/18 from Ben Winkler:

 

From FACEBOOK:  Faces of Silver - New York 2017 thank you to each and every one of you for participating and playing that day! :) cherished memories, new friendships... These Silver Beauties are from the UK

Faces of Silver - New York!!! We had a great location, theatrical setting, old railroad cars and plenty of fun! Thank you to everyone who came out :) 'Faces Of Silver' - the project www.FacesOfSilver.com playful, joyful & easy with great energy in the mix makes this project so rewarding! info@benwinkler.com #facesofsilver #benwinklerphotography #silver #greyhair #grayhair #silverhair #beautifulaging #radiance #glow #shine #style #glamour #evolvedwoman #maturewoman

 

Ben Winkler and Why I Do What I Do Video 

 

Little Updates Along My 'Faces of Silver' Tour

Ben created such a loving and 'Faces of Silver' community and world interest by photo journaling  on social media.  The testimony comments from participants to those of fellow FaceBook or Instagramers fueled his project as Ben shared, 

"Faces Of Silver' - the project www.FacesOfSilver.com playful, joyful & easy with great energy in the mix makes this project so rewarding! Haven't had this much fun in a long time!"

Ben on 'Faces of Silver' Tour:  "Many new faces, many new places, many new friendships."

'Faces of Silver' tour 2017... Interesting, I even have silver skies accompanying me along my preliminary route: London, Amsterdam, Munich, Vienna, Zagreb, Milano, Lake Como, Barcelona, Lucerne and back to London...NYC first week of April...

And there are many more places after this leg of Ben's trip.

Even Beautiful Silvers and Their Loves (and their stories) Were a Part of 'Faces of Silver'

Ben Winkler :  Oh boy, my entire day, wait, entire tour just got turned upside down! I just got reminded of humanity, kindness, and most of all love! I was fortunate to witness a most beautiful couple interact with each other. It brought back why I do what I do, to capture moments, to show tenderness and to tell the story my subjects allow me to tell! Thank you Melissa & Robert, you have just allow me to SEE and GET it, even if only a glimpse of what it is we all yearn to have! 'Faces Of Silver' - the project www.FacesOfSilver.com playful, joyful & easy with great energy in the mix makes this project so rewarding! Haven't had this much fun in a long time! info@benwinkler.com

Bobby Humphries Ben Winkler...it was fantastic meeting you and getting a small glimpse into your amazing life and experiences. And thank you for the kind and insightful words.
I didn't find Melissa until I was 40, but didn't take long to realize she was my fate and I could tell she felt the same way. I'm still amazed that I get to love her and be loved by her.
I wish you and all others the best of luck finding love and your best friend in the same person. It's an amazing feeling and helps cut down on how many times you have to tell a story.

Ben Winkler and his 'Faces of Silver' campaign was interviewed and became a feature on NBC Charlotte on 5/4/18:  https://www.wcnc.com/article/news/health/faces-...


'Faces of Silver' campaign encourages women to embrace their natural beauty
"How do we have the audacity to judge women by what their age is, who are are we to tell them what's right what's wrong?"
Author: Meilin Tompkins
Published: 5:00 PM EDT May 4, 2018
Updated: 6:04 PM EDT May 4, 2018
CHARLOTTE, NC -- Women all across the nation are taking a stand against what society has deemed, "beautiful."
Thousands of women are ditching the hair dye for a more natural approach.
Ben Winkler, a Los Angeles-based photographer, has been traveling across the nation documenting those beautiful women.
"It's basically a project to bring the awareness to society at large," Winkler said. "How do we have the audacity to judge women by what their age is, who are are we to tell them what's right what's wrong?"
Winkler's movement called "Faces of Silver" has given women the confidence to go gray.
