story:
Beyond, a photography magazine in newspaper format, was first launched in 2016 and appears every two years in parallel to the Lumix Festival for Young Photojournalism. It gives an additional view of different approaches in humanistic photography. This means Beyond is not just featuring journalistic and documentary approaches, but also more research based, conceptual and artistic ones. The idea behind Beyond is to open a discourse about current tendencies in humanistic photography and to give young photographers a podium to showcase their work.

This year's edition is dedicated to ten talented female photographers and will be released in June 2018 during Lumix Festival for Young Photojournalism.

In this campaign every Euro counts! Even if we don't reach our goal, the project will still be realized and every Euro will help to cover the printing costs. By supporting Beyond on Indiegogo you can become part of this great project. Take your chance to get an unfolded copy of Beyond fresh from the printing press or one of the nice fine art prints from our artists!

The cover of the new Beyond II

The Artists

Beyond has selected ten gorgeous, award-winning artists to take part in this years edition.  Proudly we can announce that Anais Perry, Hayley Austin, Johanna-Maria Fritz, Ksenia Kuleshova, Lia Darjes, Luiza Folegatti, Maria Sturm, Sarah Pabst, Sissel Thastum and Snezhana von Buedingen will be featured in the 2018 edition of Beyond. By focusing on female photographers in this edition, we want to draw attention to the underrepresentation of women in humanistic photography. Beyond wants to give a positive, constructive example of extraordinary woman and by that open the discourse about woman in humanistic photography.

Photographers featured in Beyond II

 

The cover from the new Beyond comes from French photographer Anais Perry, who finds inspiration in cinema art. Fiction is her starting point to capture reality and to build a strange or an artificial atmosphere. In the presented work What remains at the end? Perry portrayed her two widowed grandmothers, whose life situations mirror one another.

Even though Johanna-Maria Fritz is one of the youngest participants, she already has a lot to show. Her featured work Like a Bird won among others the Inge Morath Award, one of the most renowned awards for female photographers. Like a Bird invites us to have a look at the circus culture of Iran, Afghanistan and the Gaza Strip, and makes us to rethink our preconceived image of these countries.

The next high-flyer of Beyond II is the Russian photographer Ksenia Kuleshova. Kuleshova just got selected as one of 12 participants of Joop Swart Masterclass in 2018. Her work ABKHAZIA is a portrait of a country caught in a two decade long slumber without no sign of waking in sight. It researches the everyday life of people who try to exist within uncertainty, within a system that doesn’t have a future and doesn’t seek one.

American artist Hayley Austin focuses on individual's relationships to one another and to their culture, and the way that these forces shape them. Austin's portraits show an amazing intimacy. Beyond will feature her work Narratives of Desire, which reveals carefully constructed sexual scenes made in collaboration with couples.

The photographs of our next participant almost look like paintings. Lia Darjes' pictures of small unofficial markets in Kaliningrad act between documentary and staging and by that creating a completely new genre. With Tempora Morte, Darjes is interested in finding out how the still life genre can be positioned today by means of classic references.

For Beyond II, visual anthropologist and artist Luiza Folegatti from Brazil did not photographed herself, but gave the camera to the women she wanted to learn more about. In Lo que elijo de mí misma – What do I elect from myself she did a three months photo workshop with Latin American women living in Berlin and helped them to express their personal stories through the camera.

Maria Sturm's new work You don't look Native to me already got a lot recognition in the photo scene. In her work about the unrecognised Lumbee tribe of North Carolina, Sturm engages an unfamiliar mix of concepts: a Native American tribe whose members are ignored by the outside world, who do not wear their otherness on their physique, but who are firm in their identity. Sturm's work is not giving a typical reproduction of Native Americans, but questioning and problematizing the identity crisis of her informants and by that creating a new image of her theme.

Argentinian based photographer Sarah Pabst, mainly focuses on women and identity topics, besides her personal intimate work. In her presented work Zukunft Papst is challenging the history of her German family. By mixing up archival material and current photographs, she is able to tell a story that probably wouldn't be possible to tell otherwise. In Zukunft the past and the present morph together into a new future.

Danish artist Sissel Thastum is co-founder of the non-profit art organisation The Independent AIR, which organises artist residencies in Denmark and internationally. In Beyond II she is showing her very personal story I am here when you are here. Through the nature, the landscape and the feminine form, her work mediates a close and intimate relationship between mother and daughter. By a very poetic picture language Thastum's personal work gets universal.

Characterized by an international background, Snezhana von Buedingen focuses on the exploration of people, culture, and life. In her portrait series Meeting Sofie, von Buedingen depicts the life of a nineteen year-old girl with Down Syndrome. With a very sensitive and dreamy gaze she shows Sofie's emotional world, perhaps not so different from our own.

 

The Team

The magazine’s text focusing on women in humanistic photography, will be authored by Miriam Zlobinski, the renowned art historian, photo-editor and curator. The layout and graphic design of Beyond II will be done by the esteemed Dutch graphic designer Emmy van Thiel of The Visual Theatre. The publisher and curator of Beyond is Juliane Herrmann. Juliane is a photographer herself and just published successfully her book "Man among Men" via crowd funding. The magazine will be printed on real newsprint by Rheinisch-Bergische Druckerei Duesseldorf. For both, the publisher and the printer it is a great experience to work together and to learn from each other.

 

Your Support

Beyond is published in English and will be distributed for free at photo festivals such as the "Lumix - Festival for Young Photojournalism" in Hanover and "Visa pour l'image - International Festival of Photojournalism" in Perpignan. To make this free distribution possible we are asking for you to support the publication by helping finance the printing costs. In thanks for your support you can choose between several perks. Please have a look on the right side to see if a copy of the magazine, a signed fine art print by one of the artists or a sponsoring package might be interesting for you.

 

More than a magazine

In addition to the magazine, there will be podium discussions in Berlin and Cologne where the participating artists, Miriam Zlobinski and other photographic experts will debate the position of women in humanistic photography. We are honoured to be working in cooperation with The Society for Humanistic Photography, which will host our podium discussion in Berlin. Each supporter of the crowd funding campaign will get a personal invitation to these discussions.

 

Beyond I

Beyond got initiated with the need to show variety and different approaches in humanistic photography. The first issue of Beyond was released in 2016 during Lumix Festival for Young Photojournalism. On a guerilla action the participants distributed Beyond at the festival area of Lumix. Within some hours many hundred copies of Beyond were spread. This action was a great success and called a lot of attention. All in all distributed 2000 copies at various festivals, and sent the newspaper to photo editors, galleries and museums. The artists of Beyond I used their shared network to reach as many industry and cultural leaders as possible. The result: Beyond I was represented in several exhibitions, received extensive media coverage, and helped the photographers included in its pages gain much deserved attention. We expect Beyond II to makes waves as we address a very topical issue and have invited an outstanding group of a young female photographers to participate.

Beyond at the guerilla slide show of Christoph Bangert at Lumix Festival in 2016

Beyond at Recontres d'Arles, 2016

Beyond at the Newsprint_Photobook exhibition at Dortmunder U, 2016

Beyond at the magazine of Rheinisch-Bergische Druckerei, 2016

 

We need you!

By becoming a contributor you are supporting a valuable initiative that enables young photographers to network and engage in creative cooperation. We believe that together we can be stronger, more effective and can achieve more recognition for female photographers.

 

Information on the printing

- See Beyond I

- Many magazines try to fake the newspaper style, Beyond is being printed on a real newsprints press with the highest and most modern techniques

- Like a real newspaper Beyond comes without binding and therefore also can be used as an open exhibition

- Size: 255mm x 350mm

- 48 pages

- Full colour printing (suitable for large format pictures)

- Edition of 2000 copies

During the printing of Beyond I at Rheinisch-Bergische Druckerei, 2016


Juliane Herrmann and Marie Köhler holding the first copy of Beyond,
coming fresh from the press, 2016

story:
I was a teen when I saw my friends disappear into a bathroom during a party in my native Chile: two lines of cocaine on a mirror, my friends on them. It has been thirty something years since my brother impeded me to try it and I left that bathroom. However, here I am writing these words.

I have traveled for 16 years in to the world of coca plants, a sacred plant to many but just cocaine to the world of drugs. I saw both the shaman connected with the creator God through the plant and the killer frowning like nothing when asked about his crimes. In between, the consumers that haven ́t murdered or robbed anyone. So, why this drug is so illicit? Which are the real reasons?

My invitation for you is to immerse yourselves into the jungles of Caqueta, where armed guerrillas roam free controlling the cocaine trade; into the habitat of the Muiru Muinai, deep in the Amazon jungle; and into the South Bronx in NY and see that there ́s people trying to help drug users with a warm greeting, outside the prison system.

Please help me to print this photo book and join me in the campaign for drug policy reforms and safer drug control.

 

Tan sólo era un adolescente cuando vi a mis amigos desaparecer de una fiesta hacia el baño en mi Chile, mi país nativo. La curiosidad me llevó a ver 2 líneas de cocaína en un vidrio, mis amigos encima. Yo quería probar y mi hermano me detuvo diciéndome “eso no es para tí”. Ya han sido casi treinta años desde que salí de ese baño y heme aquí escribiendo estas palabras.

He viajado por los últimos 16 años dentro del mundo de la planta de coca; una planta sagrada para muchos pero cocaína para el mundo de las drogas. Ví a un chamán conectarse con El Creador a través de la planta y también al asesino desapercibido cuando se le preguntaba sobre sus crímenes. Entre ellos dos, los consumidores que no han ni matado ni robado. Por esta razón me pregunto: ¿Por qué es esta droga ilícita? ¿Cuáles son las verdaderas razones?


Mi invitación para ustedes es de entrar a las junglas del Caquetá, donde las guerrillas de las FARC controlan libremente el mercado de la cocaína; entrar a las profundidades de la jungla amazónica en el hábitat de Muiru Muinai; y entrar al sur del Bronx en Nueva York para ver las asistencias dadas al consumidor aparte de su incriminación.

Ayúdame a imprimir este fotolibro y únanse a mi campaña para promover reformas de política de drogas y un control más seguro.

 

 

The Project

During long months working in the fish canneries of Alaska in 1996, I met pushers selling cocaine and other drugs to migrant workers. As a waiter in New York, I came home to find my roommate crazily sniffing the carpet, desperate for the last grains of coke he thought he’d spilled. I’d first become acquainted with the classic white lines on a mirror much earlier, however, at parties in the twilight years of the Pinochet dictatorship in my native Chile. But my real quest only began when I met a shaman deep in the Amazon jungle.  You see, South American indigenous communities revere the coca leaf as sacred. It’s ever-present at birth, marriage and death. The leaves are handed to friend or stranger as a simple greeting.

El proyecto

Durante largos meses trabajando en las enlatadoras de pescado en Alaska en 1996, encontré traficantes que vendían cocaína y otras drogas a trabajadores migrantes. Como mesero en Nueva York, recuerdo haber llegado a casa y encontrar a mi compañero de piso husmeando locamente la alfombra, desesperado por los últimos granos de cocaína que pensaba que había derramado. Sin embargo, me había familiarizado con las líneas blancas clásicas en un espejo mucho antes, en las fiestas en los ochenta años de la dictadura de Pinochet en mi Chile natal. Pero mi verdadera búsqueda comenzó cuando conocí a un chamán en la selva amazónica. Las comunidades indígenas de América del Sur veneran la hoja de coca como sagrada. La planta está siempre presente; en el nacimiento, el matrimonio y la muerte. Las hojas se entregan a un amigo o extraño como un simple saludo.

 

 

On one-level, “Coca: The Lost War” charts how the essence of the coca leaf transforms as it leaves the indigenous communities into cocaine at the hands of the white man. The blood-letting intensifies as the plant and the powder go on a journey the length and breadth of the Americas, a prime commodity that links remote jungles to the most populated cities. To some it’s a leaf to be worshipped. For others the semi-processed powder is a currency used to buy farm tools, a meal or hurried sex when cash money runs scarce in a hard-knock village. Some see snow-white cocaine as a means to power, money and respect. For the rest, a demon they must serve.

On a second level, my photographs aim at questioning the logic of the so-called “War on Drugs”. President Nixon launched that long before the Cold War ended and it endures even though the U.S. is now more intensely focused on its “War on Terror”. Prohibition, billions of dollars in counter-narcotics aid and thousands of dead have turned the “war on drugs” into a war-without-end. There is no victory in sight.

So, what is the answer? Should we treat cocaine solely as a health issue? Should we ramp up the war? Or is legalization with safer, strict control, the solution?

En un nivel, "Coca: la guerra perdida" muestra cómo la esencia de la hoja de coca se transforma en cocaína en manos del hombre blanco al salir de las comunidades indígenas. El derramamiento de sangre se intensifica a medida que la planta y el polvo emprenden un viaje a lo largo y ancho de las Américas; una mercancía primordial que vincula junglas remotas a las ciudades más pobladas. Para algunos es una hoja para ser adorada. Para otros, el polvo semi-elaborado es una moneda que se usa para comprar herramientas agrícolas, una comida o el sexo apresurado cuando el dinero en efectivo escasea en una aldea selvática. Algunos ven la cocaína blanca como un medio para obtener poder, dinero y respeto. Para el resto, un demonio al que deben servir.

En un segundo nivel, mis fotografías apuntan a cuestionar la lógica de la llamada "guerra contra las drogas". El presidente Nixon lanzó ésta mucho antes de que terminara la Guerra Fría y perdura aunque Estados Unidos ahora está más intensamente concentrado en su "Guerra contra el Terror". La prohibición consiste en miles de millones de dólares en ayuda antinarcóticos y miles de muertos han convertido la "guerra contra las drogas" en una guerra sin fin. No hay victoria a la vista.

Entonces, ¿cuál es la respuesta? ¿Deberíamos tratar la cocaína sólo como un problema de salud? ¿Deberíamos aumentar la guerra? ¿O es la legalización con control la solución?

 

 

The natural beauty of the habitat where the coca plant is found is awe-inspiring.  The drug underworld, too, has a dangerous charm – the money, the gangsters’ molls. In “Coca: The Lost War”, I aim to take you to places the inhabitants described as “the last corner before the end of the world”; to places where violence shows no mercy and where the way of life is simply no way to live.

La belleza natural del hábitat donde se encuentra la planta de coca es impresionante. El inframundo de la droga también tiene un encanto peligroso: el dinero, las amantes de los gangsters. En "Coca: la guerra perdida", intento llevarte desde lugares que los habitantes describieron como "el último rincón antes del fin del mundo"; a espacios donde la violencia no muestra misericordia y donde la forma de vida simplemente no es forma de vivir.

 

 

The Author

CARLOS VILLALON (Santiago, Chile 1965). I am a veteran photojournalist who’s has been working mainly in Latin America for 18 years now. I have worked for a long list of titles that include National Geographic, The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Boston Globe, The Washington Post, Time, Newsweek, CNN and Univision. In 2004 i published what would be the main body of this book in National Geographic magazine that run the story, "Cocaine Country", as a cover in 17 different languages. In 2005 I won an honorable mention for this story in the POYi contest and in 2010 I won second place in the World Press Photo contest for general news.  I have been based in Colombia since 2000.

CARLOS VILLALON (Santiago, Chile, 1965). Soy fotoperiodista, he trabajado más que nada en Latinoamérica por 18 años para una larga lista de títulos que incluyen National Geographic, The New York Times, The Wall Street Journal, The Boston Globe, The Washington Post, Time, Newsweek, CNN y Univision. En 2004 publiqué lo que sería el principio de este libro en la revista National Geographic que publicó la historia, "Cocaine Country",en su portada en 17 idiomas. En 2005 gané una mención honrosa por esta historian en el concurso POYi y en 2010 obtuve el segundo lugar en el concurso World Press Photo en noticias generales. He estado viviendo en Colombia desde el año 2000.

 

The Book

My quest, after more than 16 years, has culminated in “Coca: The Lost War”.

My book , in its 26 cm by 21cm format is a visual exploration, compiled of 73 color photographs, that span from the divine (Leaf) to the desperate and the deadly.

Esta búsqueda, después de más de 16 años, ha culminado en "Coca: la guerra perdida”.

Mi libro, en su formato de 26 cm por 21 cm, es una exploración visual, compilada de 73 fotografías color, que abarca desde lo divino (Hoja) hasta lo desesperado y lo mortal.

 

 

In my effort to respond to this questions, I bring you four essays each with a personal perspective. They intend to compell the complexities and diversity of the actors involved in this lost war. They’re contributed by:

  • Karl Penhaul, international journalist that accompanied me, guides us through the pain and joy we went through to understand the world of drugs.
  • Amazonian shaman Calitxo Kuiru, who guides us through the spiritual significance of coca to his community.
  • Ethan Nadelmann, the founder of The Drug Policy Alliance and one of the pioneers of the medicinal marijuana legalization in the U.S., explains to us why the war on drugs is lost.
  • Wade Davis, ethnobotanist and explorer from Harvard University and probably the world’s leading expert on the coca plant and its significance to indigenous communities, explains why we are not just going to lose the coca as the basis of  the drug but the way of living of these people.

En mi esfuerzo por responder a todas estas inquietudes que plantea el mundo de las drogas, les traigo cuatro ensayos cada uno presentando una experiencia personal. Estos textos tienen como objetivo presentar la complejidad y diversidad de actores involucrados en esta guerra perdida. Los colaboradores son:

  • Karl Penhaul, periodista internacional que me acompañó durante este proceso, nos guía a través de las vicisitudes y alegrías que debe pasar uno para comprender el mundo de las drogas.
  • El chamán amazónico Calitxo Kuiru nos guía a través del significado espiritual de la coca para su comunidad.
  • Ethan Nadelmann, fundador de The Drug Policy Alliance y uno de los pioneros de la legalización de la marihuana medicinal en los E.E.U.U., nos explica por qué la guerra contra las drogas está perdida.
  • Wade Davis, etno botánico y explorador de la Universidad de Harvard y el principal experto mundial sobre la planta de coca y su importancia para las comunidades indígenas, explica que si eliminamos la planta de coca, no sólo acabaremos con la droga sino con todas las culturas que adoran la planta.

 

 

Press

In English:

  • Presentation of the campaign at the BRONX Documentary Center

  • "The U.S. spent billions fighting coca in Colombia. Why hasn't it made a dent?" by Miami Herald

  • Review of the book by Colombia Calling 

En español:

  • Reseña del libro en Bio Bio Chile TV
  • Reseña del libro en Dirección de Asuntos Culturales (Chile)

 

What there's left to do

Funds raised will go to the cost of printing this book in a high-quality 21 by 26 cm format, with hardback cover on bond paper.

Printing and publication of the book also aims to stimulate fresh debate via social media and traditional media outlets about how to reframe the “war on drugs”.

 

El resto del proyecto

Los fondos recaudados se destinarán al costo de impresión de este libro en alta calidad de 21 por 26 cm, con tapa dura en papel bond.

La impresión y publicación del libro también tiene como objetivo estimular un nuevo debate a través de las redes sociales y los medios tradicionales sobre cómo replantear la "guerra contra las drogas".

story:
Made in Canada: An Exploration of the Canadian Identity

35, 000 kilometres. 13 provinces and territories. 6 months. 4 wheels. 1 woman.


[Colonel Samuel Smith Park - Etobicoke, ON]

What does it mean to be Canadian?

It's Canada's 150th anniversary of confederation this year and many of us are still asking - who are we? Over a six-month period in 2017 I plan to explore what the Canadian identity looks like across Canada through artistry and adventure, and try and answer the question 'What does it mean to be Canadian?'


[Highway 115 - Peterborough, ON]

Goals

My goal is to provide an authentic look at the experience of being a Canadian in 2017. Throughout the six months I will be photographing and documenting my travels and interactions through social media to create a photographic essay exploring the Canadian identity and how it is perceived and lived across the country.

Additionally, through the creation of an interactive online space (through social media) where people can contribute to the project as it progresses, I will be able to see Canada through the eyes of Canadians. By personally interacting with artists, explorers, and taste-makers across the country, I can identify and apply their input to create the 'Ultimate Canadian Experience', sharing the lesser-known, imaginative, and most special parts of our country.


[Six Mile Lake Provincial Park - Port Severn, ON]

On the Road

I will be driving through twelve provinces and territories, and flying to Nunavut (there is no road access) to have a complete picture of the Canadian landscape. Securing a vehicle and creating a mobile studio is integral to this project proceeding. Having the ability to freely move around in a mostly self-sustaining way allows me the most time to create content and explore different (and often more remote) communities on the most optimal schedule. Canada is the second largest country on Earth and most of it is only accessible by road or foot, so being as mobile as possible is the key to bringing the greatest amount of content to you!


[Pog Lake - Algonquin Park, ON]

Challenges Ahead

With a project of this magnitude and complexity there are bound to be challenges in store. The best way to face these challenges is to plan ahead and do my best to be prepared. Here are some of the key challenges I believe I will face while undertaking this project:

  • Vehicle Troubles

This one is the most likely to effect the progression of this project. Everything from flat tires, oil changes, running out of gas, or a rock in the windshield are all concerns. By setting aside emergency funds and being aware of basic vehicle maintenance (tire changes, etc.), we will be able to minimize the amount of time and funds spent in repair shops!

  • Production Issues/Connectivity

Canada is a very big place and very little of it is has wireless connectivity. Taking small steps such as using a wi-fi extender, preparing content for upload ahead of time, and planning ahead for which locations have available connectivity allows me to plan out my work and upload schedule, minimizing the time spent stationary.

Broken equipment is another issue that could come up. By having multiples of elements in the production process (a computer and a smartphone, etc.), allows me to temporarily continue with the content upload while things get fixed. Also, having back-ups and reserved content for such occasions also offers me the opportunity to not lose days while on the road!

  • Sharing the Journey

This is a key element of creating an interactive trip. While it is possible to create a road-map of local experiences through self-exploration, one of the parts I find most interesting is building relationships and meeting people who have greater knowledge of their local areas and personal crafts. Through relationships and connections I already have to people who live around the country, I can spread the message. You can also help in this by either contributing yourself, or sharing through social media!

  • Funds Needed

The budget for this project is high, but there are a variety of different resources that go into reaching this amount. Alongside my own personal savings, and this Indiegogo campaign, corporate sponsors that have shared values have been sought to balance out the cost of the trip!


[Tea Lake - Algonquin Park, ON]

With Your Support

If you believe in this project, there are three ways you can contribute and be a part of it coming to fruition!

  • Share the Project!

The absolute easiest way you can contribute is by taking a few moments to share this project with your friends and family to help spread the word. Share on Facebook, Twitter, other social media, or send an e-mail, however you choose! The more people who know, the more comprehensive this trip will be. It takes a village, and I would love for you to be a part of this one!

  • Join the Adventure!

Are you a Canadian artist or adventurer living and working in Canada? Do you own a Canadian business that works directly with, or supports, local artistry, culture, or tourism in Canada? I would love to connect with you, and possibly meet you and highlight your endeavours while on the road!

  • Support Us Directly!

The most direct and immediate way you can help to support this project is by donating directly. The cost of this project is substantial and there are a number of factors to take into account, so every nickel counts! You can contribute through this crowdfunding campaign if you're interested in the perks that are offered, or directly to the project via the PayPal donate button on the website!

Whichever method you choose, I am very thankful that you've come this far and have taken the time to read about this project!


[Sara La Selva, Photographer]

Artist Bio

Sara L. was born in Toronto, Ontario, and is currently in her final year as a Performing Arts student. With most of her life spent in various aspects of the arts and outdoors, her path has often led her to explore the creative and adventurous lives of others, as well as herself. Her first experience with photography was a dark-room film class she took in high school, and from then has been driven to explore this passion. In recent years she has travelled abroad a number of times to Europe, America, and around Canada, and this has only caused her to want to travel more. By combining her creative passion with her wanderlust, she is creating a space that offers something that benefits everyone - access.

If you have any questions or inquiries, feel free to get in touch!

-----

E-mail | paddleandpine@gmail.com

Website | Paddle and Pine

Instagram | @paddleandpine

Twitter | @paddleandpine
story_txt: Made in Canada: An Exploration of the Canadian Identity35, 000 kilometres. 13 provinces and territories. 6 months. 4 wheels. 1 woman.[Colonel Samuel Smith Park - Etobicoke, ON]What does it mean to be Canadian?It's Canada's 150th anniversary of confederation this year and many of us are still asking - who are we? Over a six-month period in 2017 I plan to explore what the Canadian identity looks like across Canada through artistry and adventure, and try and answer the question 'What does it mean to be Canadian?'[Highway 115 - Peterborough, ON]GoalsMy goal is to provide an authentic look at the experience of being a Canadian in 2017. Throughout the six months I will be photographing and documenting my travels and interactions through social media to create a photographic essay exploring the Canadian identity and how it is perceived and lived across the country.Additionally, through the creation of an interactive online space (through social media) where people can contribute to the project as it progresses, I will be able to see Canada through the eyes of Canadians. By personally interacting with artists, explorers, and taste-makers across the country, I can identify and apply their input to create the 'Ultimate Canadian Experience', sharing the lesser-known, imaginative, and most special parts of our country.[Six Mile Lake Provincial Park - Port Severn, ON]On the RoadI will be driving through twelve provinces and territories, and flying to Nunavut (there is no road access) to have a complete picture of the Canadian landscape. Securing a vehicle and creating a mobile studio is integral to this project proceeding. Having the ability to freely move around in a mostly self-sustaining way allows me the most time to create content and explore different (and often more remote) communities on the most optimal schedule. Canada is the second largest country on Earth and most of it is only accessible by road or foot, so being as mobile as possible is the key to bringing the greatest amount of content to you![Pog Lake - Algonquin Park, ON]Challenges AheadWith a project of this magnitude and complexity there are bound to be challenges in store. The best way to face these challenges is to plan ahead and do my best to be prepared. Here are some of the key challenges I believe I will face while undertaking this project:Vehicle TroublesThis one is the most likely to effect the progression of this project. Everything from flat tires, oil changes, running out of gas, or a rock in the windshield are all concerns. By setting aside emergency funds and being aware of basic vehicle maintenance (tire changes, etc.), we will be able to minimize the amount of time and funds spent in repair shops!Production Issues/ConnectivityCanada is a very big place and very little of it is has wireless connectivity. Taking small steps such as using a wi-fi extender, preparing content for upload ahead of time, and planning ahead for which locations have available connectivity allows me to plan out my work and upload schedule, minimizing the time spent stationary.Broken equipment is another issue that could come up. By having multiples of elements in the production process (a computer and a smartphone, etc.), allows me to temporarily continue with the content upload while things get fixed. Also, having back-ups and reserved content for such occasions also offers me the opportunity to not lose days while on the road!Sharing the JourneyThis is a key element of creating an interactive trip. While it is possible to create a road-map of local experiences through self-exploration, one of the parts I find most interesting is building relationships and meeting people who have greater knowledge of their local areas and personal crafts. Through relationships and connections I already have to people who live around the country, I can spread the message. You can also help in this by either contributing yourself, or sharing through social media!Funds NeededThe budget for this project is high, but there are a variety of different resources that go into reaching this amount. Alongside my own personal savings, and this Indiegogo campaign, corporate sponsors that have shared values have been sought to balance out the cost of the trip![Tea Lake - Algonquin Park, ON]With Your SupportIf you believe in this project, there are three ways you can contribute and be a part of it coming to fruition!Share the Project!The absolute easiest way you can contribute is by taking a few moments to share this project with your friends and family to help spread the word. Share on Facebook, Twitter, other social media, or send an e-mail, however you choose! The more people who know, the more comprehensive this trip will be. It takes a village, and I would love for you to be a part of this one!Join the Adventure!Are you a Canadian artist or adventurer living and working in Canada? Do you own a Canadian business that works directly with, or supports, local artistry, culture, or tourism in Canada? I would love to connect with you, and possibly meet you and highlight your endeavours while on the road!Support Us Directly!The most direct and immediate way you can help to support this project is by donating directly. The cost of this project is substantial and there are a number of factors to take into account, so every nickel counts! You can contribute through this crowdfunding campaign if you're interested in the perks that are offered, or directly to the project via the PayPal donate button on the website!Whichever method you choose, I am very thankful that you've come this far and have taken the time to read about this project![Sara La Selva, Photographer]Artist BioSara L. was born in Toronto, Ontario, and is currently in her final year as a Performing Arts student. With most of her life spent in various aspects of the arts and outdoors, her path has often led her to explore the creative and adventurous lives of others, as well as herself. Her first experience with photography was a dark-room film class she took in high school, and from then has been driven to explore this passion. In recent years she has travelled abroad a number of times to Europe, America, and around Canada, and this has only caused her to want to travel more. By combining her creative passion with her wanderlust, she is creating a space that offers something that benefits everyone - access.If you have any questions or inquiries, feel free to get in touch!-----E-mail | paddleandpine@gmail.comWebsite | Paddle and PineInstagram | @paddleandpineTwitter | @paddleandpine

story:
About Me

I’m Erin Nelson, a New Orleans based photographer, and I am producing a solo photography gallery show about disappearing landscapes. 

 

Concept

Growing up in Southeast Louisiana, and living through numerous disasters, I've always been intrigued with the concept of change. This has led to me looking at not only urban landscapes changing due to natural and human influence, but also what will happen to landscapes in nature. Recently, I was watching the news, and saw a sliding scale of what will happen to major coastlines when the polar ice caps completely melt. This has been the major inspiration and driving force for this photographic series.

I wanted to focus on landscapes that will be gone within the next 10-15 years, more than likely, sooner. Due to climate, and numerous natural disasters (weather and hemispherical shifting) and man-made disasters (such as urbanization, economic communal shifts, oil/chemical spills) , the landscape around us is forever changing and/or disappearing. This is an on-going series due to the essence of this subject matter.

Why is this important? It’s important because these photographs capture the last fleeting moments of these places. I will be bringing these landscapes that are usually difficult to get to into a public space where people can access them.

Here's Where the Funding is Going

I am asking you for $2,500 in funding for this series. The funding will be 65% project, 35% perks. I have chosen flex funding, so if I don’t make my goal, I will still produce the show with what funds I have received. Projected gallery show date is May 2017, but this is subject to change.

Series funding of 65% ($1,625) will be going to pay for printing the photographs on aluminum (11x14 and 12x18 inch sizes), and to produce postcards and postage to advertise the opening. The reason for printing on aluminum will help to preserve the photographs so they can withstand humid gallery conditions, but also to last for generations to come. The remaining 35% ($875) will go to funding the perks that will be available to you the backers. These perks help show you my appreciation for backing this project.

Please take a look at the perks list. I’m offering unique prints, photo sessions in two locations in the US, and all will include you on the Contributor’s List that will be listed on not only my website, but also on a special placard in the gallery during the exhibition.

If I surpass my goal, I will be adding stretch goals of other prints and photographic services.

The Impact

Unfortunately, we all know that landscapes change, but some of us are unfazed until we look at photos from years prior to these changes. I know from living in Louisiana, and dealing with hurricanes and oil spills, things can take drastic shifts quickly. This series gives visibility or visual aid to the effects of these shifts in communities, whether they maybe urban or in nature. In a way, the series is preserving instances in time through photography.  

With your donation, you will be supporting an artist with a desire to use her voice to help out a visualization to a growing problem.

Risk and Solution

With all projects and series, there will be risks and challenges.

If I am not funded, I will to resort to alternative methods of producing this show. I feel that there is one alternative, which is to print on photographic paper and mount on gator foam, but it will diminish the over all communication of the photographs. 

Other Ways You Can Help

While I know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • I ask that everyone to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Attending the exhibition 
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share with everyone you know!

*With your donation of any amount, your name (if provided) will be included on a Contributors List displayed on my website and in the gallery for my show to express my full gratitude.

story:
3 Months of Independent Journalism

This campaign is to cover the costs of the next 3 months of independent, objective journalism.

  • Providing an alternative to the standard, mainstream media
  • Covering stories which would otherwise go uncovered
  • Bringing you fresh, vital, on the ground reportage
  • Reportage to come from the UK, Europe, Russia and Donbass

The aim: to reach as wide an audience as possible, providing truthful, vital reportage, breaking through the information barrier.

story:
Who am I?

My name is Sophie Mayanne, I'm 24 years old and I am a photographer based in the Cotswolds, UK. For the past few months I have embarked on a personal project titled "Behind The Scars", which has already had an amazing response, with 60 people already taking part in the series. I want to photograph scars of all shapes and sizes, and share the incredible stories behind them.

Why Scars?

As a photographer, I have always been interested in photographing what society considers as "flaws" - and with this project I want people to see their scars in a new, positive light, and challenge you to think differently about your own skin, too! 

 

Beckie, Shanti, Ashleigh, Ronnie & Isabella for Behind The Scars. 

 

Why do I need you?

So far, Behind The Scars has been entirely self-funded, with 3 studio shoots taking place in London, UK.

Each studio shoot costs £150.00, so if fully funded, I could add 6 additional shoot dates in the UK, allowing me to focus on getting as many people as possible involved!

What is the goal of Behind The Scars?

The ultimate goal of the series would be to create a book, however before I reach this point, there are many more people to photograph for the series! 

 

Miriam for Behind The Scars. "When I was 9 I fell off a swing on holiday and broke my arm quite badly. Being in hospital on holiday was a pain, but I made friends with the other kids on my ward and we remained pen pals for sometime after. My scar doesn't bother me at all, I forget it is there until someone else brings it up. "​

Can I follow the series as it progresses?

Yes! The series will be regularly updated on my Instagram account, Blog and website where you can follow the project as it grows!

Can I be involved in the series?

Yes! If you would like to be involved in the series yourself, you can email me on sophiemayanne@gmail.com. 

Isabella for Behind The Scars. "In the summer of '15 I was in a house fire. My clothes and way of life up in flames. I spent my summer in a burns unit on Fulham Road. My scars and scar tissue continue to change, but I have never felt more beautiful."​

story:
Hi we are Alice, Giulia and ….. Giulia!  

Alice

<< Hi! I'm Alice, I'm 28 and I'm from Valdimontone Contrada in Siena. I have a bachelor degree in "Modern Languages, Literatures and Cultures" from Siena University and a master in "Translation, Mediation and Interpretation" from Bologna University. After the second degree I decided to come back to Siena because I missed my hometown, my family and my dogs! I want to stay and live where my roots are. I refuse to believe that the only way to find jobs is to leave Italy, like many other young people are forced to do nowadays. I took some courage and decided to create a project that reflects my job requirements and my personal interests. Now, I only hope that this story could have a happy ending! >>

 

 

 

Giulia V

<< Hi! I'm Giulia, I'm 29 and I'm from Valdimontone Contrada in Siena. I have lived far away from Siena for more than 10 years, to study and work. I got a bachelor degree in "Economics and Management" and a master degree in "Economics and Finance" from Luiss University in Rome, then I got a "Master in Finance" from Nova University in Lisbon. I just completed my PhD in "International Economics" from the Graduate Institute of Geneva. I have lived in Switzerland for over 6 years. During this time I missed my hometown a lot. I always knew that it wouldn't be that easy to find a job in Italy. So I tried to think outside the box. I asked myself what was missing in the tourism landscape of Siena. I searched for something totally new that could engage visitors in a different way, using an old passion of mine: the instant photography.>>

 

Giulia F

<< Hi, I'm Giulia, I'm 29 and I'm from Tartuca Contrada in Siena. After graduating from the Scientific High School, I studied "Medicine and Surgery" in Siena University. Even though my education and background are strictly scientific, I coulnd't resist to POLAROAD's call. This project let me re-discover my hometown from a new point of view. I have learned about historical and cultural aspects that I have always taken for granted, even if I have never left my hometown. So my two friends involved me in POLAROAD. What I love the most about this project is the goal of valorizing Siena and creating something that belong to us deeply connected to our motherland.>>

 

 

POLAROAD is our challenge! In an historical period when many people leave Italy to go abroad we want to stay! Everybody complaints that Italy is a place for old people where no opportunities are given to young ones. We want to prove it wrong, demonstrating that there is a space left also for us! We decided to invest in a young business which can enhance the beauty and cultural heritage of the town where we were born. We love Siena and we are deeply connected to it. Who, better than us that were born and lived here for so many years, can give you the best advice of what you can discover in it? 

How intimidating is it to navigate through a new city for the first time? Do you wish you knew some locals that could give you some local tips to better explore the place? POLAROAD is here for you! With a team of people that were born in Siena and know every little corner of it, we are developing a wide range of POLATOURS, self-guided tours which will make you grasp the real essence of this middle-aged city. You will learn not only the historical details, but, most importantly, all the stories which have been passed down from generation to generation within Sienese families. These tours may also be enriched by the rental of instant cameras which will make your experience unique and unforgettable, leaving you the most precious souvenir, the POLAGUIDE. The guidebook, which guides you around in the city, will become an album where you can store all the memories of your trip! 

Do you have kids and you are looking for a way to engage them in the discovery of Siena? POLAROAD is the right place for you! For every POLATOUR we provide a complementary POLAGUIDE tailored to kids of all ages. There will be puzzles to be solved, coloring pages, stories to be told and, of course, many pictures to be taken! Come, explore Siena with all your family… fun is guaranteed!  

 

 

Here at POLAROAD we don’t create simple tours, but POLATOURS.  

Tired of being a tourist and ready to become a traveler? Don’t waste any more time: decide the day when you want to do your POLATOUR, find the itinerary which better suits your interests choosing one of our POLAGUIDE and combine it with the instant camera that you like the most.  

Booking your POLATOUR online will be simple and free! Just one simple click! 

 

Come to take your POLAKIT a tour shop and let the POLATOUR of Siena begins!

We are three young women, we have big motivation and even bigger dreams, but we need your support to be able to start our business from scratch. Our goal is to establish a POLAROAD network all around the world with other young people ready to valorize their homeland. We want to make the POLATOUR a new experience in the landscape of tourism WORLDWIDE.  

 

Our unique perks! 

You can choose among different types of contribution. Every contribution is valuable as we are a start up! You can find here for the first time exclusive products which will be available in our shop once it will open up. Don't miss your opportunity to be the first one to receive them  comfortably at your house door.

The "I LOVE POLAROAD" t-shirt will only be available during this fundraising campaign...so don't miss it! 

The Impact

In a world which goes super fast where digital technologies are present in almost all aspects of our life we want to take a step back and try to savor the real essence of things like photography and travelling. We want to give our children the opportunity of taking a break from digital devices and looking at the world out there not through the screen of their smartphones. Instant photography gives us an opportunity for all of this. We would like to create a network of people worldwide which could offer a POLAROAD experience in their city and country. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please get the word out and make some noise about this idea and campaign! This is a completely new experience and people need to know about it in order to know whether they can like it or not.  

If you are interested in creating a POLAROAD point in your own city you can contact us directly at info@polaroad.it . We are just starting this business, but given that we dream big, we would like soon to expand to other cities in Italy and countries in the world! We started from our own city, where we have the sufficient knowledge to create interesting discovering guidebooks. We need your knowledge and collaboration to develop guidebooks about your city and country...so don't be shy!  

Thanks again!

Please get the word out and make some noise about this idea and campaign! This is a completely new experience and people need to know about it in order to know whether they can like it or not.  
If you are interested in creating a POLAROAD point in your own city you can contact us directly at info@polaroad.it . We are just starting this business, but given that we dream big, we would like soon to expand to other cities in Italy and countries in the world! We started from our own city, where we have the sufficient knowledge to create interesting discovering guidebooks. We need your knowledge and collaboration to develop guidebooks about your city and country...so don't be shy!  
Thanks again!

story:
What is BAWDY?

My name is Joy Bernal. I'm a NJ based photographer, wardrobe stylist, model, and I am the creator of BAWDY.

BAWDY is a photography based visual series that captures and illustrates emotions, experiences, or situations that are difficult to verbally express. These images are created and presented in a way that allows you and others to see, feel, and better understand what we can't fully describe with words. 

I wanted to build my brand in a way that would incorporate all the things I love to do: creating, while targeting one of the things I value most: communication.  

Through the series, we’re aiming to promote communication, perspective, and self-awareness, as well as provide opportunities for small businesses and local artists to present their work to the world.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach at least $3,000 to fund Season 1's production of BAWDY. Season 1 is made up of 5 Chapters that require a range of 1-3 photo shoots each for 10 models. Your contributions will be put towards:

  • Studio Space
  • Wardrobe
  • Props
  • Hair & Makeup
  • Season 1 Showcase Venue
  • Printed copies of BAWDY Season 1

...everything to get BAWDY started! As a thank you for your support, we want to give back to you with some BAWDY merch!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute, DON'T WORRY! We appreciate your support regardless! You can still help out by spreading the word and sharing our pages!

  • Indiegogo
  • Instagram
  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Website

story:
Rewards

Don't miss your chance to get your Talkie in 20 days after the end of the campaign ⇧⇧⇧ (limited quantity available), or select the amount of Talkies and get them before February 14 ⇩⇩⇩

How to use

We all love to caption photos on our Instagram and Facebook. Well, voice message takes it to the next level! It conveys the thoughts and feelings behind a picture so much better than printed text. Create a gallery of your best photos, enhanced with voice comments.

Bring joy to your loved ones with the added touch of a recorded message. Use Talkie to express greetings, an invitation, a declaration of love or just to say hello to your far away friend. Your voice means a lot to people for whom you are precious. Give them a moment to cherish.

In a few clicks

We are developing a user-friendly web service with the help of which you could order Talkie in a few clicks using any device.

  • Upload your voice message.  
  • Choose your photo. 
  • Fill the recipient's address. 

Done!

How to place Talkie

  • Hang on the fridge as a conventional magnet;  
  • Set on the table on the easel;  
  • Store in the box.

Warning! Let the children hold Talkie only under adult supervision. It has magnets and other small parts inside.

Team

By creating a service, we aimed to make the world a kinder, fill it with words of love. We invite you to become a part of our team and help us to spread our project among the people. Use Indiegogo sharing tools for it. Thank you!

Risks & Challenges

We have 6 years of experience with instant photo printing and have become proficient at streamlining the process to deliver the highest quality in fastest turnaround time. With the addition of Audio Recording technology, we have spent 6 months finding ways to optimize and accelerate this process as well. We feel confident in our preparation and eager to begin production before the end of the campaign to ensure prompt delivery. 
December is a difficult month for sending parcels, but we are poised and ready to be first in line. In any case, you will receive regular updates on the status of production and shipment of your Talkies.

story:
My name is Adam Gerlach. I have been a landscape photographer for over 20 years. Over the past year I have been grateful for the opportunity to envision and design a limited-edition book of my photographs with Andy Burgess, creator of Dark Spring Press, entitled Traces of Light. I am proud to now share the concept of my book of night photography with book collectors and photography enthusiasts through Indiegogo. Traces of Light provides a great way to collect two bodies of my work in one beautiful volume. 

For several decades I have enjoyed the process of creating fine art prints for exhibition and acquisition by collectors.  These prints are sold in limited editions and take many days, weeks, and sometimes months to create and are priced accordingly, consequently they are not accessible to collectors on a more limited budget . As my career has progressed, I have been searching for ways to share my work with a broader audience and have found the answer with this book project.

I am turning to the Indiegogo community to help me finance the completion of the Traces of Light book project. 

 

Details of the project:

Traces of Light contains two bodies of work in one elegant 10x12" coffee table book. The first part of the book contains 21 night road images, capturing the light trails from passing cars during long exposures. The remaining 34 images are luminous long exposure images of trees also photographed at night. All the images in the book are haunting, graphic, and minimalist.

 

Traces of Light Specs :

  • 55 black & white images
  • Dimension: 10x12” (approx. 25x30cm)
  • The First Edition of the book is limited to 450 copies and 50 of those are collector editions that come with a signed archival pigment print.
  • Foreword by world renowned photographer Michael Kenna.
  • Introduction by accomplished writer David Stroud.
  • Essay on the work written by Adam Gerlach.
  • Printed at Wilco in Amsterdam, a renowned high-quality printer of art books.
  • The book was printed on an 8-color Heidelberg Speedmaster press.
  • The paper used for the book is Gardapat Kiara paper made in Italy at a mill on Lake Garda. Weight 135 g/m2. The paper combines a high thickness with a velvet surface.
  • A spot tone varnish was added just on the photographs to make them pop and glow.
  • The book is covered in linen with an image tipped into the cover. 

 

 

Dark Spring Press:

  • Dark Spring Press is an Independent publisher that presents elegant, meaningful, small run, limited edition photography books
  • Dark Spring Press was founded in 2017 by Andy Burgess in Tucson Arizona
  • Dark Spring Press honors the collaboration between photographer, designer, and printer to create beautiful books with high production value and collectability

 

Goals of this campaign:

It has been my responsibility to provide the majority of the funding for Traces of Light and I've gotten far with the project thus far. All I need now is to raise the money to finish the project and get the word out.

By backing my Traces of Light Indiegogo campaign,  you are helping to make these final steps possible. 

Signed books and prints will be delivered in time for the holidays in December.

 

A Sneak Peak at a few spreads from Traces of Light :

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Examples of Australian Tea Tree Images from

Traces of Light :

 

 

Examples of Roadway Images from

Traces of Light :

 

 

Examples of Bristlecone Pine Tree images from

Traces of Light :

 

 

Risks and Challenges:

The risks for this Indiegogo project are mostly my own. There is no risk to the backers of this campaign and you have the chance to acquire this beautiful limited-edition photography book.

If you buy a book through this Indiegogo campaign they will ship out along with other rewards in December 2020.

 

Some Rewards to Say Thank You:

story:
My name is Dee Von Drasek and I'm hoping to grow my small business, DVD Photography. In order to do so, I need to buy a lens and new computer. Unfortunately, my computer is outdated, slow, and cannot keep up with running Photoshop and Illustrator.

I'd love to photograph weddings and content for magazines! That is my dream! In order to do so, I also need to purchase a new lens, as the one I have isn't fast or clear enough. The lens I'm hoping to purchase is a Tamron 150mm-600mm.

I attended Alverno College where I worked hard to receive a photography scholarship. I graduated in 2012 with a B.A. in Graphic Design. Since graduation, I have been photographing families and am grateful for all of the wonderful people I've already been able to work with.

Feel free to look at my photography website! www.dvdphotographywi.com

I appreciate any and all help! Thank you!

story:
What is the Legacy Project?

The Legacy project is a fascinating not-for-profit endeavour to capture the mystifying stone remains of prehistoric sites scattered across the British Isles. Ancient stone circles are a remarkable legacy of Neolithic Britain, their shadowy origins stirring the hushed whispers of fables and legends throughout the ages.

Escape with Jason Friend on an eloquent photographic journey that pays homage not only to the prehistoric remnants of a lost civilisation, but to the soul of a landscape immersed in mystery and wonder - a journey that aims to raise public awareness of these precious ancient monuments, and to assist in their preservation for future generations.

The Legacy project is the realisation of an idea that was inspired many years ago - it was Jason’s early visits to these sites that sparked his initial desire to learn photography. Spellbound by the power these archaic stone remnants wield across the landscape, Jason longed to capture the essence of these mysterious locations on film. This would take him on an incredible journey that would eventually lead to a career as a renowned professional landscape photographer.

Moving beyond a mere appreciation of the aesthetic, the aim of The Legacy Project is not simply to record the physical structure of these stone circles, but to instil a complete emotional experience which conveys the ethereal nature of these megalithic sites. Through this photographic journey, Jason wants the ancient spirit of the landscape to wash over you – for you to think, to feel, to imagine what once took place where the stones remain.

In order to capture the stark and dramatic tone of these mystical landscapes, the project is being shot entirely in black and white using a mixture of infrared film, and infrared converted digital cameras. Traditional photography equipment will also be used to produce images taken during extreme long exposures (sometimes exceeding 10 minutes) to portray a sense of passing time, hinting at the trove of secrets the stone circles have held throughout the ages.

To date, the Legacy Project has led Jason along a fascinating path of discovery across the stunning British countryside, including visits to historical sites in the Orkney Islands, Western Isles, Isle of Arran, Oxfordshire, Wiltshire, Derbyshire, Cumbria, and Northumberland. 

The Funding

I am looking to raise funds to help finance my next few trips (including a planned trip to the Republic of Ireland), and also to help finance the creation of an interactive iPad & Android App which will showcase these sites and the images I have made at them. The App will almost be a developing book, as I continue to visit new sites I will be regularly updating the app.

Another objective of raising the funds through Indiegogo is to help make the Legacy Project a self sustainable project. As I said before, I am not undertaking this project to make money but also I can not continue to afford the raising costs of travelling throughout the British Isles. The plan is to reinvest every penny made through sales of the ebook, app, greeting cards and prints to not only fund future trips but also hold a series of exhibitions throughout the UK. The first of these exhibitions was recently held at the prestigious Joe Cornish Gallery in Northallerton and was considered a great success. 

In order for me to help achieve these goals, I am hoping to raise at least £500.

The Ireland Photography Trip

For a while now I have dreamed of visiting Ballynoe and a number of other Irish sites including the mystical Ancient Temple of Newgrange. In his book ‘Rings of Stone ‘, Aubrey Burl suggested that Ballynoe Stone Circle may have had direct links with Swinside Stone Circle in Cumbria. He suggests that there may have been a prehistoric sea route from Dundrum Bay (2 miles from Ballynoe) to Duddo Sands on the West Coast of Cumbria. It can not be denied that there are distinct similarities in the construction of Swinside and Ballynoe, which is incredible if you consider that both sites could have been constructed by the same people who had to travel the Irish Sea in prehistoric boats some 5000 years ago.

The Rewards

I am offering a number of rewards for everyone who supports the project including your name in the ebook, a selection of Fine-Art Greeting Cards and signed A4 & A3 Giclée Photographic Prints. 

Risks & Challenges

Ultimately the major risk to this project is lack of initial funding for the next stage. Without it, it can not become a self sustainable project and my aim to visit over 300 UK prehistoric sites will not become a reality.

However, there are no real ongoing concerns once the project has received funding. Perhaps the only concern would be the British weather but thankfully these monuments have survived for over 5000 years and I am more than happy to wait for the perfect conditions.

Keep The Mystery Alive...

By pledging towards the Legacy Project, you will be helping to raise public awareness of these incredible megalithic sites, and to assist in their preservation for the benefit of future generations. If you don't wish to support the project financially but would still like to help then please do consider sharing this campaign with your family and friends.

story:
Hi 


I am usually more asserted to paying my own way or working overtime to get money i need like i done last year (12/13 hours a day for 8 months) to buy my lights & attachments,  but this opportunity has come up to be part of a one off course and it's just too good and too short notice to save up! Unfortunately my bank won't help as they gave me a big loan to pay for a new boiler already. So, this is where i decided to turn to this kickstarter style , i found myself thinking noone would be interested, but i'll shortlist the things why you think it would be good to put me, someone you know on this course.
The biggest attraction in the course means anyone i work  with (could be you) during September - January 2016 that has contributed to this funding has a chance to be seen by Nick Knight and many other industry experts from all across the field incuding the biggest editors of the fashion magaines,  so that's cool! it's all eyes on us!

Here is the brief they have set so far:

The course starts in September 2015 and will run until January 2016. It is run entirely online. It will give you access to videos, live Q&As and online discussions and also give you the chance to get yourself and your work in front of Nick Knight and a line-up of art directors, fashion directors and more. The syllabus is below, but is subject to change as more details are confirmed:

    • Getting started and Nick’s story

    • Understanding the Industry

    • Breaking into the top of the industry

    • Perfecting Production

    • The art of Collaboration

    • The shoot

    • Editorial vs Commercial

    • Mastering Post Production

    • Presentation & Licensing

    • Fashion In Motion


What i Need & What You Get

The course cost £1250 and i am hoping to raise £900 to gain access to it as i will have the rest of the funds from working overtime & some photography tests, i am asking anyone to contribute who feels they have personally or their company has gained financially or exposure as a result of my imagery for any reason in the past i am of course most blessed & obliged for your support.  Anyone else of course willing to assist in this kickstarter if you are just a fan of my work or a very good friend, thankyou!
For contributors £20-£50 are elligible to receive 2 7x5inch prints or 1 A4 print of each image i produce for the course.
For contributors £50-£75 are entitled to a free portrait / fashion session at my studio.
For contributors £75 plus are entitled to all of the above plus to feature in one of the assignment images for the course viewed by all the industry insiders & Nick Knight himself.


  • The information i will learn on this course is as valuable to the people i work with in the future as it is to me as you will see me utilise the skills & knowledge i will have picked up from Nick's life long career. 
  • This is something i'm not likely to do again as i believe in paying my own way in this world but like i said it's so short notice to raise funds and if you would like to contribute my heart goes to you & thankyou :)
So, i hope we can make it!! & that you all benefit from stronger images, better editorials & advertising campaigns.  Thankyou :)

story:
1000 Cars of NYC...

...is a photo book by Lionel Koretzky, designed by DoThings and published by Damiani. This is an attempt to raise funds demanded to the author (myself) to co-finance the publication of a 1st edition of 1500 books.

I am a French still-life photographer specialising in cars, watches, jewelry and fashion accessories. As far as I remember, cars have always been a deep passion, collecting miniatures as a kid, knowing everything and dreaming about them. In 2013 I started shooting cars in NYC where I lived at the time, repeating a single crop and point of view, posting pictures on Instagram, creating a body of work that raised attention among art directors and publishers. I eventually agreed to contract with Damiani who will publish the book in the Fall of this year, promote and distribute it worldwide. 

The budget raised during this campaign will finance my own buyout of 500 books which is a usual practice when publishing new comers' first editions (this is my first book :)) The author and the publisher agree upon a certain number of books to be purchased by the author as garantie, both parties participating in the production and promotion financial effort. In return for your contribution to mine, I will offer 450 signed books as rewards , among other perks (one being an awesome large poster!). 1st edition books are highly collectable, often gaining value as time goes by and new editions are released.

Technical: Smith sewn, hardcover; size of 15,9x15,9 cm, 6 ¼” x 6 ¼”; 288 pages of single cars and grids; printed 4 colors + varnish on coated matt paper 170 grs.

Budget: publishing agreement: 19,500 EUR + poster, photo prints & packaging 3000 EUR + 10% campaign fees and transfers: 2,050 EUR. TOTAL = 24,550 EUR any extra will go towards sales tax and a party for the launch of the book. THANK YOU !!!

story:
My name is Pablo Medina and I was born and raised in Mexico City. When I was 14 years old, I had the opportunity to immigrate to the United States, and have been living here ever since. I am now 24 years old and, although I am still legally viewed as a non-resident alien of this country, in many ways, I consider this place my home.

I have been fortunate to have experienced the egalitarian ideals of the American Dream - equal rights and opportunity for all – and have tried to make the most out of the invaluable opportunities I have been given through honest, hard work and dedication. While I believe that the American dream is still a reality, and that the United States remains the envy of the developed world, I have also witnessed the daily challenges that often come with being an underrepresented minority and an immigrant in this country.

With that in mind, and through The Melting Pot Series, I would like to shine a positive light on the beauty and power of this country’s diversity by featuring unsung heroes from underrepresented backgrounds and immigrant communities, who are breaking down barriers in the United States of America.

This summer I will be celebrating 10 years of my arrival to the U.S. and would like to do so by successfully launching this project!

As part of this campaign, and with your support, I would like to put together and distribute a photography book featuring some of these special people, as well as their stories, and, ultimately, organize an exhibit. By doing so,  I hope to raise awareness for important social issues such as immigration and the importance of diversity an inclusion.

ALL proceeds will go to programs and organizations that support the development and empowerment of people from underrepresented backgrounds and immigrants. (To be announced shortly!)

You can find some of my work on Facebook @LifeofPabs, where I am constantly working on promoting open minds and new experiences through photography :)

story:
It is about the talent

Talent will be the single biggest determinant of growth within an organization.
Beyond infrastructure, data, energy, all the things we thought used to grow business.
We failed to realize it’s the individuals that you have, in your business, that surround you, that you work with, that are in your network, that single biggest human talent is where disruption comes from.

Invest in Talent

Brant Bonin Bough
SYNERGY GLOBAL FORUM NEW YORK 2017
 

 

 

 

What has been a three-year plan is now about to start on its two-year minimum project.

Created to showcase people with a strong craft behind them, bringing strength in creativity, business and social / economic awareness together in five editions and two photo books a year.

The Pitch: https://issuu.com/theportfoliomagazine/docs/the...

The magazine: https://issuu.com/nathanazopardi9/docs/theportf...

(Images below from the Pitch, link above)

https://issuu.com/theportfoliomagazine/docs/the...

"Guest writers shall be invited to help create content.
Audio/Podcasts and video content shall be available from the third edition"

The magazine is very photo-centric in a way that I want you to stop and take time to read the interviews, read the image! Link to their work, be inspired and help inspire others while just stopping and taking it in!

Jeg spørger om dine interaktioner og penge over de neste 30 dagene, så jeg kan fokusere de neste to årene på tidningen.

The magazine shall focus on interviews/portraits of a mix of people from 15-year-old poets to founders of Apple to musicians and directors.

Also documenting events that have something to say while I look deeper at why and how the projects/events are created.

Testimonial#2

“Of our 5 senses, sight can compel us to act in a fraction of a second; impactful images can generate deep emotions and everlasting memories. Nathan’s craftsmanship as a visual artist moves us, he leaves us marked - his photography transports us into a mental sanctuary where we leave our reality behind and enter the one he’s created for us to experience. It’s pure instant magic. “

Katy Yam, Marketing & Communications Director, Element AI

Summary 

  • My name is Nathan, I am founder and Photographer of The Portfolio Magazine.
  • From a three year plan to one year of making sure this can be done to now doing it.
  • Treating my Photography as if it is a tech business.
  • Create a scalable business from photography and my interest in tech and Freakonomics/Economics/Growth.
  • Documenting others in how they have created or are creating a business around their craft.
  • Creating this magazine is ten years in the making of wanting to document as honest and as raw as possible.
  • Wanting to show how many amazing people there are while grounding it into a strong visual document.
  • When you look at the magazine you see what inspires me, people, projects, events that either inspire or play a part of something further down the road.

(Images below from the magazine)

  • I am looking to reach a minimum of 30,000 euro. Costs include:
  • the magazine shall start on the Issuu platform.
  • Digital by the first and second edition, print-ready by the third edition (print versions of first and second edition shall be made available to a select amount of funders) and then as back order.
  • Equipment.
  • camera:
  • Lenses: 
  • Lights: 
  • Microsoft Surface laptop for heavy editing while on location.

You can help by Funding and/or sharing the campaign with your networks.

  • This shall start as a two-year project that puts true craft at the forefront that will both show how important craft, business, creativity, stubbornness, music, the spoken word, images, talking, listening, taking risks, asking others for advice, giving advice is to where we are at this moment. 
  • I chose to take this path, I chose to create something by seeing how many people I met within totally different projects had the same drive to create, grow, inspire, learn, change.
  • My want to push forward with this has allowed me to create something that does allow others to both sit back and take the time to read and learn from other people experiences.
  • making sure that offline reading was possible for people traveling.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • If you are not able to help in a monitory way, please make noise and share the campaign.
  • over the next two months, I shall also be working on paid projects so if you know someone who would need or benefit from my skillset. please pass on my info or connect us!.
  • it is easy enough to share using the Indiegogo links.

This shall start as a two-year project that puts true craft at the forefront that will both show how important craft, business, creativity, stubbornness, music, the spoken word, images, talking, listening, taking risks, asking others for advice, giving advice is to where we are at this moment. 
I chose to take this path, I chose to create something by seeing how many people I met within totally different projects had the same drive to create, grow, inspire, learn, change.

story:
Why is this project important ?

The Republic of South Sudan is the youngest nation on earth and was founded in 2011, separated from what is now Sudan in the north. It is an Eastern-African, landlocked country of the size of France with approximately twelve million citizens consisting of more than 60 tribes. Shortly after it's foundation, in 2013, a civil war broke out, mainly between the two major tribes of the president and the vice-president. The country lacks almost every aspect of a functioning infrastructure: roads, electric grid, health care, education and modern communication. Many international aid organizations are present to overcome food shortages, health crises and help build basic infrastructure. The Northern Bar El Ghazal region has been so far, unlike other regions of South Sudan, spared from the atrocities of war, internal mass displacement and food shortages. The pictures show the busy daily life, and the optimism of these pictures may enflame hope that this young country will able to stand up. With the support of this campaign, you will be able to obtain a fine reprint of the first edition, or a photo poster, or come to an exhibition, but most importantly, you will will help raise the awareness for a country which is one of the poorest country in the world and has the most challenges to overcome to change into a functioning society.

As of now, the production costs per book are approximately $120.- The higher the volume printed, the lower are the costs per book. The proceeds of the campaign will allow funding of the first edition of the book. It can then be distributed to galleries, book stores and other venues for sale to interested audiences at a significant lower sale price, and allow printing of additional editions.

A few pictures can be previewed here: South Sudan Pictures on Vigun Website 

Challenges

The challenges of the project is to communicate to supporters how difficult it is to take pictures in this country,  to travel there, but also how important it is to raise awareness for countries which are not on our direct radar screen.  Right now, the US Department of State give a Level 4 travel advisory: Do not travel to South Sudan due to crime and armed conflict. Violent crime, such as carjackings, shootings, ambushes, assaults, robberies, and kidnappings is common throughout South Sudan, including the capitol, Juba. If one does an online search, mostly pictures of refugees and soldiers can be found. There is hardly any photographic documentation of  a "normal" daily life.
