story:
A WORD ABOUT MYSELF

My name is Masha Tatarintseva.  I am a video artist. In my most recent work, I have been exploring issues of mixed immigrant self identities, and women rights. I am fascinated by intimate miniature work for the audience of one as well as large spectacles for stadiums. Born in St Petersburg Russia, I spent my formative years in Pittsburgh, where I spent a lot of time playing make-belief about becoming a cowgirl, being a cross cultural ambassador and all the improbable things I will grow up to do

WHY I’M DOING THIS PROJECT

Two reasons:

  • Last summer when I came home to Pittsburgh, a big stack of old photos was all that was left after my parents returned from my grandmother’s funeral in St Petersburg, Russia.  I looked through the old photos where I only knew about 20% of the people, mainly, my grandparents.  I realized that the family of people who came before me are total strangers to me, yet I look like them and possibly have their mannerisms and personality.  This installation is my attempt to reconnect with these people whom I never met and never will meet. 
  • I have not had opportunities to design theater and immersive work as much as I would like.  So, I decided to bring to life my own designs.  This is my second  self produced large scale project.  

WHAT YOUR SUPPORT WILL HELP TO ACHIEVE:

I need to raise $4500 to cover the costs of making this installation possible.

Your support will help me to cover the costs of turning my photographs into  physical three-dimensional backlit pieces that will be arranged to make an  immersive installation space complete with original music score, lighting design, interactive projection and opportunity to view all of the physical photography pieces that make up the photograph series.

  • cover cost of renting Automat Art Space for a week ($800)
  • design fee for Julian Valdivieso, compose, who is creating the sound scape
  • design fee for Chu-hsuan Chang, lighting designer, who will transform the space with light
  • costs of lighting and video projection equipment ($500)
  • the cost of printing and installing each of the 20 LED backlit photo prints ($2000)

WHAT YOU GET

Each person supporting this fundraiser will get a variety of original and custom made works of art.  Everyone donating at the $120 level or greater will be taking home an original high quality backlit LED print.  The technology for these prints is made by a Utah based small business who's printed boxes are of exquisite clarity and quality. 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

There are no big risks or challenges for this project.  I have a lot of experience managing, designing and executing sizable creative projects.  I am very excited to be working with my long-time collaborators, Julian Valdivieso and Chu-hsuan Chang, and produce this installation at Automata Art Space, an organization run by my former CalArts faculty, Janie Geiser and her collaborator Susan Simpson.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help me get the word out by sharing this campaign with your friends and collaborators. Every bit counts towards making this project a reality.

story:
Last 100 copies of Daily Portrait Berlin Book are available on: http://dailyportrait.bigcartel.com






You can buy the Daily Portrait Berlin Book on http://dailyportrait.bigcartel.com





Thank you to all the Backers! You are great! ❤
The Daily Portrait Berlin Book goes to print! :) More info coming soon.





Daily Portrait Berlin Book is now the 9th most funded photo book in the history of Indiegogo! :) Thank you to everyone who bought a book or a poster or donated to the project! Thank you to everyone who has spread the word about campaign! You are great! :)

Unser Dank gilt allen, die ein Buch oder ein Poster gekauft oder für das Projekt gespendet haben! Danke auch an alle die geholfen haben die Crowdfunding Kampagne bekannt zu machen! Ihr seid großartig :)







HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?
Funds will be used for production costs (print, tax, indiegogo fees) and shipping.



“One of the best parts about coming to Berlin is the opportunity to meet new people. Berlin has so many wonderful people living here or passing through. And for a lot of people who visit or live here, this is what makes the city special to them. The openness, the diversity, the beauty of the difference.” 
I HEART BERLIN about Daily Portrait Berlin
 




You can read about DP Berlin in:
Süddeutsche Zeitung, Berliner Zeitung, Tagesspiegel, Jádu/Goethe-institut, Berlin loves you, Stern, The Huffington Post, Bild, Konbini, Brigitte, Il Mitte Berlino, Mitvergnügen, Berlino magazine, Lolamag, Qiez, Kultmucke.de, F5, Tportal, Capital, Liveberlin, Amy&Pink, Lidovky, GoodImpact, Radio Fritz, Noizz, Photonews, Boredpanda, Ze.tt ...


DP Berlin official website:
http://dp4.portraitdaily.com

DP Berlin on Social media:
Twitter, Instagram, Flickr, Vimeo





Every day a new person, a new photo. All of them in the nude or seminude. Would you also be photographed by a stranger?





Now, after two years of intensive work, we are ready to publish Daily Portrait Berlin Book, featuring 381 unique portraits of naked Berliners in their homes.





ABOUT THE BOOK
Today's time-controlled by social networks defines who we are, how we should live and how we should feel. We are overwhelmed with the beauty ideal defined by advertising campaigns and films which are translated into capturing stylized selfies.

With Daily Portrait Berlin, we want to show people in an authentic way, while at the same time encouraging real-life connections and interactions- away from social media and the digital world- and create a community where people in Berlin can meet without prejudice and fear and be who they are, without censorship and predefined attitudes.

DP Berlin is a tool to get to know people, let go of their fears, challenge themselves, have a new life experience, and basically strip in front of a stranger.





You can have fun discovering the stories of strangers you would have never met. 
You can examine the shelves in the kitchen. See what book the tattooed girl is reading. Be surprised by the huge piano in the apartment of an athlete. Laugh over humorous decorations. Notice the artistic compositions on the walls created by creative people feeling inspired.  It shows Berlin apartments that reflect the personality of their owners. It shows how people truly are-in the nude- in their true living space. It shows an array of emotions; happy, silly, shy, serious, concerned, uncertain and sometimes even a bit weird.

 



BOOK DESIGN
The book, whose dominant color is yellow, brings 430 pages of photographs interspersed with quotations from the participants.  The portraits will be published in chronological order. Some portraits will be published on a single page, some other on a double page spread in order to properly show details. The book is a comprehensive form of visual storytelling an deliver an authentic mosaic of Berlin inhabitants.


The Graphic Work of Marek Kučera sensitively working with all the photographs.


Readers will also find the Photo manual.





HOW IT WORKS?
Daily Project Berlin is a participatory exploration of the identity of modern Berliners. The concept is simple: 1 camera and 381 Berliners. 

For example: Marie takes a photograph of John (naked) in his apartment. Marie gives John the camera and now John has to take a photo of Will (naked) in his apartment the next day. The photo shoot takes place at the model’s homes. The whole body has to be captured on the photo. Those who want can be naked, otherwise in underwear. And the stories goes until 381 photos are made.





This concept proved to be a positive tool for social interaction and a great way for people to challenge themselves and breaks down barriers. It allowed people to become comfortable with themselves and with each other, and create a community.





DP Berlin is a project that unites people regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, material wealth or racial or national affiliation.





DP Berlin creates moments of unexpected encounters and stories that are captured in photographs, with many random encounters, moments of surprises and what happens when two strangers meet. Through this project, everyday people experience being a model and a photographer.





Photos show the dialogue between the photographer and the model. It demonstrates that photography is also a communication tool regardless of the artistic background of the photographer. In some ways, DP Berlin is an artistic project and also a social experiment, and it results in a mirror of society. You can start your own DP Berlin in your city, or just read the book. It's up to you.









THE FOUNDERS
Daily Portrait is an original idea of Martin Gabriel Pavel. Martin started his project in Prague in 2015 where he photographed one topless person per day. With his portraits, he captured the city of Prague through the perspective of its young open-minded inhabitants.

Now with Daily Portrait Berlin, Martin teamed up with photographer and designer Marek Kučera who offered to collaborate. Just like the participants in their project, Martin and Marek were also strangers at first. However, through this project, Martin and Marek developed a friendship, just like the 381 participants in their project, and are now an active creative duo working in Berlin.





HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?
Funds will be used for production costs (print, tax, indiegogo fees) and shipping.





Thank you to all who supported the project :)








BOOK SPECS.
Size: 25 x 31,5 x 5cm / Soft Cover
Pages: 434 (incl. Cover)
with high quality print finishing
Printing technology: Offset





DELIVERING DATES
Orders will be shipped till June 2017.






POSTER
Size: 83x112cm
Material: 250 g/m2
Printing technology: Offset
Edition: 1000 Copies







THE DAILY PORTRAIT BERLIN BOOK + THE DAILY PORTRAIT PRAGUE BOOK (SET)





THE DAILY PORTRAIT PRAGUE BOOK
365 photographs, portraits of people, shot inside the Prague city, on Polaroid Camera by Martin Pavel in 2012-2013, Published in 2014, photo dimension: 108mm x 86mm

story_txt: Last 100 copies of Daily Portrait Berlin Book are available on: http://dailyportrait.bigcartel.comYou can buy the Daily Portrait Berlin Book on http://dailyportrait.bigcartel.comThank you to all the Backers! You are great! ❤The Daily Portrait Berlin Book goes to print! :) More info coming soon.Daily Portrait Berlin Book is now the 9th most funded photo book in the history of Indiegogo! :) Thank you to everyone who bought a book or a poster or donated to the project! Thank you to everyone who has spread the word about campaign! You are great! :)Unser Dank gilt allen, die ein Buch oder ein Poster gekauft oder für das Projekt gespendet haben! Danke auch an alle die geholfen haben die Crowdfunding Kampagne bekannt zu machen! Ihr seid großartig :) HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?Funds will be used for production costs (print, tax, indiegogo fees) and shipping.“One of the best parts about coming to Berlin is the opportunity to meet new people. Berlin has so many wonderful people living here or passing through. And for a lot of people who visit or live here, this is what makes the city special to them. The openness, the diversity, the beauty of the difference.” I HEART BERLIN about Daily Portrait Berlin You can read about DP Berlin in:Süddeutsche Zeitung, Berliner Zeitung, Tagesspiegel, Jádu/Goethe-institut, Berlin loves you, Stern, The Huffington Post, Bild, Konbini, Brigitte, Il Mitte Berlino, Mitvergnügen, Berlino magazine, Lolamag, Qiez, Kultmucke.de, F5, Tportal, Capital, Liveberlin, Amy&Pink, Lidovky, GoodImpact, Radio Fritz, Noizz, Photonews, Boredpanda, Ze.tt ...DP Berlin official website:http://dp4.portraitdaily.comDP Berlin on Social media:Twitter, Instagram, Flickr, VimeoEvery day a new person, a new photo. All of them in the nude or seminude. Would you also be photographed by a stranger?Now, after two years of intensive work, we are ready to publish Daily Portrait Berlin Book, featuring 381 unique portraits of naked Berliners in their homes.ABOUT THE BOOKToday's time-controlled by social networks defines who we are, how we should live and how we should feel. We are overwhelmed with the beauty ideal defined by advertising campaigns and films which are translated into capturing stylized selfies.With Daily Portrait Berlin, we want to show people in an authentic way, while at the same time encouraging real-life connections and interactions- away from social media and the digital world- and create a community where people in Berlin can meet without prejudice and fear and be who they are, without censorship and predefined attitudes.DP Berlin is a tool to get to know people, let go of their fears, challenge themselves, have a new life experience, and basically strip in front of a stranger.You can have fun discovering the stories of strangers you would have never met. You can examine the shelves in the kitchen. See what book the tattooed girl is reading. Be surprised by the huge piano in the apartment of an athlete. Laugh over humorous decorations. Notice the artistic compositions on the walls created by creative people feeling inspired.  It shows Berlin apartments that reflect the personality of their owners. It shows how people truly are-in the nude- in their true living space. It shows an array of emotions; happy, silly, shy, serious, concerned, uncertain and sometimes even a bit weird. BOOK DESIGNThe book, whose dominant color is yellow, brings 430 pages of photographs interspersed with quotations from the participants.  The portraits will be published in chronological order. Some portraits will be published on a single page, some other on a double page spread in order to properly show details. The book is a comprehensive form of visual storytelling an deliver an authentic mosaic of Berlin inhabitants.The Graphic Work of Marek Kučera sensitively working with all the photographs.Readers will also find the Photo manual.HOW IT WORKS?Daily Project Berlin is a participatory exploration of the identity of modern Berliners. The concept is simple: 1 camera and 381 Berliners. For example: Marie takes a photograph of John (naked) in his apartment. Marie gives John the camera and now John has to take a photo of Will (naked) in his apartment the next day. The photo shoot takes place at the model’s homes. The whole body has to be captured on the photo. Those who want can be naked, otherwise in underwear. And the stories goes until 381 photos are made.This concept proved to be a positive tool for social interaction and a great way for people to challenge themselves and breaks down barriers. It allowed people to become comfortable with themselves and with each other, and create a community.DP Berlin is a project that unites people regardless of age, gender, sexual orientation, material wealth or racial or national affiliation.DP Berlin creates moments of unexpected encounters and stories that are captured in photographs, with many random encounters, moments of surprises and what happens when two strangers meet. Through this project, everyday people experience being a model and a photographer.Photos show the dialogue between the photographer and the model. It demonstrates that photography is also a communication tool regardless of the artistic background of the photographer. In some ways, DP Berlin is an artistic project and also a social experiment, and it results in a mirror of society. You can start your own DP Berlin in your city, or just read the book. It's up to you.THE FOUNDERSDaily Portrait is an original idea of Martin Gabriel Pavel. Martin started his project in Prague in 2015 where he photographed one topless person per day. With his portraits, he captured the city of Prague through the perspective of its young open-minded inhabitants.Now with Daily Portrait Berlin, Martin teamed up with photographer and designer Marek Kučera who offered to collaborate. Just like the participants in their project, Martin and Marek were also strangers at first. However, through this project, Martin and Marek developed a friendship, just like the 381 participants in their project, and are now an active creative duo working in Berlin.HOW WILL THE FUNDS BE USED?Funds will be used for production costs (print, tax, indiegogo fees) and shipping.Thank you to all who supported the project :)BOOK SPECS.Size: 25 x 31,5 x 5cm / Soft CoverPages: 434 (incl. Cover)with high quality print finishingPrinting technology: OffsetDELIVERING DATESOrders will be shipped till June 2017.POSTERSize: 83x112cmMaterial: 250 g/m2Printing technology: OffsetEdition: 1000 CopiesTHE DAILY PORTRAIT BERLIN BOOK + THE DAILY PORTRAIT PRAGUE BOOK (SET)THE DAILY PORTRAIT PRAGUE BOOK365 photographs, portraits of people, shot inside the Prague city, on Polaroid Camera by Martin Pavel in 2012-2013, Published in 2014, photo dimension: 108mm x 86mmhttp://portraitdaily.com/dp2/book

story:
The Idea

I want to get into nature (way into nature) for great photography opportunities and to be inspired by the adventure:

  • I'm a filmmaker and photographer currently living in the mountains of North Carolina. The love of sharing beautiful things with others is slowing taking over my life. 
  • My campaign will bridge a gap that has appeared in my funding of this adventure.The photos that I will share and the emotion that comes with them will be the product of this endeavor. 
  • What will be accomplished by throwing some dough into my campaign you ask. Well, it will make the adventure possible and with enough funding it will fund the gear to upgrade my equipment thereby increasing the quality of my photos. 

 

What I Need and What You Get

Here is what I need:

  • To eat while on the trail and stay at a hostel every so often to charge my batteries and scrub some of the stink off. If I raise enough I will be upgrading some of my photography gear.
  • What will you get. Unique works of art! I love taking photos that make me feel some thing. The photos I take will be made possible by you and I will be sharing them with you. There will be a book of my work from the trail with my best photos from my time in North Carolina. Check out the descriptions for the different levels to see what I am offering.
  • What will happen if I don't reach my goal? I'm going to go as far as I can with what I have and what you give. This is a dream and it value to me is immense. I've sold some of my prize possessions to make it happen so I am going no matter what. "Do or do not there is no try" Yoda

Why

I hope to inspire you in some way shape or form.  Be it through beauty of nature or the adventure of the hike I want to move you some how.

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world
  • You have most likely seen my work before. If not don't take my word for it go check it out.
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

What are the risks of this undertaking? They are many. One in three that start the A.T. will finish it. injury is a very real possibility. Hiking 20 to 30 miles a day with 30 too 40 pounds on your back in rough and wild terrain can be hard on the body and doing it every day for 5 months can be hard on the mind. Being exposed to the weather and climbing into higher altitudes can also be a risk and a challenge. Ticks, snakes, mosquitos, poison ivy, and bears oh my. Gear does not like water and it will rain sometimes for days on end.

  • Living in the mountains of North Carolina has taught me a good bit about how to stay safe in the woods. 
  • I feel prepared to embrace the weather with the gear I've researched and collected.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute it doesn't mean you can't still help me with this endeavor.

  • Help me get the word out to people..
  • Share my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Mail me food.

And now into the wilderness I go.

I'm a filmmaker and photographer currently living in the mountains of North Carolina. The love of sharing beautiful things with others is slowing taking over my life.

What will be accomplished by throwing some dough into my campaign you ask. Well, it will make the adventure possible and with enough funding it will fund the gear to upgrade my equipment thereby increasing the quality of my photos.

Here is what I need:

To eat while on the trail and stay at a hostel every so often to charge my batteries and scrub some of the stink off. If I raise enough I will be upgrading some of my photography gear.
What will you get. Unique works of art! I love taking photos that make me feel some thing. The photos I take will be made possible by you and I will be sharing them with you. There will be a book of my work from the trail with my best photos from my time in North Carolina. Check out the descriptions for the different levels to see what I am offering.
What will happen if I don't reach my goal? I'm going to go as far as I can with what I have and what you give. This is a dream and it value to me is immense. I've sold some of my prize possessions to make it happen so I am going no matter what. "Do or do not there is no try" Yoda


Why
I hope to inspire you in some way shape or form.  Be it through beauty of nature or the adventure of the hike I want to move you some how.

Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world
You have most likely seen my work before. If not don't take my word for it go check it out.
Make it real for people and build trust.


Risks & Challenges
What are the risks of this undertaking? They are many. One in three that start the A.T. will finish it. injury is a very real possibility. Hiking 20 to 30 miles a day with 30 too 40 pounds on your back in rough and wild terrain can be hard on the body and doing it every day for 5 months can be hard on the mind. Being exposed to the weather and climbing into higher altitudes can also be a risk and a challenge. Ticks, snakes, mosquitos, poison ivy, and bears oh my. Gear does not like water and it will rain sometimes for days on end.

Living in the mountains of North Carolina has taught me a good bit about how to stay safe in the woods. 
I feel prepared to embrace the weather with the gear I've researched and collected.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't contribute it doesn't mean you can't still help me with this endeavor.

Help me get the word out to people..
Share my campaign using the Indiegogo share tools!
Mail me food.

And now into the wilderness I go.

story:
La idea general era poder ver de primera mano los caminos, gentes y paisajes existentes entre Arauca y Puente de Boyacá, tratando de mirar lo que queda hoy físicamente de esa historia y cómo es el imaginario actual de los sucesos de hace 200 años, comparando ese pasado con este presente, así como distinguir lo más posible el contenido sensorial que hay entre esos dos puntos, entendiendo esto en  el hecho de que usar la propia fuerza para desplazarse es entender, en carne propia, la dimensión de una subida, la dificultad de una superficie, el significado de 10 kilómetros. Ir en bici era escuchar las voces y el sentimiento de los seres que habitan en medio de esos 800 kilometros que recorrieron las tropas en 1819.

Usar la bicicleta para viajar permite una mirada distinta a la que se puede obtener haciéndolo por otros medios. Completar rutas que se suponen reservadas al movimiento encima de máquinas que nos llevan con rapidez a un lugar usando tan solo la fuerza de las piernas, yendo despacio –muy despacio en nuestro caso- es conseguir hacer del camino un destino en sí que se deja mirar en alta definición.

Pero más allá de los relatos gloriosos y prístinos de buenos contra malos, nos encontramos con contradicciones situadas que impiden consolidar como un credo la idea de Nación: una frontera cerrada entre Venezuela y Colombia por la que hoy un Bolívar venezolano solo podría pasar ilegalmente junto con otros miles de sus compatriotas, para ser sospechoso de pobreza y por tanto de cada cosa mala que ocurre por donde vaya, ya ni qué decir de venir a armar revoluciones y subversión como la que hiciera en su tiempo. Héroes indígenas difuntos por homenajear en su rebeldía y bravura mientras se aporrea con gases y bolillo a indígenas vivos por su misma rebeldía y bravura ante los mismos reclamos de los tiempos que hoy se conmemoran con discursos y placas. Discursos y placas lustrosas en lugares donde difícilmente llegan las mulas.

Reclamos centenarios ante un centralismo rampante representado en la ausencia de agua potable, alcantarillado, luz eléctrica, vías decentes que solo aparecen en la medida que nos acercamos a los centros de poder. Reclamos de habitantes centenarios de territorios que hoy se encuentran ad portas de ser expulsados por decreto y sin negociación por parte de un sistema de gobierno que al tiempo les pide patriotismo y colombianidad mientras negocia con multinacionales títulos mineros. Tal vez, se pregunta uno, si la cosa no era finalmente los españoles en el poder, sino el poder en manos de quién no sabe de necesidades, ni le importa solucionarlas si eso no lo beneficia en su gula.

El relato particular del día a día de este viaje lo hicimos en redes sociales y ha sido compilado en un libro de viaje que hemos llamado "Bicientenario: la libertad pendiente".

Este libro ha sido construido a través del registro fotográfico, junto con una crónica del viaje y de los análisis posteriores que nos suscitó éste con el fin de dejar memoria visual y etnográfica del color y las formas absurdas del paisaje, junto a la sonrisa y los pesares de toda la gente que nos acogió y se detuvo un rato para compartir con nosotros su pedazo de panela, una cerveza, una esquina, un poquito de su ser. La gente que existe más allá de los titulares y la fama. La gente real que construye cada día, contra todo pronóstico, un país posible.

Es la impresión y difusión de este libro la que invitamos a apoyar a través de este crowdfunding.

 

Les viajeres

María Johana Cadavid Mesa

Antropóloga, pueblerina y feminista… Del mismo modo en el sentido contrario. Me gusta la profundidad de lo cotidiano, los sirirís, los árboles de flores amarillas y leer en voz alta.

IG: @airamcatellus
Blog: cantosdesiriri.wordpress.com

Nelson Cárdenas Ferreira

Fotero todo tiempo, escribidor de cuando en vez. Bobo desde 1968. No perfore el envase.

IG: @cantarranasur
Blog: cantarranasur.wordpress.com

Pablo Porras Chacón

Hacedor de profesión, viajero de convicción, conservado por descripción, toma fotos de pasión y mamador de gallo de religión.

IG: @pabloporras2121
Blog: pabloporras.com/

 

El Libro

Un libro de de 16 x 22,5 cms con aproximadamente 150 páginas a color, tapa semidura, papel brillante y cosido a lomo abierto.

 

Lanzamiento del libro

El lanzamiento del libro incluirá: presentación del proyecto, exposición fotográfica, venta y entrega de libros que incluirá aguadepanle con queso.

3 de Agosto de 2019. 5:00 p.m.
Teatro La Candelaria, Cl. 12 #2-59.
Bogotá, Colombia.
teatrolacandelaria.com

 

Contacto

María Johana Cadavid
e-m: airamcatellus@gmail.com
Cel: 311 3784724

Nelson Cárdenas
e-m: nelsoncardenasfoto@gmail.com
Cel: 313 8031266

story:
About the Author

A native of Albany, Georgia, Kofi A. Oliver began making experimenting with Super-8 and video projects while a student at Florida State University. Kofi also attended Loyola Marymount University’s highly competitive MFA program in film as well as screenwriting studies at UCLA.

I took up photography about seven years ago and have come to merge this obsession with my passion for travel. I am curious about the world and strive to capture unique, intimate, and, visually stimulating images. This Cuba photobook is the first in a series of "Wanderlust" projects I envision.

The Project

Your contribution will help continue my exploration of Cuba, a country which I have had the pleasure of photographing in three separate journies over the past year and a half. Each visit has brought me so many touching and magical moments to photograph I feel compelled to continue to explore this wonderful island. Up to this point, I have self-financed the project but feel the need at this time to seek assistance in spending more time in the country. I am scheduled to travel in December to the far Eastern region of Cuba through the provinces of Holguín, Santiago de Cuba, and Guantánamo. Future travel will include other provinces as I plan to present the breadth of the country in pictures as comprehensively as I can.

What We Need & What You Get

As this trip will include travel over a much larger area of the country than I've tackled before, the expenses I will incur will be greater. Your contribution will help cover the following:

  • Air and ground transportation to and around Cuba, lodging, and food for at my next two to three visits to the country over the next six months. 
  • Printing of the initial 250 copies of the book.

The Perks!!!

To show my thanks, we’ve created a variety of perk levels, including the photo book itself when published, high-quality prints of my your selection of many of the photographs in my portfolio, and credits in the book.

The most important perk is my gratitude for believing in my vision and my photography! I've worked countless hours making this project a reality to this point, with so many much more time and effort needed going forward it is great to know it is appreciated. Thanks!

And keep in mind even if the entire goal isn't met, I will continue to work on the project to its completion. It will just take much more time.

The Impact

With the relationship between the United States and Cuba in such flux, I feel it's more important than ever to provide a glimpse into, what is still largely a closed-off world, particularly to the people of the U.S. I also serve as an ambassador of sorts to the people of Cuba in that my photography seeks to tell their story and give some access to their world. They are a wonderful people and I wish more people had the opportunity to get a chance to know them and their country through my images and words.

Risks & Challenges

If you've visited Cuba you know it requires a fair amount of effort to uncover it's treasures. Trapped in time-warp, travel to Cuba necessitates at times, a great deal of patience and ingenuity. I've visited the country three times up to this point and have learned how to navigate throughout the country and connect with its people. These encounters have provided me with a great amount of fulfillment and so far some of my best photographic work

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't able at this time, I understand but please feel free to share this link!!!

story:
As an artist, I've won numerous contest and awards, published in scores of articles and installed several exhibitions for public and private presentations. My formal education includes an AA,  BFA and MA (Within Fine Art Photography). Providing inspirations through environmental fine art photography in Venice-Los Angeles and graphic arts for the past 53 years has been my main focus in life. 


This campaign allows the upgrading to adequate camera equipment that meets the important standardized needs for developing high quality imagery. Obtaining this equipment will contribute immensely toward reaching acceptable levels of artistic excellence. 


Creating original imagery is innovative. Sharing them with an audience is the ultimate reward. My images prompt visual imaginations' and isolate moments about everyday life’s experiences as they rise to capture the awareness of one’s insight and vision. This equipment will assist in developing high quality photography, increasingly presenting ideal images to viewers they address in the future.     


This combined equipment consists of a: Canon EOS-5 DsR / 50 mega-pixel full frame-digital camera, Canon EF 24-150 mm f/ 4-22 zoom lens, and a Sigma 150-600 mm f/5-6.3 zoom lens. Budgeted at approximately $6,000, this equipment will be discount purchased from Samy’s Camera Store in California. 


Whether slight or generous this subsidy is gratefully appreciated as an aesthetic inspiration. If the entire goal is not attained presently the collected funds will be kept in a restricted goal-achieving bank account until enough resources are obtained to raise the appropriate amount. 

 

Supporters receive "Perks" as gifts of autographed reproductions chosen from my most popular images displayed in the "Gallery" above or from my current websites at either: www.rvmann.com or www.rvmann.biz. Please click on the thumbnail icons to expand the images and accompanying text.


If contributions are not possible at this time your considerations and acknowledgements of my work are encouraging and vital to achievements in the arts.

 

Thank you,

Richard Mann
story_txt:
As an artist, I've won numerous contest and awards, published in scores of articles and installed several exhibitions for public and private presentations. My formal education includes an AA,  BFA and MA (Within Fine
Art Photography). Providing inspirations through environmental fine art photography in Venice-Los Angeles and graphic
arts for the past 53 years has been my main focus in life. 

This campaign allows the upgrading to adequate camera equipment
that meets the important standardized needs for developing high quality imagery. Obtaining this equipment will contribute
immensely toward reaching acceptable levels of artistic excellence. 

Creating original imagery is innovative. Sharing them with an audience is the ultimate reward. My images prompt visual imaginations' and isolate moments about everyday life’s experiences as they rise to capture the awareness of one’s insight and vision. story:
I am in the planning stage of setting out on a tour of the mountains of the western U.S. to photograph these majestic ranges with my boxer Kody. I plan to hit the different ranges of the Rockies in Colorado, Wyoming, and Montana, as well as the Sawtooth range in Idaho. Depending on funds we may try to hit the Cascades as well. I'm looking to build my outdoor portfolio, as well as give Kody a great experience while he's still healthy and young enough (he has lived with cancer for 3 years so far). Unfortunately we have incured some vet bills that have eaten away some of the money set for this endeavor.

What I am looking for with this campaign are funds to help with gas, food and lodging along the way. We will be donig a lot of camping, with the occasional hotel stay. Anything above the set goal will be put towards photo and camping gear upgrades that will allow for better images and ability to reach those places few will ever see. 

The perks that I am offering are in the form of either specific prints, or store credits for the online store set to my Smug Mug page, Shadowandlightphotography.smugmug.com, to be used towards the purchase of items of your choice. The prints will come from a professional print house, that offers a variety of items.

Help me not only give a big boost to a career doing what I am passionate about, but also give Kody an incredible experience while he is still healthy enough to enjoy it. We will also be chronicling his adventures along the way for a separate project.

If you can't contribute at this time please pass this campaign on to friends who may be interested. Also I will have prints and other products available on line soon.

story:
“ASPECTS OF BEAUTY” – a Nephilim MaxxPix photo series

The current culture surrounding the female form has becoming troubling. Mass marketing still pushes a very niche beauty reliant on heavy modification with makeup and Photoshop, to say nothing of the restrictive body type at the forefront. That is what this photo-series confronts.  

Simply put, this crowd-funding is to shoot a photo-series with the goal to showcase that every body type, from plus-size to petite, with a realistic light and minimal makeup, has the potential for beauty. In addition to using diverse models, the wardrobe will be acquired from chain retailers, such as Walmart or Kmart, to continue the more realistic approach. All of these elements will be brought together to demonstrate that women of any body type can be a practical model on a commercial level.

The crowdfunding is primarily to pay the locally-picked models, the wardrobe and studio space for the shoots. Additionally, a small percentage will go towards creation of the Nephilim MaxxPix website to host the galleries. 

Q&A

As this is a socially conscious project, I’ve taken the time to talk with different sources and here’s the most frequently asked questions that may cover some of your own:

What exactly is this? 
As stated, the baseline is a photo-series that will focus on showing that women of any type can be a model without needing to be Photoshopped or heavily made-up.

So like Victoria’s Secret model? 
No. While there’s a large market for women in revealing outfits and lingerie, this series is from a commercial modeling standpoint. That means that it’d be more akin to advertisement modeling with less attempt made for sex appeal.

Who are you? 
I am A.J. Carey, the event photographer for Nephilim MaxxPix. You can see my photography work on Facebook (XXXXXX), which is a selection of my personal and professional work.

Of course there’ll be more questions but I’ll answer them to the best of my ability when asked!

There are Stretch Goals that not only allow for additional photo-shoots, but an expansion of the premise to encompass male models as well.

$4,000 – In addition to the six photoshoots with six different models, reaching this Stretch Goal will allow for the six models to do each photoshoot (i.e. each model would do a photo-shoot in business attire, in casual, etc,). This Stretch Goal brings a new dimension to the shoot, with a clear comparison between each body type and each clothing choice.

$6,000 – This Stretch Goal allows me to do a parallel photo-series in the same vein yet with the clear distinction that it will be with male models. Just as with the previous Stretch Goal, this adds an extra layer to the whole premise, as well as bringing up another very limited view from the modeling community.

$8,000 - If this goal is reached, in addition to all previous goals, there will be a special photo-series that mimics popular modern advertisements that have come out. 

$10,000 – This is basically my miracle Stretch Goal and it just means that I’ll be able to put a down payment on permanent studio space. It’s a personal goal, I’ll be honest.

Throughout the campaign, I’ll continually update with additional information, such as more promo photos and more! 

Want to contact me? Email me at nephilimmaxxpix@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

My name is Dominick Lewis and I am a West Palm Beach based photographer and the owner of Palm Beach Photo Studio. I started photography in 2012 right around the time I graduated from high school and it's become an obsession ever since. I moved around a little bit between Philly and New York but finally came back to South Florida in 2014. That's when I noticed the amount of young raw talent in Palm Beach County but with no room for growth and no place to develop that talent. I am building Palm Beach Photo Studio under the principle that we must save and nurture the young artist and give them a space they can call their "home". By contributing to this campaign you would not only be helping build Palm Beach Photo Studio from the ground up but also bringing the arts back to West Palm Beach, FL.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to build Palm Beach Photo Studio into the best photography in South Florida by your contribution. Our goal is to raise $5000 in 31 days to go towards renovations, equipment and legal fees. Donate whatever you're able to give but starting at $20 there is a unique incentive at each price level to you, the contributor, for helping us reach our goal. If we don't reach our goal by the end of the 31 days the money will still go towards necessary costs to get us up and running by January 2016.

The Impact

It's about time West Palm Beach got a photography studio open to the public so everyone regardless of how much you're willing to spend can have access to professional equipment and be in the presence of other artists like themselves. Palm Beach Photo Studio will host weekly photography and business workshops, networking events(aka game nights), and also monthly art showcases so everyone can join in on the fun. Regardless if you're a photographer, make-up artist, stylist, creative director or someone who just enjoys art. Palm Beach Photo Studio is just the beginning to what West Palm Beach has to offer.

Risks & Challenges

One of the biggest obstacles we face right now is building a 20-foot cyclorama wall into our studio. This will be the most expensive cost to our studio as we must hire a contractor, carpenter, and painter to make sure our space safe and professional looking.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monitarily to our campaign help us get the word out across the city by sharing this campaign on social media or simply by letting your friends know that there a new creative studio on the block and we're here to stay. Thank you

story:
Vielen Dank für Eure Unterstützung! Außerhalb von dieser Plattform haben wir unser Ziel erreicht! Vielen Dank an alle Unterstützer!

For the English-language-version please scroll to the bottom!

ES WEHT EIN NEUER WIND...

 ...denn wir haben Europas wohl erste autark arbeitende Beleuchtungsanlage auf Windenergiebasis entwickelt. Wir wollen das Klima retten, Licht ins Dunkel bringen und bieten eine kostengünstigere Alternative zu klassischer Straßenbeleuchtung. 

Unterstützt uns, damit wir der Elektronik den letzten Schliff geben und endlich in Serienproduktion gehen können.

PROCEED 1 Windgenerator

       

So fing es an

Angefangen hat es vor ca. 18 Monaten in meiner eigenen Garage. Ich, Peer Langemak, arbeite als Beleuchtungsplaner und wurde mit meinem damaligen Partner von vielen Kommunen immer wieder nach autarken Insellösungen im Außenbereich wie Bushaltestellen, P&R-Plätze oder Fahrradwege angefragt. Aber auf dem Markt gibt es keinen Anbieter, der zuverlässig eine fertige Lösung bieten kann. Solarlichtmasten gibt es zwar, aber auch diese müssen an ein Stromnetz angeschlossen werden. Der Grund ist folgender und ganz einfach: In Nordeuropa scheint meistens dann, wenn Licht gebraucht wird, keine Sonne. 

Also habe ich mit meinem Bruder und Freunden die Idee ausgearbeitet und habe relativ schnell mit der Arbeit begonnen. Zum Broterwerb arbeite ich als Beleuchtungsplaner u.a. für verschiedene Fernsehshows. In den letzten Monaten habe ich fast jede freie Minute, viel Geld und Energie in die Entwicklung der Prototypen und in die Messungen investiert. Erst in meiner Garage, dann in einer angemieteten Werkstatt in Wahlstedt, Schleswig-Holstein. Die Messungen haben wir "unkonventionell" auf dem Dach meines Autos ausgeführt.


Modernste Technologie, der Zeit voraus

Der PROCEED I Windgenerator arbeitet dank des speziell entwickelten Savoniusrotors schon ab Windgeschwindigkeiten von 3 m/s mit äußerst geringen Wirkungsverlusten zuverlässig und völlig lautlos. Er benötigt keine Nachführung der Windrichtung und ist besonders für bodennahe Luftschichten geeignet, da er auch in Verwirbelungen arbeitet. Er ist selbstbremsend, zusätzlich mit einer Sturmsicherung ausgestattet und damit sogar für die Windlastzone 4 geeignet. Ausgerüstet ist er mit einer Vulkan V3630 LED Leuchte, einem Timer mit Dimmerprofil und Lithium Akkus, die für eine extrem lange Lebenszeit sorgen. Der noordforce PROCEED I verfügt über 60Ah Akkukapazität und kann nach vollständigem Aufladen bis zu 10 Tage ohne Wind autark arbeiten.  

Unzählige Einsatzmöglichkeiten

Die Einsatzgebiete für den PROCEED I Windgenerator finden sich überall dort, wo eine Beleuchtung notwendig aber kein Anschluss an ein Versorgungsnetz vorhanden ist oder ein Neuanschluss zu kostspielig wäre und natürlich überall dort, wo eine saubere, umweltfreundliche und nachhaltige Alternative gesucht ist. Das gilt häufig für Bushaltestellen oder Fahrradwege genauso wie für Industrieflächen, Parkplätze oder Parkanlagen.

 

Nachts ist dunkler als draußen

Denke einmal an die ländlichen und strukturschwachen Regionen bei uns und am besten weltweit: Unbeleuchtete Fahrrad- und Gehwege zwischen Dörfern und Siedlungen; weite Areale in Afrika, Südamerika und Australien, die wenn überhaupt, mit lauten, qualmenden Kraftstoffgeneratoren versorgt werden. Wo noch: Flugplätze im Outback, Schutzhütten im Gebirge, die Lodge auf der einsamen Insel. Alternative Lösungen für Innenbeleuchtung gibt es viele - aber nachts ist es eben dunkler als draußen. Es sei denn, man hat eine PROCEED 1, die flüsterleise und autark die dunkelste Nacht erhellt.

Der Markt ist bereit

Unsere langjährige Erfahrung mit kommunaler Außenbeleuchtung zeigt, dass immer häufiger autarke Insellösung gefragt sind, gerade weil Kommunen sparen müssen. Solche Lösungen werden bisher nur durch Solarmasten angeboten, die aber wiederum "zur Sicherheit" doch an das lokale Stromnetz angeschlossen werden müssen. Die Erfahrung besonders in Norddeutschland zeigt allerdings, dass in den Monaten, in denen Licht benötigt wird, die Sonneneinstrahlung nicht ausreicht. Weiterhin wurde die Anfälligkeit gegen Verschmutzung, Vandalismus und Diebstahl beklagt. Relativ schnell wurde klar, dass Sonne nicht die Lösung ist. Die Lösung ist...Wind! 

Wir gehen von einem Markt von ca. 4-5000 Masten Deutschland- und mindestens 20.000 Masten Europaweit aus. 

Wie viel kostet eine Anlage?
Eine Anlage wird um die 3000,- Euro kosten. Zum  Vergleich: Die Installation einer neuen Beleuchtungsanlage ("Straßenlaterne") kostet eine Kommune inkl. Erdarbeiten und Verkabelung um die 5000,- Euro.

Wir sind bereit zur Serienproduktion - und DU?

Die Versuchsreihen waren erfolgreich, die ersten Prototypen stehen bereits. Doch bisher ist jeder Mast reine Handarbeit. Die Elektronik muss noch weiterentwickelt und durchgeprüft werden. Wir haben zwar eine Haftpflichtversicherung aber noch keine Zertifizierung. Die Mechanik steht, aber wir wollen Formen und Werkzeuge herstellen lassen, um auch hier in eine Serienproduktion zu starten! 

Unterstütze uns und Du bekommst einen unserer echt coolen Perks (die wir immer noch erweitern) und trägst zur Klimarettung bei!

Wir werden für den Perk für 500,- Euro pro später verkauftem Mast 50 Cent an ein Regenwald-Wiederaufforstungsprojekt spenden. Im Laufe der Kampagne stellen wir Dir dieses Projekt noch genau vor!

Wenn mehr Geld zusammenkommt, haben wir außer "grünem Licht" die Möglichkeit auch Zusatzteile wie einen Bewegungssensor, eventuell eine Handy-Ladestation oder einen Notrufknopf z.B. für die Nutzung in Nationalparks oder auf entlegenen Parkplätzen mit anzubieten. 

Self-sufficient Outdoor Lighting with the Proceed I Wind Generator
Green light to save the climate

Endless expanses, far and wide not a soul and the last hint of civilization quite a few hours ago. But over there, isn’t there a gleam of light? And then: The latest technology in rugged nature, a LED - illuminated place in the wilderness, countless kilometers away from a supply network.
Think of rural and structurally weak regions in our vicinity and all over the world: Unlit bike- and footpaths between villages and small settlements; wide areas in Africa, South America and Australia, which are, if at all, supplied with loud, smoky fuel generators. Where else: airstrips in the outback, shelters in the mountains, the Lodge on the desert island. There are many alternative solutions for interior lighting, but as a German saying goes: at night it's just darker than outside. Unless you have a PROCEED 1 that illuminates the darkest night self-sufficient and quiet as whisper.

A Green Wind is Blowing…
… as we have developed Europe’s probably first self-sufficient, wind-powered lighting equipment.

The market is ready
Many years of our experience with municipal outdoor lighting show an increasing demand for autonomous yet cheap solutions as many administrations are on a tight budget. Such solutions are so far only offered through solar powered lighting, but often must be connected to the local power grid for “security" reasons. The experience, particularly in northern Germany, however, shows that the sunlight is not strong enough in the months in which lighting is needed. Furthermore, a frequent complaint was the vulnerability to pollution, vandalism and theft. Very quickly it became clear that solar power is not the solution. The solution is ...wind!

Latest Technology, Ahead of Time
Due to the specially designed Savonius rotor with its low level of loss of effectiveness, the PROCEED I Wind Generator operates reliably and completely noiseless at a minimum wind speed of 3 m/s. It requires no wind re-tracking and is particularly useful at near-ground air layers as it can also operate in turbulences. It is self-braking, additionally equipped with a storm security device, and thus suitable also for wind load zone 4. The combination of the Vulkan V3630 LED lamp, a timer with a dimmer profile, and rechargeable lithium batteries additionally provides extremely long durability. Once charged completely, the noordforce “PROCEED I” offers 60Ah battery capacity and can operate self-sufficiently without any wind for up to 10 days.

Uncountable Fields of Application
The PROCEED I Wind Generator can be used wherever lighting is required but no connection to the public supply mains is available or a new connection would be too cost-intensive. This is oftentimes the case at bus stops or cycle paths but also on industrial sites or in car and public parks.

Der Markt ist bereit


Unsere langjährige Erfahrung mit kommunaler Außenbeleuchtung zeigt, dass immer häufiger autarke Insellösung gefragt sind, gerade weil Kommunen sparen müssen. Solche Lösungen werden bisher nur durch Solarmasten angeboten, die aber wiederum "zur Sicherheit" doch an das lokale Stromnetz angeschlossen werden müssen. Die Erfahrung besonders in Norddeutschland zeigt allerdings, dass in den Monaten, in denen Licht benötigt wird, die Sonneneinstrahlung nicht ausreicht. Weiterhin wurde die Anfälligkeit gegen Verschmutzung, Vandalismus und Diebstahl beklagt. Relativ schnell wurde klar, dass Sonne nicht die Lösung ist. Die Lösung ist...Wind! 
Wir gehen von einem Markt von ca. 4-5000 Masten Deutschland- und mindestens 20.000 Masten Europaweit aus. 
Wie viel kostet eine Anlage?


Eine Anlage wird um die 3000,- Euro kosten. Zum  Vergleich: Die Installation einer neuen Beleuchtungsanlage ("Straßenlaterne") kostet eine Kommune inkl. Erdarbeiten und Verkabelung um die 5000,- Euro.

Wir sind bereit zur Serienproduktion - und DU?

Die Versuchsreihen waren erfolgreich, die ersten Prototypen stehen bereits. Doch bisher ist jeder Mast reine Handarbeit. Die Elektronik muss noch weiterentwickelt und durchgeprüft werden. Wir haben zwar eine Haftpflichtversicherung aber noch keine Zertifizierung. Die Mechanik steht, aber wir wollen Formen und Werkzeuge herstellen lassen, um auch hier in eine Serienproduktion zu starten! 
Unterstütze uns und Du bekommst einen unserer echt coolen Perks (die wir immer noch erweitern) und trägst zur Klimarettung bei!
Wir werden für den Perk für 500,- Euro pro später verkauftem Mast 50 Cent an ein Regenwald-Wiederaufforstungsprojekt spenden. Im Laufe der Kampagne stellen wir Dir dieses Projekt noch genau vor!
Wenn mehr Geld zusammenkommt, haben wir außer "grünem Licht" die Möglichkeit auch Zusatzteile wie einen Bewegungssensor, eventuell eine Handy-Ladestation oder einen Notrufknopf z.B. für die Nutzung in Nationalparks oder auf entlegenen Parkplätzen mit anzubieten. 
Self-sufficient Outdoor Lighting with the Proceed I Wind GeneratorGreen light to save the climate
Endless expanses, far and wide not a soul and the last hint of civilization quite a few hours ago. But over there, isn’t there a gleam of light? And then: The latest technology in rugged nature, a LED - illuminated place in the wilderness, countless kilometers away from a supply network. Think of rural and structurally weak regions in our vicinity and all over the world: Unlit bike- and footpaths between villages and small settlements; wide areas in Africa, South America and Australia, which are, if at all, supplied with loud, smoky fuel generators. Where else: airstrips in the outback, shelters in the mountains, the Lodge on the desert island. There are many alternative solutions for interior lighting, but as a German saying goes: at night it's just darker than outside. Unless you have a PROCEED 1 that illuminates the darkest night self-sufficient and quiet as whisper.

A Green Wind is Blowing…… as we have developed Europe’s probably first self-sufficient,
wind-powered lighting equipment.
The market is readyMany years of our experience with municipal outdoor
lighting show an increasing demand for autonomous yet cheap solutions as many
administrations are on a tight budget. Such solutions are so far only offered
through solar powered lighting, but often must be connected to the local power
grid for “security" reasons. The experience, particularly in northern
Germany, however, shows that the sunlight is not strong enough in the months in
which lighting is needed. Furthermore, a frequent complaint was the
vulnerability to pollution, vandalism and theft. Very quickly it became clear
that solar power is not the solution. The solution is ...wind!
Latest Technology, Ahead of TimeDue to the specially designed Savonius rotor with its low level of loss of effectiveness, the PROCEED I Wind Generator operates reliably and completely noiseless at a minimum wind speed of 3 m/s. It requires no wind re-tracking and is particularly useful at near-ground air layers as it can also operate in
turbulences. It is self-braking, additionally equipped with a storm security
device, and thus suitable also for wind load zone 4. The combination of the
Vulkan V3630 LED lamp, a timer with a dimmer profile, and rechargeable lithium
batteries additionally provides extremely long durability. Once charged
completely, the noordforce “PROCEED I” offers 60Ah battery capacity and can
operate self-sufficiently without any wind for up to 10 days.
Uncountable Fields of ApplicationThe PROCEED I Wind Generator can be used wherever lighting is required but no connection to the public supply mains is available or a new connection would be too cost-intensive. This is oftentimes the case at bus stops or cycle paths but also on industrial sites or in car and public parks.

story:
Pure eyes - the photo project.

Hello everyone,

I'm a portrait photographer based in Milano, Italy. 

After some years working in ADV photography as a digital artist, I took a break from this job and started traveling mostly in South East Asia. There I found my true self as a portrait photographer. Taking pictures for me is a way to meet people around the world and discover their culture and traditions.

More about my photography here: 

https://www.facebook.com/annaruggieriphotographer/

http://www.annaruggieri.com



My project consist in 20/30 photos representing people of Myanmar: their life and their pure eyes. Myanmar is still a very "closed" country due to his political situation, but the people's eyes would communicate much more than what we expect.

With your help it would be possible to print my selected pictures to create an exhibition and share my experience with everybody by printing a photobook too.  



What I Need & What You Get

More details:

  • To print and put in frames my 20 (up to 30) 70cm x 50cm pictures I would need at least €600. To create a photobook I need at least €200 to build the printable file.
  • I'm excited to present you my unique perks: cards and photobooks!
  •  If I won't reach my entire goal, all the funds will be used to produce my photobook and cards and send it to backers, being proud of sharing my project with this small audience.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute you'll be helpful:

  • Sharing my Indiegogo campaign on social networks!
  • Making noise about my project with friends!
  • Visiting and linking my Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/annaruggieriphotographer/ or sharing my website http://www.annaruggieri.com 

Thank you!

story:
Check out the 2018 Avila Beach Sunrise Calendar

 

About Me and the Project

 

Hello, my name is Jay Olson and I used my experience in web design and marketing to start www.EnjoyAvilaBeach.com about 10 years ago to help fill an information void about my favorite little California beach town, Avila Beach. After falling in love with Avila again as an adult, I painful watched it sit empty and small businesses struggle on even the most beautiful days, So I built a website and used the power of Social Media to get the word out on Avila Beach. After almost a decade, I’ve not only built up a very popular website for Avila, but some of the most popular social media pages about tourism in our area. You can learn more about me and my website here.

 

Over the years, the website and social media pages have grown beyond my wildest dreams but with that, the amount of time and costs to run everything have grown as well. Since sharing beautiful photos is the best way to get engagement on Social Media, I’ve posted A LOT of them over the years. I’ve always tried to share the best photos of Avila Beach I could, but most of the time I had to take them myself. Over the years of sharing my photos, the number one feedback I received was that I should put them together into a Avila Beach calendar. 
 
 
For the past couple of months, I’ve been working on a calendar for 2016 using the most popular Avila Beach photos I’ve taken this past year. I am using it to help support my Avila Beach site so I can continue my passion of sharing my favorite place, Avila. I set up this Indiegogo campaign that will run until the last day of November. Why Indiegogo? It’s not only a fantastic website for raising money in the community but it was a perfect storefront to sell them. You donate to the website and in turn you’ll get an awesome Avila Beach Calendar(s).

 

 

Avila Beach 2016 Calendar

 

Only people that support this campaign are guaranteed a 2016 Avila Beach Calendar so pre-order yours before time runs out!! 

This calendar is very important to me. It’s my work not only as a photographer but as the community manager for Enjoy Avila Beach. I want it to not only be the best looking calendar for Avila Beach but made with high quality materials. 

 

  • The finished size is 8.5 x 11 inches closed (11 x 17 hanging)
  • Each month (12) will feature a different photo of Avila Beach (Plus 1 Bonus Photo with a notes section in the back)
  • Each Calendar will come with online goodies of the featured photos. Including Avila Beach videos, desktop & smartphone wallpaper, cover photos, and more!
  • Campaign runs till Sunday, Nov 29th, 2015 at Midnight 
  • This is the final design and all calendars are being printed
  • I will have them in my hands the first week of December. I'll be shipping them & delivering them out immediately so everyone will have them with plenty of time to spare before Christmas!

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to look! Calendars are not your thing? No worries, there are still ways you can help!

 

  • Please SHARE this with your friends on social media. Chances are you know someone that would love an Avila Beach Calendar!
  • These calendar make great GIFTS for anyone! 
  • I also offer PRINTS of my Avila Beach photos on my website. You can pick many different sizes and on many mediums like canvas and metal. 

Please feel free to contact me with any questions at Jay@EnjoyAvilaBeach.com or connect with me on Facebook.

story:
Participation de l’exposition photographique « À mon corps dérangeant » au Forum Social Mondial (FSM) 2016 de Montréal

Le but de ce projet est de réaliser une exposition de mon travail photographique « À mon corps dérangeant » sur la vie affective et sexuelle des personnes handicapées, dans le cadre du FSM à Montréal en août 2016.

Il s'agit donc de m'aider à financer l'impression, mon transport ainsi que celui de l’exposition.
Plusieurs partenaires appuient ce projet, dont le Forum Social Mondial 2016, ainsi que leur Comité Handicap et des associations du Canada.

_______________

Sensibilisation du public à la sexualité des personnes handicapées, au travers de l’exposition « A mon corps dérangeant »

Depuis 2011 je réalise un reportage au long cours intitulé « A mon corps dérangeant », axé sur la vie affective et sexuelle de personnes handicapées physiques. J’ai jusqu’à présent rencontré 6 couples, saisi leurs moments d’intimité, dans une approche qui reste pudique.

Le résultat en est une ode au corps « différent », une ode à l’amour, réalité partagée par tous, quels que soient son apparence, son héritage, son handicap.

Ces dernières années, ce travail a été récompensé par le Concours SOPHOT 2014 de la photographie sociale, et le Prix "Innovation" 2015 du « Mois Extra Ordinaire » du handicap de la Ville de Paris.

_______________

Pourquoi ce projet est-il important ?

Faire évoluer le regard sur le handicap, par le biais d’un reportage inédit sur la sexualité des personnes handicapées, sujet tabou.

L’existence-même de la sexualité des personnes handicapées, parce qu’elle est associée à un corps abimé, meurtri, n’est pas marquée d’une solide évidence pour la grande majorité de nos contemporains.
Avoir un handicap n’implique pourtant pas d’échapper aux émotions du cœur et encore moins aux désirs du corps. Un postulat d’autant plus évident que chacun peut être confronté au handicap au cours de sa vie.

La différence est admise tant qu’elle ne bouscule pas les barrières de la soit disant normalité. L’évidence du droit à une sexualité – déjà revendiqué par diverses associations au Québec – est un combat à mener au quotidien.

Le projet "A mon corps dérangeant" entend présenter comme une évidence cet élément indispensable d’équilibre et d’épanouissement qu’est la sexualité des personnes handicapées. Amener le visiteur à sortir des idées reçues, pour changer de regard sur la différence.

_______________

Le Forum Social Mondial (FSM)

Au mois d’août aura lieu le FSM, à Montréal. Cet événement majeur au Canada présente 1500 activités, et rassemble plus de 50 000 personnes issues des 4 coins de la planète. Groupes de la société civile, organisations et mouvements sociaux, mais aussi visiteurs individuels tous unis pour un monde solidaire.

Participer au FSM, c’est donc transmettre des idées à grande échelle, agir ensemble pour le bien commun. C’est l'opportunité de dévoiler ce travail tant à des acteurs de la vie sociale qu’à des visiteurs du monde entier, participer à avancer ensemble sur la tolérance, dépasser les tabous.

Participer au FSM, c’est s’insérer dans une amorce de sensibilisation planétaire pour peu à peu contribuer à une évolution des idées.


_______________

Qui suis-je ?

Photographe professionnel, mon activité s’articule autour de la  photographie humaniste. Je collabore depuis une quinzaine d’années avec le milieu associatif, et réalise divers reportages pour la presse sociale.
Mon site Internet : www.jeromedeya.com

_______________

Pourquoi un financement ?

Avec votre soutien, par le biais du financement participatif, je souhaite :
- Imprimer une exposition de 38 photos (30x40 cm), sur un support robuste, léger et peu encombrant, pensé pour une itinérance au long cours,
- Financer mon billet en Classe Eco (la vie sur place est à ma charge),
- Financer le transport de l’exposition, parfaitement emballée pour un voyage économique en soute.

Dès sa conception, cette exposition est pensée pour une sensibilisation à grande échelle, en se tournant vers d’autres événements, festivals, galeries… dans divers pays du monde.

Son premier voyage lui ferait donc traverser l’Atlantique de Paris à Montréal, où je suis en recherche de partenariats pour une éventuelle seconde exposition après le FSM.

Cher contributeurs, toute piste est la bienvenue !


Merci par avance de donner sa chance à ce projet,
en contribuant financièrement, ou en le faisant connaitre autour de vous.


_______________

Le financement

L’exposition
* 38 tirages d’exposition (30x40 cm) sur Dibond (plaque d’aluminium) : $2055 CAD (1 430 €)
* 18 cartels (6 en Français, 6 en Anglais, 6 en Espagnol) comportant chacun le texte rédigé par un couple photographié : $502 CAD (349 €)
* 3 panneaux (Français, Anglais, Espagnol) pour le texte du photographe : $256 CAD (178 €)

Le transport
* Billet d’avion Paris - Montréal (en août) : $1150 CAD (800 €)
* Supplément 2 Bagages, pour l’exposition (tarifs Air France) : $374 CAD (260 €)

COUT TOTAL  : $4337 CAD (3015 €)


A ma charge
* Commission Indiegogo de 5% : $216 CAD (150 €)
* Logement et vie sur place.


Si le budget total était atteint, toute contribution supplémentaire constituerait une cagnotte pour faire voyager l’exposition
au-delà de nouvelles frontières.

story:
Some pages of the book

Scroll down to see the perks (pictures)

Dear friends,

My name is Manolis Tsantakis, I am a photographer and I live on the island of Crete, Greece.

One of my favorite themes are the, literally, ancient olive trees with their huge, extraordinary trunks, shaped like living sculptures, which have always been of great interest, to artists in particular.

The island of Crete is one of the few remaining places in the world where one can still come across millennia-old olive trees—both singularly scattered and entire olive groves of them - and the only place with the world’s oldest olive trees, resonant vestiges of the long-gone Minoan civilization. Not only are these ancient trees alive, they are still productive, offering people their invaluable gift over thousands of years.

It is these thousand-year-old olive trees that I have searched for and photographed for more than 10 years now, throughout Crete.

And yet…human ignorance and greed has led to the unthinkable uprooting of these trees and the planting of new ones in their place, in the hope of a more bountiful yield.

Other causes for their uprooting include public works, road construction, logging for firewood, even their marketing abroad!

My goal is to record this entire research in a photographic album, in the hope that the information included will encourage more people to awaken to the cultural and historical value of those ancient olive trees, so that both common folk and the authorities may be motivated towards their protection.

The publication will include photographic material of old, now abandoned olive press factories and also pictures from the collection of olives in modern day olive groves, as well as from the process of pressing and production of olive oil in modern factories, accompanied by informative texts and captions.

It will also include important information from specialists and a selection of unique poems by outstanding poets, specially written for this publication.

I am therefore calling upon all of you willing to help in the realization of this project by making a contribution to this enormous effort for the salvation and public display of the last remaining ancient olive groves on this planet!

www.photoart.gr

ΕΛΛΗΝΙΚΟ ΚΕΙΜΕΝΟ

Γεια σας φίλοι μου, ονομάζομαι Μανόλης Τσαντάκης  είμαι φωτογράφος και ζω στην  Κρήτη.

Ένα από τα αγαπημένα μου θέματα για φωτογράφηση είναι τα αρχαία ελαιόδεντρα με τους μεγάλους και περίεργους κορμούς που ως ζωντανά γλυπτά παρουσιάζουν μεγάλο ενδιαφέρον ιδιαίτερα για τους καλλιτέχνες.

Η Κρήτη είναι από τα λίγα μέρη του κόσμου που υπάρχουν ακόμη διάσπαρτες μεμονωμένες υπεραιωνόβιες ελιές μέχρι ολόκληροι ελαιώνες και το μοναδικό στον κόσμο με τις αρχαιότερες ελιές, απομεινάρια του μακρινού Μινωικού πολιτισμού που όχι μόνον ζουν αλλά συνεχίζουν να καρποφορούν δίνοντας ακόμη στους ανθρώπους μετά από χιλιάδες χρόνια τα πολύτιμα δώρα τους.

Αυτά τα πανάρχαια ελαιόδεντρα ηλικίας άνω των χιλίων ετών, ψάχνω και φωτογραφίζω περισσότερο από 10 χρόνια σε ολόκληρη την Κρήτη.

Όμως… η άγνοια και η απληστία των ανθρώπων για περισσότερο κέρδος, οδηγεί στο ξερίζωμα αυτών των ελιών και στη θέση τους φυτεύουν νέα φυτά νομίζοντας πως θα αποδώσουν περισσότερους καρπούς.

Άλλες αιτίες είναι η οικοπεδοποίηση, τα δημόσια έργα, δρόμοι, η υλοτόμηση για την παραγωγή καυσόξυλων, ακόμη και η πώληση τους σε άλλα κράτη!

Ο σκοπός μου είναι όλη αυτή η έρευνα να καταγραφεί σε ένα φωτογραφικό λεύκωμα,

που να ενημερώνει τον κόσμο για την πολιτισμική και ιστορική αξία των αρχαίων αυτών ελαιόδεντρων, με την ελπίδα ότι θα ευαισθητοποιήσει απλό κόσμο και αρμόδιους φορείς για την προστασία τους.

Στην έκδοση αυτή θα υπάρχουν επίσης φωτογραφίες παλαιών εγκαταλειμμένων ελαιοτριβείων αλλά και φωτογραφίες από την ελαιοσυγκομιδή στα λιόφυτα καθώς και η διαδικασία της έκθλιψης και της παραγωγής του λαδιού από τα σύγχρονα εργοστάσια με κατατοπιστικά κείμενα και λεζάντες.

Θα υπάρχουν επίσης σημαντικές πληροφορίες από εξειδικευμένους επιστήμονες

καθώς και επιλεγμένη ποίηση από σημαντικούς ποιητές που έχουν ήδη γράψει ειδικά για την έκδοση αυτή.

Καλώ λοιπόν όλους όσους μπορούν να βοηθήσουν και να συμβάλουν σε αυτή τη μεγάλη προσπάθεια για την ανάδειξη και προστασία του τελευταίου αρχαίου ελαιώνα του πλανήτη!

 

Texte Français

Bonjour mes amis, mon nom est Manolis Tsantakis, je suis photographe et je vis sur l'île de Crète en Grèce.
L’un de mes sujets photographiques préférés sont les anciens oliviers aux troncs immenses et étranges comme des sculptures vivantes, et présentant un intérêt certain pour tout artiste.

La Crète est l’un des rares endroits au monde où il existe encore des oliviers séculaires, qu’ils soient isolés ou regroupés en oliveraies, et c’est aussi le seul lieu où ces arbres sont aussi vieux, restes de la lointaine civilisation minoenne, qui non seulement vivent encore mais qui continuent d’offrir aux hommes, après plusieurs milliers d’années, leurs fruits précieux.

Depuis plus de 10 ans je recherche et je photographie ces arbres extrêmement âgés, puisqu’ils ont tous plus de 1000 ans.

Et pourtant … l’ignorance et la cupidité des hommes à la recherche de toujours plus de profits, a conduit au déracinement de ces oliviers afin de les remplacer par de jeunes arbres pour de plus grandes récoltes.
Le développement immobilier, les travaux publics, les routes, l’abattage pour le bois de chauffage et même la revente de ces arbres majestueux sont d’autres causes de leur disparition.

Mon but est de réunir le résultat de ce travail de recherche dans un livre photographique afin d’informer le monde de la valeur culturelle et historique de ces oliviers plusieurs fois centenaires, dans l’espoir d’une sensibilisation du grand public et des autorités compétentes pour leur sauvegarde.

Cette édition inclut également des photos de vieux moulins à olives abandonnés ainsi que des photos prises lors de la récolte des olives et du processus de presse par des machines modernes accompagnées de légendes explicatives.
Des informations pertinentes écrites par des scientifiques de renom ainsi que des poèmes inspirés directement par ce projet complètent l’intérêt artistique de ce beau livre.

J’invite donc tous ceux et celles qui le peuvent à m’aider en prenant part à cet effort destiné à la promotion et à la protection de la dernière oliveraie archaïque de la planète.

Poster 1

Poster 2

Poster 3

Poster 4

Poster 5

Canvas print 1   Dimensions of photography 27.0 x 19.0" -  70x47 cm 

Canvas print 2  Dimensions of photography 39.0" x  26.0" -  100x66 cm 

Art print 1  Dimensions of photography 13.0 x 19.0" -  48x33 cm 

Art print 2  Dimensions of photography 13.0 x 19.0" -  48x33 cm 

Art print 3  Dimensions of photography 13.0 x 19.0" -  48x33 cm 

Art print 4  Dimensions of photography 13.0 x 19.0" -  48x33 cm 

Art print 5  Dimensions of photography 13.0 x 19.0" -  48x33 cm 

Thank you so much for your support !
story_txt: Some pages of the bookScroll down to see the perks (pictures)Dear friends,My name is Manolis Tsantakis, I am a photographer and I live on the island of Crete, Greece.One of my favorite themes are the, literally, ancient olive trees with their huge, extraordinary trunks, shaped like living sculptures, which have always been of great interest, to artists in particular.The island of Crete is one of the few remaining places in the world where one can still come across millennia-old olive trees—both singularly scattered and entire olive groves of them - and the only place with the world’s oldest olive trees, resonant vestiges of the long-gone Minoan civilization. Not only are these ancient trees alive, they are still productive, offering people their invaluable gift over thousands of years.It is these thousand-year-old olive trees that I have searched for and photographed for more than 10 years now, throughout Crete.And yet…human ignorance and greed has led to the unthinkable uprooting of these trees and the planting of new ones in their place, in the hope of a more bountiful yield.Other causes for their uprooting include public works, road construction, logging for firewood, even their marketing abroad!My goal is to record this entire research in a photographic album, in the hope that the information included will encourage more people to awaken to the cultural and historical value of those ancient olive trees, so that both common folk and the authorities may be motivated towards their protection.The publication will include photographic material of old, now abandoned olive press factories and also pictures from the collection of olives in modern day olive groves, as well as from the process of pressing and production of olive oil in modern factories, accompanied by informative texts and captions.It will also include important information from specialists and a selection of unique poems by outstanding poets, specially written for this publication.I am therefore calling upon all of you willing to help in the realization of this project by making a contribution to this enormous effort for the salvation and public display of the last remaining ancient olive groves on this planet!www.photoart.grΕΛΛΗΝΙΚΟ ΚΕΙΜΕΝΟΓεια σας story:
I need your support! And you get my photos!

Very simple. 

Already two years since my photo equipment was stolen. But i kept taking photos and you can see some of them on my Instagram: Chkrap

Now i need your support to be able to continue my photography work. 

But if you are not able to contribute financially, please share my call and motivate your friends to contribute as well. 

I hope i will have real photo equipment to continue my photography work. 

Thanks a lot! 

 

You can check my flickr gallery and if you like any of the photos, after you choose your perk just send me message on samir.ljuma@gmail.com with the link of the photo and ill send it to you. 

here is the link to the gallery:

https://www.flickr.com/photos/samirljuma

story:
You're invited to be a part of producing 

CHANGE MAKERS EXHIBITION AND BOOK!

 

Change Makers is a portrait and story project spotlighting women revolutionizing change.

https://www.changemakersunite.org/

 

CHANGE MAKERS – IF YOU CAN SEE IT, YOU CAN BE IT!

The purpose of 'Change Makers' is to spotlight the women leaders of today whose work is devoted to change. From revolutionizing the way we vote, to chipping down male-dominated fields, to opening platforms for women creatives to thrive; the stories of these women stand on the peaks of extraordinary. And in learning and understanding more stories like theirs, we remember...sometimes the boldest stories go untold. Our 'Change Makers' project hopes to change that.

 

INSPIRATION AND HOW YOU CAN HELP!

The inspiration for 'Change Makers' ignited after we experienced the Women's March on Washington. The DC March alone joined more than half a million women to fight for human rights and band against the 2016-2020 president elect; while across the globe in all seven continents, more than 3.3 million women marched. Being pieces in the monumental movement, we knew that within these history-making marches, there were historic and heroic stories to be told.

 

To tell 30 of our Change Makers stories and inspire more, our goal is to raise $15,000 to create a 'Change Makers' website and series of exhibitions, events and book to reach young men and women to show a new picture of leadership. With your help, change is ours.

 

OUR TEAM:

CHANGE MAKERS has been conceived by 3 women on the bus to the Women’s March in Washington D.C. Here is who they are:

Mary Dove, Producer and Website Design

Mary works as a community organizer and activist creating educational and community programs supporting women. Mary Dove founded Lean In NYC in 2012 following the publishing of Sheryl Sandberg's book “Lean In”. The group now has over 4600 members and has produced 30 speaker and educational events. 

Camile Sardina, Writer

Camille is the Director of PR for Lean IN NYC and has contributed to many publications including Teen Vogue, Ladygunn and BUST. She will be interviewing all of the featured women.

Jena Cumbo, Photographer

Jena has contributed to Ladygunn, BUST, Village Voice, has an MFA in photography and a background of shooting portrait photo projects.

 

OUR CAMPAIGN

We’ve covered all our own expenses including gas, tolls, and production cost, not to mention countless unpaid hours, many late nights and even more early mornings. It's been an amazing joy!

Now, to actually get the exhibitions series ready to share with young men and women, we need your help! The costs break down like this:

  • Archival Prints: $1500.00
  • Frames and Mounting: $3000.00
  • Website: $500.00
  • Book Design: $2000.00
  • Book Printing: $3000.00
  • Production: $2000.00
  • Rewards: $2000.00
  • Indiegogo fees & Stripe: $1000
  • Total: $15,000

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

If you can’t contribute to our campaign, no worries! You can still help us out by SHARING our story!

  1. Send this page to a friend who want to change the world in a positive way!
  2. Share this campaign with your friends and family on social media!

Thank you, thank you, thank you!
