story:
Matt Round Studios

Matt has been working as a freelance photographer in the local area now for around 5 years full-time. In this time his business in the commercial sector has grown from strength to strength. He spends most of his time doing commercial photography - products, events, corporate headshots etc.

As much as he loves his work, Matt has been longing to grow the portraiture side of his business, and the lack of a studio space has been holding him back. SO, we have found the perfect location to open a studio, and we need support from you to raise a small injection of capital to get it going!

What We Need & What You Get

This is what we need, and what you will get in return for helping us to get there:

  • £6,000 in capital to get the studio open. This money will pay for: a photo printer and setting up costs (paper and ink), the costs to build a partition wall and make the flooring even, painting and decorating, a couple of studio lights and resources to make our space friendly and welcoming for families with babies, and children with additional needs.
  • We have some awesome perks that you will want to sign up for, including pet photo shoots at a bargain price!
  • Everyone who pledges will be included on a 'wall of fame' on our website.
  • If we don't reach our full fundraising goal on this round of crowdfunding, all money will be set aside until we are able to fund the rest of the project ourselves, at which point we will still fulfil your original pledges.

The Impact

This opportunity will have a huge impact on the business. It will enable us to:

  • Have a customer facing relationship with our clients, where you can pop in for a cup of tea and discuss your requirements.
  • Grow a reputation within the local area.
  • Grow Matt's product offering and enable him to become a specialist in the area of portraiture.
  • Provide short mini-shoots in a comfortable, wheelchair accessible space, perfect for families of children with additional needs.
  • Provide pet portrait shoots.
  • Provide a studio space that will be available for use by the local community.
  • We will be able to offer workshops and teach photography skills classes.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute financially to our project, you can still support us by:

  • Getting the word out and making some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to share with your community.
  • Even if you don't want to get in front of the camera yourself, you can gift your pledge to a friend or family member, or decline to take up your pledge if you simply want to make a cash donation to the cause.
  • Please ask us about bespoke pledges. For example, if you want to contribute £200, but don't need studio hire, just let us know that you have purchased a £200 perk but that you would like a photo shoot and equivalent value of prints instead!

And that's all there is to it! Thank you for taking the time to read this.

story:
Journey to the Louvre with Justin

Early this year Justin got word that a jury of 12, unanimously chose his photographs to be part of the 157th Salon National des Beaux Arts Exhibit, at the Louvre in Paris!!!  He is one of a handful of artists in Canada, travelling to Paris in December, to represent! The honour is indescribable and chance for international exposure is unparalleled.  He HAS to go!!  

Justin's story

Raised in Rural Ontario, Justin first fell in love with beautiful landscapes, big open skies, colour rich sunsets and billowing clouds well before he ever picked up his first camera. Taking photographs to capture this serenity was only natural. For decades Justin’s obsession with taking photographs was a well guarded secret that very few knew.  Used to escape the daily grind and the chaos life would throw his way, photography was an outlet he used to strengthen his mental health and keep creativity in his life.

Justin never thought that his personal form of therapy would land him in Paris, showing off one of his pieces of photography in the most artistic, influential places in the world!  Being selected to be a delegate representing Canada was a dream come true!!  

#HamOntGoesToParis

This campaign allows you to invest in this journey through the many perks available.  Own a piece of his photography to hang on your walls and support a Hamilton Artist in becoming International!!  Your investment through this campaign will ensure Justin's photography is presented in its best possible light.  Justin is proud to ensure the photo is printed locally and framed right here in Hamilton.   

Your investment

Our perks are designed so that you get the value of your contribution in art and experience. We are hoping to raise $9000 so Justin can Journey to Paris!  The following is a breakdown of how Justin will use your generous contributions;

  • Preparation of the Photo - Justin cannot just worry about his image, he must also assess how it will be printed.  What will the frame look like, will he need an anti reflective glass, does canvas make more sense?  This will be a process of trials and cost can accumulate quickly.  Justin will be supporting LOCAL crafts people to print and frame his pieces and together they will find the right formula to send to Paris.  The estimated budget, including trials $1500.
  • Shipping and Insurance - It won't be until the above is determined that we can know for sure the costs associated with shipping and insuring the piece, but in speaking with previous delegates and some generalized research we anticipate $2000.
  • Artists fees - Once you are chosen to be a part of the exhibition there are fees you need to submit that cover the handling of your art once handed over to SNBA.  They include things like security, lighting, hanging and insurance while there. These fees are already over $2000
  • Promotional Material - having the opportunity to meet 10,000 people in four days, we want to make sure Justin has enough media to disperse so that he can be reached after the event.  We are working with LOCAL marketing geniuses at Unicorn Rebellion, to design a takeaway for people to remember and hold on to so they can contact Justin at a later date.  Budgeting $3000
  • Additional Funds - additional funds will be used to finish a professional webpage (same LOCAL geniuses) so that Justin can represent his work to all the new connections he will be making while in Paris, with pride. If we are lucky enough to exceed our goal Justin will use the funds to enter other galleries to continue growing his passion for art.

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, we get it if you cannot support financially, but please do not think your contribution ends there! We are grateful for every social media share, every conversation you introduce us to someone new and every LIKE or virtual high five of support along the way!

  • share this campaign 
  • tell someone about it at work or the gym
  • Follow Justin on Instagram @justinmulderphotography

Thank you for reading to the end!  We hope you can come along on this journey and be a piece of it!
story_txt:
Journey to the Louvre with Justin
Early this year Justin got word that a jury of 12, unanimously chose his photographs to be part of the 157th Salon National des Beaux Arts Exhibit, at the Louvre in Paris!!!  He is one of a handful of artists in Canada, travelling to Paris in December, to represent! The honour is indescribable and chance for international exposure is unparalleled.  He HAS to go!!  
Justin's story
Raised in Rural Ontario, Justin first fell in love with beautiful landscapes, big open skies, colour rich sunsets and billowing clouds well before he ever picked up his first camera. Taking photographs to capture this serenity was only natural. For decades Justin’s obsession with taking photographs was a well guarded secret that very few knew.  Used to escape the daily grind and the chaos life would throw his way, photography was an outlet he used to strengthen his mental health and keep creativity in his life.
Justin never thought that his personal form of therapy would land him in Paris, showing off one of his pieces of photography in the most artistic, influential places in the world!  Being selected to be a delegate representing Canada was a dream come true!!

If we are lucky enough to exceed our goal Justin will use the funds to enter other galleries to continue growing his passion for art.


Other Ways You Can Help
Hey, we get it if you cannot support financially, but please do not think your contribution ends there! We are grateful for every social media share, every conversation you introduce us to someone new and every LIKE or virtual high five of support along the way!

share this campaign 
tell someone about it at work or the gym
Follow Justin on Instagram @justinmulderphotography

Thank you for reading to the end!  We hope you can come along on this journey and be a piece of it!

story:
Who Am I ?

My Name is Flanegan Bainon, sounds like a westerner but I am one out of 40 of North Borneo's (Sabah) Indigenous Native, Murut tribe. Born and Raised in Kota Kinabalu, Capital City of Sabah (North Borneo). In my early 20's I went to Melbourne, Australia to further my studies for 3 years studying Photography at RMIT University and moved to Tokyo, Japan for 2 years Assisting and ended up being a Full-time Photographer. Due to Personal reason and also family issues, I decide to hold my dream being a Portrait Celebrity Photographer in Japan and move back to Kota Kinabalu, Sabah.


What is Nunuk Ragang?

Nunuk Ragang is a Red Banyan Tree located at Tampias, Sabah (in-between Ranau and Sandakan District) where the KadazanDusun & Murut Civilization began before spreading all over the State of Sabah.

In order to preserve the Identity is to capture it in a traditional way. Clean Straight Forward Portrait Shot without distraction except the People with his/her Costume.


Why I'm doing this Project ?

     After being away for 5 years living in a developed country. I've realize being Borneo Native, I didn't know much about my own identity as I'm growing up watching more Western media TV since childhood. The only time I'm being proud and recognize myself as Murut tribe is when I decide to wear the Murut Indigenous Costume during my graduation day in Australia.
     From there on, I've decide to begin my own research on North Borneo Native Tribe's Art, Music and Culture and come to realization that there's no proper Photographs of all 40 Indigenous Native Costume ever since.
    So far, with luck I've Photographed 9 Indigenous Native with their Full Costume back in 2010. And now, I decide to take this opportunity in IndieGogo to fulfill and complete this Portrait project.


Mini-Portraiture Series of Nunuk Ragang
exhibit publicly in the city of Kota Kinabalu.


Your Fund Support will be part of ever-changing culture-landscape of North Borneo (Sabah) History. If the Young Generation can't follow the tradition, the only way to educate them is to Photographs in a proper way and document them for future showcase in State's Art Gallery and also in State's Museum.


How Much do I need ?

Without support and sponsor from the locals who have no interested to photographs the Faces and Native Costume in a proper way because it has no "Tourism Culture" value. I've count the overall cost from paying a small fee to the Indigenous Native as a thank you gift (40 ethnic), transportation fee to villages or small town where I will set a grey background on location, assistant fee and also Selection of Exclusive Perk Reward such as, Set of Postcard & Limited set of High Quality Prints.

If the fund didn't reach at least RM6000 to pay the fee to the 40 indigenous ethnic group who I will Photographs as a gift. I will refund the whole amount to all the backers after the end of the deadline.

If I got more that what I target, I've decide to donate a certain amount to selected Indigenous Orphanage Home in Bundu Tuhan and also in Papar and the remaining fund to have my First-ever "Retrospective" Portrait Exhibition in my hometown's Major Art Gallery.

Here are the breakdown (all in Malaysia's Ringgit) :
RM6000, fees for roughly 40+ of Ethnic Tribe with full costume as thank you gift.
RM300-500, fees for Assistant and also BTS Cameraman.


Other Similar / Related Project that I've achieved.


- A Photo Documentary called "This is Sabah", where I've traveled all over North Borneo for 2 months to photograph the places and people while trying to understand the Indigenous Life in the Interior part and also searching my Identity voice.

- A Commissioned Project called "The Faces of Gayo Ngaran" by KL Photo Award. To Photograph and Document the faces of Elderly Native People who lives at the foothills of Majestic Mount Kinabalu where they are the last generation to know the whole story and history of Dusun Tribe and relationship with the Mount Kinabalu.

Beside Fund / Crowdfunding, what else can you help.


While you decide to fund this project or not, Please share the love by sharing this link to showcase the Unique faces of North Borneo (Sabah) Indigenous Group.


Thank you very much and I will keep posted on the project.
A formal way of Thank You in Kadazan/Dusun Language is "Kotohuadan".

story:
The Gift

We have always had it in our hearts to be entrepreneurs and we are now stepping into that chapter of our lives. Being former Army Veterans we also know that none of us is as strong as all of us, which is why we are launching this campaign.

We wanted to do something that would not only impact us but something that would also impact our community in a positive way.  We believe we have found a way to do that!  We have been blessed and fortunate to acquire a photography studio which we are calling "The Spot". 

It was our desire to have a location that not only serves the needs of our clients but also the needs of other photographers and their clients. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal in this startup is to outfit "The Spot" with the necessary equipment while remaining debt-free.

  • We are needing to raise at least 10,000 dollars which will go towards renovations and supplies such as:
    • Flooring, Studio Lighting, Backdrops, Props etc.
  • Any donation amount is greatly appreciated and with any campaign, there are some special perks!
    • Those who live locally in the Pacific Northwest and donate an amount of 250 dollars or more will receive:
      • 2 Full 1-hour photo sessions (excluding wedding/events) complete with a stylist to style your session. This is redeemable for 5 years!
    • Those who live locally in the Pacific Northwest and donate an amount of 500 dollars or more will receive:
      • 3 Full 1-hour photo sessions (excluding wedding/events) complete with a stylist to style your session. This is redeemable for 5 years!
    • Those who live in distance and donate an amount of 200 dollars or more will receive:
      • A custom-made C-Sharp photo mailed to your home.

The Impact

When you partner with us in this endeavor you will be impacting the lives of many.

We love being able to capture special moments for others to enjoy, whether it is through special events, portraits, or simply candid (real-life) moments. It is a beautiful thing to capture a moment in time that has passed (on the calendar) but yet lives on in our heart, spirit, and mind. In essence, it is the "Gift of Photography".  You will be a part of all of these special moments just as we are.

You will also know that you have helped partner with other small businesses.  For example, when another photographer uses "The Spot" for their client you are ensuring the success of that photo session which ensures the success of that photographer.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some might not be able to contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways:

  • Help us get the word out about The Gift of Photography.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share this with your community of friends and family.

Thank you in advance!

~Courtney & Shine

story:
1. About me

My name is Rosa Veloso, I´m from Galicia, in the northwestern coast to Spain bordered to Portugal. I began in photography when I was only 8. My artistic work moves between still life and portraits. Although they are the food photography and the food itself -I am a private chef- what I do for living: this is my company

a sample of my artwork

 

2. Lisbon?

In the past, Galicia and Portugal belonged to the same kingdom. Portugal’s closely related to Galicia, not only in language but on the way of being (prone to saudades or morriña). Our roots and traditions are deeply intertwined. I have always considered Portugal my home away from home. I have a crush on Lisbon, the hills, the kindness of the people, the feeling of being welcomed and the “saudade”. However, during the past five years, Lisbon is moving rapidly through the entrepreneurial action, raising prices and gentrification. It seems to me that the city is slowly losing its soul and neglecting the things that made the city so appealing in the first place. Mine is an exhibition about the significance and large impact tourism has on the life of modern Lisbon.

3. Why a Crowdfunding?

This is my first crowdfunding. I really love the fact of sharing projects with people in the other side of the world supporting ideas from others and i will enjoy if you support mine eventhough we do not know each other.

4. The project: In more detail

Una de las fotos de la espoxición

4.1  Further specifications

The exhibition will feature 40X50 photographies printed on high quality RH paper, dry  mounted on 1cm kapafix and carefully framed for optimal display.

Photographies belong to a signed limited edition of 10 prints each.

The opening of the exhibition will be held in Passevite Gallery (Lisbon) on November 11, 2017. On view until December 11, 2017.

Provided the work has been conceived as a travelling exhibition, photographies will be also displayed in Madrid during 2018 (venue yet to be determined)

4.2 Your help

Your contibution will be used to produce the exibition

The cost of the production is 3000 euros, this includes a catalog with a 300gr paper cover, a poster and a postcard.

If we reach 4000 euros in funding we would like to do an interactive expibition: the spectator and the city, transcending the walls of the gallery and going to the streets of Lisbon. Led by the artists and friends of the gallery we do a tour of the city and its barrios evading the obvious tourist traps.

If we reach more than 4000 euros the extra money will be used to pay the great people and friends, that are helping out with the project, for their contribution.

Other ways you can help: money isn't everything! If you are not in a position to contribute financially you can still help us out, by sharing this campaign on your social media and forward it to anyone you believe may be interested.

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Olisipofila: Referente a Olisipo: nombre antiguo de la ciudad de Lisboa. Me considero una olisipófila: persona que ama desmesuradamente la ciudad de Lisboa. Esta exposición habla de la vertiginosa transformación de la ciudad de Lisboa, desde la perspectiva de la fotografía bodegonista. Usando como protagonista la popular figura del Gallo de Barcelos, han nacido estas piezas llenas de energía y -a la vez- tristeza, que sugieren la soledad del Lisboeta en plena gentrificación y auge turístico.

1. Un poco sobre mí

Mi nombre es Rosa Veloso. Soy de Galicia, una provincia al noroeste de España que comparte frontera con Portugal. Empecé a hacer fotografías desde los 8 años. Mi trabajo artístico se mueve entre el retrato y la fotografía bodegonista. Aunque es la fotografía gastronómica y la comida en sí misma-soy chef privada- lo que me da de comer: esta es mi empresa.

2. ¿Lisboa?

Antiguamente Galicia y Portugal eran un mismo Reino, es por eso que nuestra idiosincrasia, lenguas y costumbres tienen muchos puntos en común. Portugal siempre ha sido mi segunda casa.
Siempre he dicho que Lisboa es una de las ciudad más hermosas del mundo. Sus colinas, su interracialidad, su saudade y amabilidad.  Desde hace unos años se ha vuelto muy popular. El turismo se ha desarrollado bastante rápido y en pocos años se ha convertido en el segundo mejor destino en Europa. De como afecta esa transformación trata mi exposición.

3. ¿Por qué un Crowdfunding?

Esta es mi primera campaña de Crowdfunding. Me entusiasma la idea de poder colaborar con proyectos del otro lado del mundo y que tú puedas colaborar con el mío aunque no nos conozcamos ni vivamos en el mismo barrio.

4. El Proyecto más detallado

4.1 Especificaciones técnicas

Fotografías de 40x50 en papel RH  de alta calidad sobre soporte de kapafix de 1 cm de ancho y debidamente enmarcadas.

Edición limitada de 10 copias firmadas y numeradas.

La Inaguración de la exposición será en Lisboa, en la galería Passevite, el 11 de Noviembre de 2017. Con un mes de duración. Nuestra intención es inaugurarla también en Madrid.

4.2 Tu ayuda

Tu ayuda irá directamente a la producción de la exposición.

Para la producción básica de la exposición necesitaremos un total de  3.000€. Incluye un catálogo con cubierta de 300g, el poster y la postal.

Si llegamos a 4.000€ nos gustaría hacer una expo interactiva: espectador y ciudad. Traspasaremos las paredes de la galería y recorreremos la Lisboa real. De la mano de los artistas y amigos de la galería, haremos un recorrido por la ciudad y sus barrios, rechazando cualquier lugar o emblema turístico.

Si superamos los 4000€, lo que recaudemos será utilizado para pagar el trabajo de tod@s l@s buen@s amig@s que nos están ayudando en esto.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar: El dinero no lo es todo! Si no puedes colaborar económicamente, hazlo compartiendo esta campaña: piensa en alguien que le pueda interesar y envíale nuestra campaña.

5. Recompensas

*15€ Mecenas súper importante #1: Gracias por apoyarnos!!! Porque destinaremos tu recompensa a los infinitos cafés que se consumen durante el proceso creativo, eres nuestro Mecenas Súper Importante #1! Tu nombre estará en el apartado Agradecimiento y Mecenazgo del catálogo; y te lo enviaremos a donde nos digas. Tu recompensa: Postal firmada, Poster firmado y tu nombre en la lista de mecenas.

*25€ Mecenas súper importante #2: Gracias por apoyarnos!!!  Porque necesitamos esa cerveza después de una jornada de trabajo (sabes de lo que hablo, no?), eres nuestro Mecenas Súper Importante #2! Tu nombre estará en el apartado Agradecimiento y Mecenazgo del catálogo. Te enviaremos todo a donde nos digas. Tu recompensa: Catálogo firmado, Postal firmada, Poster firmado y Tu nombre en la lista de mecenas.

Sus colinas, su interracialidad, su saudade y amabilidad.  Desde hace unos años se ha vuelto muy popular. El turismo se ha desarrollado bastante rápido y en pocos años se ha convertido en el segundo mejor destino en Europa. De como afecta esa transformación trata mi exposición.3. ¿Por qué un Crowdfunding?Esta es mi primera campaña de Crowdfunding. Me entusiasma la idea de poder colaborar con proyectos del otro lado del mundo y que tú puedas colaborar con el mío aunque no nos conozcamos ni vivamos en el mismo barrio.4. El Proyecto más detallado4.1 Especificaciones técnicasFotografías de 40x50 en papel RH  de alta calidad sobre soporte de kapafix de 1 cm de ancho y debidamente enmarcadas.Edición limitada de 10 copias firmadas y numeradas.La Inaguración de la exposición será en Lisboa, en la galería Passevite, el 11 de Noviembre de 2017. Con un mes de duración. Nuestra intención es inaugurarla también en Madrid.4.2 Tu ayudaTu ayuda irá directamente a la producción de la exposición.Para la producción básica de la exposición necesitaremos un total de  3.000€. Incluye un catálogo con cubierta de 300g, el poster y la postal.Si llegamos a 4.000€ nos gustaría hacer una expo interactiva: espectador y ciudad. Traspasaremos las paredes de la galería y recorreremos la Lisboa real. De la mano de los artistas y amigos de la galería, haremos un recorrido por la ciudad y sus barrios, rechazando cualquier lugar o emblema turístico.Si superamos los 4000€, lo que recaudemos será utilizado para pagar el trabajo de tod@s l@s buen@s amig@s que nos están ayudando en esto.Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar: El dinero no lo es todo! Si no puedes colaborar económicamente, hazlo compartiendo esta campaña: piensa en alguien que le pueda interesar y envíale nuestra campaña.5. Recompensas*15€ Mecenas súper importante #1: Gracias por apoyarnos!!! Porque destinaremos tu recompensa a los infinitos cafés que se consumen durante el proceso creativo, eres nuestro Mecenas Súper Importante #1! Tu nombre estará en el apartado Agradecimiento y Mecenazgo del catálogo; y te lo enviaremos a donde nos digas. Tu recompensa: Postal firmada, Poster firmado y tu nombre en la lista de mecenas.*25€ Mecenas súper importante #2: Gracias por apoyarnos!!!  Porque necesitamos esa cerveza después de una jornada de trabajo (sabes de lo que hablo, no?), eres nuestro Mecenas Súper Importante #2! Tu nombre estará en el apartado Agradecimiento y Mecenazgo del catálogo. Te enviaremos todo a donde nos digas. Tu recompensa: Catálogo firmado, Postal firmada, Poster firmado y Tu nombre en la lista de mecenas.

story:
Hello! It's me again!

Emilie here! EmyBPhoto is now a team composed of myself (Emilie Black) and Charlotte Cox, assistant extraordinaire. This year we started a bit earlier and have already gotten 3 fab shoots done with 9 more to come. You loved the calendar last year, you will adore it this year!

What We Need & What You Get

So, we need to be able to pay for this calendar's production from photoshoots to printing. That is where you all come in! We need some help! We are producing this one out of pocket and the pocket need a bit of help.

Your contribution will help us pay for everything from gas to get to the photoshoots to wardrobe to printing to promotion.

In exchange, you get a calendar (or more) shipped to you. If you're feeling adventurous and generous, you can also get your very own photoshoot!

 

Risks & Challenges

Currently, we are going to print no matter what, so your risk is simply a question of will you love what we do or not. Here we pride ourselves in always delivering a quality product no matter what. The challenge at the moment is paying for everything and getting everything done on time for the printer's deadline while working 2 jobs and maybe having a full night's sleep every few weeks.

Other Ways You Can Help

Share, share, share! Share us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, tell your auntie, your cousin, your neighbor's wife's nephew's co-worker. Telling as many people as you can helps us greatly in getting the word out and getting more fans to get this lovely calendar.

Another way to help is to request that your local horror shop carry the calendar for the Holiday season (we will be ready on time for Halloween!).

Thank you! Merci! Danke! Gracias!

story:
Bound is our collective look at the American West in the form of a 120 page hardcover photo book. We wanted to meditate on and thoughtfully portray what the American West means to each of us in a seamless way that's both accessible and relatable to anyone. It's minimalist, it's contemplative, it's high-spirited, and we can't wait to share it with you.
We are a humble group of individuals who embrace creative thinking via photography, surfing, and travel. Our central motive in the creation of this book has been to promote both our own take on the lasting effect the American West has on the human spirit and creative free thinking at large. What we ultimately hope to accomplish with this project, hopefully the first of a series to come, is to share our point of view manifested as a visually appealing art piece that will leave our readers feeling as though they gained a bit of insight from the experience. We sincerely hope you'll join us in celebrating a book we are truly proud of.

With your help, we hope to raise a grand total of $6,000 which will be put mainly toward the cost of printing hardback copies of Bound which will withstand the test of time. The books will be printed in Huntington Beach, CA with an emphasis put on environmentally sustainable production methods and materials so that our readers may take pride in their purchase. With your donation, we will be offering a selection of perks as incentive, the first of which being a digital smile for your donation of $5 or more, just to say thanks for the support. Our second perk is a set of 2 Bound themed pins for your donation of $10 or more. With your donation of $25 or more, you get an 8"x10" print of the following photo, as well as two Bound themed pins.

With your donation of $50 or more, you get a signed copy of Bound and a set of two Bound themed pins, and for your donation $75 or more, you will receive a signed copy of Bound along with an 8"x10" print of the photo above. For your donation of $100 or more, you will receive a 12"x18" print of the following photo along with a signed copy of Bound and a set of two Bound themed pins.

For your donation of $250 or more, in what we're calling our Deluxe Package, you will receive a hand screen-printed Bound T-shirt as well as a 12"x18" print of the above photo, a signed copy of Bound, and a set of two Bound themed pins. With your donation of $500 or more, you will receive five 12"x18" prints, signed by the photographer, of your choice (any photo featured within Bound). And finally, for our biggest perk, we are offering a custom art piece up to 24"x36" of any photo featured in Bound printed on any medium of your choice. 

We hope you are as excited as we are about these perks as well as the book as a whole and please feel free to reach out to us with any questions you may have. Feel free to spread the word using our campaign share tools, excitement is the best form of promotion!

story:
Hi!

We love taking pictures of birds!

But all those images! It's a mess! Culling out the bad ones, finding the ones you want... then trying to tag and name them... Traditional photo management tools just don't cut it. Renaming files and directories, making copies... it just doesn't work. It's hard to do, it doesn't work well, and it's just not any fun. And I still can't find the pictures I'm looking for.

Whimbrel BIRD solves this problem. We've developed a desktop photo management application specifically for birders. Quickly and easily identify your bird from our built-in checklist. Tag from a full list of single-click birder-specific and user defined attributes, and drag and drop your image on to the map. Once you do, it's all in your database. You can find your pictures, by what they are or where they are, and more!

We add the full taxonomy from your selected species along with detailed location data from the point you selected.  Without having to type it in for each picture.  You can find everything in a given park, County, Refuge, and more!  Or, view by genus, family, order, or group!  Imagine if you could just show all your Hawks, or Warblers - you can!

Saved location data includes Country, State, County, City, and various landmarks and local points of interest including state and local parks, natural areas, forests, refuges, and many others. The saved taxonomy includes family, order, genus, species, common name, and common family names or groups.

You can search by combinations of all the various attributes you can assign! Mark unknown or uncertain ID's for later review. Find everything from a County or Refuge. Search by time of day. It's all in a searchable database, and we provide easy tools so you can pull out the data in different ways, all tied to your images. It brings a new perspective and lets you see your pictures in a whole new way.

                

                 

See more details at www.whimbrel.com

Whimbrel BIRD is almost done. All the core components are complete. We're finishing up the last few features, and we'll soon be ready for beta testing and release.

We need your help! We need to have birders use Whimbrel BIRD, to help us make sure it works as intended and to refine various features to make sure we have the right capabilities. We also need funding so we can finish building out our web, support, and test infrastructure to take our product to market.

We're providing several options for you to help us do this:

  • Early Adapters: We're looking for 50 users to sign up as early adapters, so we can have the opportunity to have birders running on a variety of systems and configurations, and get feedback on how certain features and functions work so we can fine tune them. You'll get the software first, and of course you'll be able to update to our release version when that's available.
  • Early Access Users: We'll provide up to 250 users early release versions of the software, while we build out our support and licensing for the full product release.
  • Discounted pre-purchase: Make a contribution now, and we'll give Whimbrel BIRD to you when we release at a significant discount from the full product price.
  • Mac pre-purchase: Help support our Mac release.  The same as the Discounted pre-purchase option, but for Mac.

We're also offering some additional rewards! We have Whimbrel-logoed items for each option – Spudz Microfiber lens cloths in a convenient pouch that you can clip to your camera or binoculars, a 8GB SD Card, and a handy notebook and pen, made from eco-friendly recycled paper:

 


Our risks of not delivering Whimbrel BIRD are fairly low. As we mentioned, we're almost done with the exception of a few features. The final effort is to make sure that it's a quality product that's well supported with the right features will take some additional resources, and that's what we're looking for. If we don't meet our full funding goals, we'll still be able to release Whimbrel BIRD, but it may take more time, and we may not be able to fine-tune and test different features. We won't be able to build as good of a support system, and the release for Mac and other enhancements will be delayed.

We're confident that after loading your images into the Whimbrel BIRD database, you'll find the benefits are immediate. You'll be able to look at your images in different ways, and gain new insights. We think it will definitely enhance your birding experience.

And, please, even if you don't contribute, share this with your friends and fellow birders! Like us on Facebook, and you can use the icons on the Indiegogo site to tell others about us to help us meet our goal!


Thank you, and Happy Birding!!!

story:
About our project

In 2015 we traveled from Casablanca to Chefchaouen with a group of teenagers documenting their love for spreading Calisthenics to their communities. We were so inspired by their passion and enthusiasm for this ancient art of bodyweight movement that we decided to work with them to produce the first photographic book ever to celebrate the power and beauty of Calisthenics, set against the mystical and vibrant backdrop of the blue city of Chefchaouen.

But this is more than a book, it’s part of a greater project to raise awareness, to show how Calisthenics is changing people’s lives and transforming communities.

Your contribution will not only help us bring this book to life but will also empower the next generation of young people - starting by creating employment for the youth featured in the book. An agenda that coincides with the United Nations vision of Sustainable Development.

100% of sales profit will go to support "Je Suis Calisthenics” - A non-profit cause that empowers communities through calisthenics.

 

The Book

The book covers the tour of a group of teenagers over 6 weeks, from the outdoor parks of Casablanca towards the peaks of the Chefchaouen Mountain Range. Driven by their passion for Calisthenics, we join them on an uplifting tale of determination and solidarity, reminding us that life is a journey, not a destination. Full of rich and striking photography this book transcends the boundaries of culture and language.

The use of gritty black and white photography demonstrates the youth at play in their urban environments, juxtaposed with hyper-real coloured images of the youth, shot against the mystical blue and vibrant backdrop of Chefchaouen. This book shows the incredible dynamism of youth culture expressing itself in a new and exciting way putting the youth of Casablanca on a blue pedestal.

 

"The first book to ever cover the culture of the community in calisthenics."

 

Who are we?

We are the Kashmirwala brothers, a duo of creative visionaries.

Ibrahim, photographer and award-winning creative director with over ten years of experience in the field of visual effects and communication.

Fahd, social animator with a passion to develop communities through the encouragement of health and wellbeing - founder of "Je Suis Calisthenics".

Our ethos is to work with inspiring individuals and create projects that have a positive social impact. We believe that no dream is too big to achieve.

 

Why Morocco?

On a photographic trip to Morocco in 2014, we came across a group of teenagers doing Calisthenics in a skateboard park in Casablanca. They welcomed us into their group and although we didn’t speak their language, we communicated through Calisthenics. They showed us their moves and we were blown away by their raw energy, their enthusiasm and their humbling spirit. These kids had almost nothing and they were sharing so much with us.

 

 

Calisthenics is a new wave of freestyle athletic conditioning. This cutting-edge sports movement calls on bodyweight resistance, balance and core-strength, setting itself apart from the sleek, self-conscious, mirrored world of city gyms, and asserting itself firmly in the raw, dusty and gritty streets. Its essence as a culture is an adaptable, creative mentality that pushes one’s ability to the furthest limits. The driving ethos shared by this collaboration is determination, simplicity of vision and creativity.

 

"With Calisthenics, the entire world is your playground."

 

Calisthenics is at a similar stage to where skateboarding was in the 70s. Like skateboarding, it was born in the streets. Groups of guys hanging out in deprived areas with no real vision of the future, working on their skills with passion and determination. Just as the kids of Dogtown would break into abandoned houses to use empty swimming pools to skate in, childrenss playgrounds are being used for Calisthenics. Teams organise group workouts. The older kids teach the younger ones.

But because of the general lack of awareness and support, these groups are often seen as anti-social.

That’s why we decided to create a photographic document of Calisthenics, to celebrate its power and beauty and show how it can build confidence and self-esteem and bring communities together. So, we took the group to Chefchaouen, the Blue City in the Rif Mountains – the perfect artistic backdrop to show off Calisthenics. 

In Chefchaouen we felt we were present at the birth of a new global movement. And because it’s only a matter of time before this movement becomes an industry, it’s important that it stays in touch with its roots. The team spirit, mutual support and positive reinforcement that happen at the Calisthenics bar have the power to bring people together from all backgrounds, regardless of ethnicity, age or gender, contributing towards much-needed unity and social integration.

What started as a photographic project has evolved into “Je Suis Calisthenics” 

 

The Cause - “Je Suis Calisthenics” 

(Photo not part of Journey to the Blue City)

This project has been 3 years in the making because we wanted to create a photographic masterpiece whilst being socially responsible by finding a way to create sustainable and decent work for the youth. With this IndieGoGo campaign, we will be able to do just that.

Our aim is to produce and publish 500 copies of “Journey to the Blue City”. After distributing copies to all backers, the remaining copies will be sold and 100% of sales profit will go to fund “Je Suis Calisthenics” - a non-profit cause that empowers communities by creating decent employment for the youth and encouraging their love and passion for Calisthenics. 

 

(Photo not part of Journey to the Blue City)

But that's not all, the classes they provide to disadvantaged communities are free of charge. The vision of “Je Suis Calisthenics” to encourage good health and wellbeing and provide full and productive employment is a vision that coincides with the United Nations Agenda of 2030 for creating sustainable development globally.

By helping our project, together we can play a much bigger role, in creating a sustainable future for the world.

 

What We Need and What You Will Receive:

  • With your help, our goal is to have a limited print run of 500 books. If we do not reach our goal, we will still deliver a high-quality final product to our contributors. If we exceed our goal, we will be able to make more funds available to Je Suis Calisthenics.
  • By contributing to this project you will become one of the few owners of this inspiring limited edition book. But even more importantly you will become an active contributor to sustainable development In Morocco.  
  • We have contacted printers and received our quotes. Now, all we need is you!  - We are projecting that you as a backer can expect to receive Journey to the Blue City right in time for Christmas 2017.
  • All other perks, such as wristbands, postcards and prints are available now and are also expected to be delivered before Christmas 2017.
 

Challenges and Moving Forward

  • We have put together a great team, and we've prepared as much as possible to make sure that this project runs smoothly. From this campaign, through the book design and production, to shipping out orders, we know what our next steps are and what deadlines we have to meet. 
  • The Calisthenics community is growing steadily year on end and it is only a matter of time before we look back to when it all began. We are certain this will not only bring a nostalgic value but an inspirational one, to how this sport can bring about a positive change. 
  • We do not have an advertising budget, but we believe this project is rich enough to sell itself via word of mouth. So please tell your friends to visit and share https://www.facebook.com/JourneyToTheBlueCity/

 

Book Specifications:

Size: 210 x 260 mm (Portrait)

Printing: 4-process color throughout (Lithographic)

Pages:  132 pages (If we exceed our fundraising goal page count may increase)

Text: 80 lb. matte coated

Endsheets: Endsheets to print 4-process color

Binding:  Section sewn, case bound hardcover, cloth over board with colorplan endpapers

 

Here are the Perks!

 

£5 - Je Suis Calisthenics Wristband x2

 

£15 - Limited Edition Postcard Set

 

£20 - Je Suis Calisthenics T-Shirt

 

£35  - Journey to the Blue City Book

(3d visualization)

 

£50 - Blue City Bundle

 

£65 - Signed/Personalised Book

Each book cover will be bespoke with a unique photo solely selected for you. Kashmirwala will personally write a customized note and sign the book - email info@kresh.uk 

 

£70 - Je Suis Calisthenics Bundle

Rock your very own 'Je Suis Calisthenics' T-shirt!  Also, receive a copy of Journey to the Blue City, postcards, and wristbands. 

 

£250 - Previous Perks & Signed Print of Choice

A signed book, postcard set and a signed print of choice.Select from an option of 10 limited edition prints available at http://kresh.co.uk/jbcprints - email your choice to info@kresh.co.uk

 

£350 - "The Tiger Cup" Giclée Print 10"x16"

As presented by the Kashmirwala Brothers to the Moroccan ambassador to the UK.

(Ambassador H.E Abdessalm Aboudrar)

Own your very own piece of The Blue City in the form of a framed 10"x 16" Giclee print. Printed on the finest of Art Paper, the backer will receive "The Tiger Cup", Kashmirwala's most renowned work.

 

£500 - Limited Edition Giclée 10"x16" of choice & three (3) Signed/Personalized Books 

 

10"x 16" Custom Giclée print on Hahnemühle Pearl signed and framed. Select from an option of 10 limited edition prints available at http://kresh.co.uk/jbcprints - We encourage you to email your choice to info@kresh.co.uk and leave a note to specify your choice, and your contact information if you'd like Ibrahim to contact you to discuss choosing the right piece of art for your home. In addition, you will also receive 3 signed/personalized copies of the book.

Giclee prints are professional, museum-quality inkjet prints using archival inks and the finest and most durable archival stock options. A giclee print uses a combination of eleven archival pigment-based inks producing a significantly larger color gamut than you're used to with traditional print methods. This means colour preservation of the print can last up to 100 years.

The prints will be framed behind museum-quality glass, which allows for a clearer viewing as all reflections are minimized.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you believe in what we’re doing but you’re not in a position to contribute financially, you can also help by spreading the word.

Share our Indiegogo campaign on your social media and use our hashtags #JourneyToTheBlueCity.

Thank you!
story_txt:
About our project
In 2015 we traveled from Casablanca to Chefchaouen with a group of teenagers documenting their love for spreading Calisthenics to their communities. We were so inspired by their passion and enthusiasm for this ancient art of bodyweight movement that we decided to work with them to produce the first photographic book ever to celebrate the power and beauty of Calisthenics, set against the mystical and vibrant backdrop of the blue city of Chefchaouen.

But this is more than a book, it’s part of a greater project to raise awareness, to show how Calisthenics is changing people’s lives and transforming communities.
Your contribution will not only help us bring this book to life but will also empower the next generation of young people - starting by creating employment for the youth featured in the book. An agenda that coincides with the United Nations vision of Sustainable Development.
100% of sales profit will go to support "Je Suis Calisthenics” - A non-profit cause that empowers communities through calisthenics.
 
The Book
The book covers the tour of a group of teenagers over 6 weeks, from the outdoor parks of Casablanca towards the peaks of the Chefchaouen Mountain Range. Driven by their passion for Calisthenics, we join them on an uplifting tale of determination and solidarity, reminding us that life is a journey, not a destination. Full of rich and striking photography this book transcends the boundaries of culture and language.

The use of gritty black and white photography demonstrates the youth at play in their urban environments, juxtaposed with hyper-real coloured images of the youth, shot against the mystical blue and vibrant backdrop of Chefchaouen. This book shows the incredible dynamism of youth culture expressing itself in a new and exciting way putting the youth of Casablanca on a blue pedestal.
 
"The first book to ever cover the culture of the community in calisthenics."
 

Who are we?
We are the Kashmirwala brothers, a duo of creative visionaries.
Ibrahim, photographer and award-winning creative director with over ten years of experience in the field of visual effects and communication.
Fahd, social animator with a passion to develop communities through the encouragement of health and wellbeing - founder of "Je Suis Calisthenics".
Our ethos is to work with inspiring individuals and create projects that have a positive social impact. We believe that no dream is too big to achieve.
 
Why Morocco?
On a photographic trip to Morocco in 2014, we came across a group of teenagers doing Calisthenics in a skateboard park in Casablanca. They welcomed us into their group and although we didn’t speak their language, we communicated through Calisthenics. They showed us their moves and we were blown away by their raw energy, their enthusiasm and their humbling spirit. These kids had almost nothing and they were sharing so much with us.
 

 
Calisthenics is a new wave of freestyle athletic conditioning. This cutting-edge sports movement calls on bodyweight resistance, balance and core-strength, setting itself apart from the sleek, self-conscious, mirrored world of city gyms, and asserting itself firmly in the raw, dusty and gritty streets. Its essence as a culture is an adaptable, creative mentality that pushes one’s ability to the furthest limits. The driving ethos shared by this collaboration is determination, simplicity of vision and creativity.
 
"With Calisthenics, the entire world is your playground."
 

Calisthenics is at a similar stage to where skateboarding was in the 70s. Like skateboarding, it was born in the streets. Groups of guys hanging out in deprived areas with no real vision of the future, working on their skills with passion and determination. Just as the kids of Dogtown would break into abandoned houses to use empty swimming pools to skate in, childrenss playgrounds are being used for Calisthenics. Teams organise group workouts. The older kids teach the younger ones.
But because of the general lack of awareness and support, these groups are often seen as anti-social.
 That’s why we decided to create a photographic document of Calisthenics, to celebrate its power and beauty and show how it can build confidence and self-esteem and bring communities together. So, we took the group to Chefchaouen, the Blue City in the Rif Mountains – the perfect artistic backdrop to show off Calisthenics. 
In Chefchaouen we felt we were present at the birth of a new global movement. And because it’s only a matter of time before this movement becomes an industry, it’s important that it stays in touch with its roots. The team spirit, mutual support and positive reinforcement that happen at the Calisthenics bar have the power to bring people together from all backgrounds, regardless of ethnicity, age or gender, contributing towards much-needed unity and social integration.
What started as a photographic project has evolved into “Je Suis Calisthenics” 
 
The Cause - “Je Suis Calisthenics” 

(Photo not part of Journey to the Blue City)
This project has been 3 years in the making because we wanted to create a photographic masterpiece whilst being socially responsible by finding a way to create sustainable and decent work for the youth. With this IndieGoGo campaign, we will be able to do just that.
Our aim is to produce and publish 500 copies of “Journey to the Blue City”. After distributing copies to all backers, the remaining copies will be sold and 100% of sales profit will go to fund “Je Suis Calisthenics” - a non-profit cause that empowers communities by creating decent employment for the youth and encouraging their love and passion for Calisthenics. 
 

(Photo not part of Journey to the Blue City)
But that's not all, the classes they provide to disadvantaged communities are free of charge. The vision of “Je Suis Calisthenics” to encourage good health and wellbeing and provide full and productive employment is a vision that coincides with the United Nations Agenda of 2030 for creating sustainable development globally.
By helping our project, together we can play a much bigger role, in creating a sustainable future for the world.
 
What We Need and What You Will Receive:

With your help, our goal is to have a limited print run of 500 books. If we do not reach our goal, we will still deliver a high-quality final product to our contributors. If we exceed our goal, we will be able to make more funds available to Je Suis Calisthenics.
By contributing to this project you will become one of the few owners of this inspiring limited edition book. But even more importantly you will become an active contributor to sustainable development In Morocco.  
We have contacted printers and received our quotes. Now, all we need is you!  - We are projecting that you as a backer can expect to receive Journey to the Blue City right in time for Christmas 2017.
All other perks, such as wristbands, postcards and prints are available now and are also expected to be delivered before Christmas 2017.
 Challenges and Moving Forward

We have put together a great team, and we've prepared as much as possible to make sure that this project runs smoothly. From this campaign, through the book design and production, to shipping out orders, we know what our next steps are and what deadlines we have to meet. 
The Calisthenics community is growing steadily year on end and it is only a matter of time before we look back to when it all began. We are certain this will not only bring a nostalgic value but an inspirational one, to how this sport can bring about a positive change. 
We do not have an advertising budget, but we believe this project is rich enough to sell itself via word of mouth. So please tell your friends to visit and share https://www.facebook.com/JourneyToTheBlueCity/


 
Book Specifications:
Size: 210 x 260 mm (Portrait)
Printing: 4-process color throughout (Lithographic)
Pages:  132 pages (If we exceed our fundraising goal page count may increase)
Text: 80 lb. matte coated
Endsheets: Endsheets to print 4-process color
Binding:  Section sewn, case bound hardcover, cloth over board with colorplan endpapers
 
Here are the Perks!
 
£5 - Je Suis Calisthenics Wristband x2

 
£15 - Limited Edition Postcard Set

 

£20 - Je Suis Calisthenics T-Shirt 


 
£35  - Journey to the Blue City Book

(3d visualization)
 
£50 - Blue City Bundle

 
£65 - Signed/Personalised Book

Each book cover will be bespoke with a unique photo solely selected for you. Kashmirwala will personally write a customized note and sign the book - email info@kresh.uk 
 

£70 - Je Suis Calisthenics Bundle

Rock your very own 'Je Suis Calisthenics' T-shirt!  Also, receive a copy of Journey to the Blue City, postcards, and wristbands. 
 
£250 - Previous Perks & Signed Print of Choice

A signed book, postcard set and a signed print of choice.Select from an option of 10 limited edition prints available at http://kresh.co.uk/jbcprints - email your choice to info@kresh.co.uk
 
£350 - "The Tiger Cup" Giclée Print 10"x16"
As presented by the Kashmirwala Brothers to the Moroccan ambassador to the UK.

(Ambassador H.E Abdessalm Aboudrar)


Own your very own piece of The Blue City in the form of a framed 10"x 16" Giclee print. Printed on the finest of Art Paper, the backer will receive "The Tiger Cup", Kashmirwala's most renowned work.
 

£500 - Limited Edition Giclée 10"x16" of choice & three (3) Signed/Personalized Books 


 
10"x 16" Custom Giclée print on Hahnemühle Pearl signed and framed. Select from an option of 10 limited edition prints available at http://kresh.co.uk/jbcprints - We encourage you to email your choice to info@kresh.co.uk and leave a note to specify your choice, and your contact information if you'd like Ibrahim to contact you to discuss choosing the right piece of art for your home. In addition, you will also receive 3 signed/personalized copies of the book.

Giclee prints are professional, museum-quality inkjet prints using archival inks and the finest and most durable archival stock options. A giclee print uses a combination of eleven archival pigment-based inks producing a significantly larger color gamut than you're used to with traditional print methods. This means colour preservation of the print can last up to 100 years.
The prints will be framed behind museum-quality glass, which allows for a clearer viewing as all reflections are minimized.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you believe in what we’re doing but you’re not in a position to contribute financially, you can also help by spreading the word.
Share our Indiegogo campaign on your social media and use our hashtags #JourneyToTheBlueCity.
Thank you!

story:
Hi friends, family, and art supporters! I'm Dani Leal and I'm a photographer based out of New Orleans. For the first time, I've been accepted and invited to exhibit work in public, at the Ogden Museum of Southern Art no less, with CURRENTS in conjunction with Photo Nola Festival this December. The exhibit will showcase contemporary photographic practices from New Orleans Photo Alliance Members. Of 91 submissions, 13 were invited to showcase, myself included among incredible company, from December 7th, 2018 until February 15th, 2019

Check out the official exhibition page here - https://photonola.org/event/currents-2018/

Check out my website here - www.danilealphotography.com

The work I'm showing displays themes of girlhood versus womanhood in todays world, something I am really excited to explore with other viewers. 

In order to make this a mutually beneficial fundraiser, a $50 donation will get a 8.5x11 print, selected from the options below. A donation at or above $250 will get one selected 8.5x11 print professionally framed, if they would like. 

Of course, any amount will make a dent in this funding and I would be so grateful. This is a really big opportunity, and my first time showing completed work to anyone outside of a small critique and my studio. I feel so humbled to have been one of the artists chosen, and it's a privilege to get to show them at the Ogden, a museum recognized for examining the coincidence of visual art and Southern Traditions in an effort to broaden our understanding of the South itself. It would mean the world to have the support of fellow art lovers help me with this last push, and to have my work on your walls!

Below please find the 8 photos I will be offering as prints. Be sure to select the appropriate "perk" on the right hand column that corresponds to the print you would like when making your contribution.  If contributing $250 for a framed print, AT CHECKOUT please specify which print you would like using the "other" option under "contribution appearance". THANK YOU!

Print #1

 

Print #2

 

Print #3

 

Print #4

 

Print #5

 

Print #6

 

Print #7

 

Print #8

story:
ABOUT THE BOOK

I'm producing a limited edition run of my new art book IDENTITY – a collection of portraits and landscapes taken in and around Hudson, NY and the Historic Hudson Valley. I will be using the funds from this campaign to edit and package the book for a retail version published through a premium art book publisher. 

PREMIUM HARDCOVER EDITION  (200 AVAILABLE) – $250

A signed copy of the 14"x11" limited edition hard cover photography book. Artist proof collector's item. Linen-bound. Premium archival paper. Your name featured in the Acknowledgements section.

SOFTCOVER EDITION (100 AVAILABLE) – $95

A smaller, more economical soft cover version of the book. Deluxe paper. Signed. 12"x9".

MUSEUM QUALITY SIGNED LIMITED EDITION PRINTS (EDITIONS OF 50)

16x20 Limited Edition Museum Quality Prints from our selection of images in the GALLERY section.

PERSONAL PORTRAIT SESSIONS & ADDITIONAL PERKS

I am offering a limited number of personal portrait sessions (US and abroad) – as well as large and small signed prints, a signed IDENTITY poster, and more.


Designed by Israeli-born graphic artist Roi Baron (Waltz With Bashir, Macmillan Books), this limited edition run will be available for purchase only through this campaign. Once they're gone, they're gone.

The general public retail version will be available once a a publisher is confirmed and a release date is set.


MY STORY

My name is Giovanni di Mola. I’m a photographer and DJ based in Upstate New York. 10 years ago I left a life in the clubworld of New York City to clean myself up and get some perspective on who I am, what I want, and the mark I want to make. That’s when I discovered the city of Hudson, New York, about 2 hours north of Manhattan.

Like me, Hudson had lived through its own colorful chapters – a thriving whaling town, a pipeline city for drugs and prostitution, and then, in its most recent incarnation, a safe harbor for creative people fashioning a life outside the mainstream.

Like most typical New Yorkers, I didn't have a car or a driver's license, but Hudson was a walkable town, a Main Street town, not too big, not too small. And because the rents were exponentially cheaper than what I was paying in New York, I was able to open my photography studio and start my life as a professional artist.

Over the next ten years, I would come to know who I am through the people I photographed – people that were searching for themselves just like I was. That search for identity became the throughline of my work.

The portraits were a conversation. For the subjects, they were seeing themselves through another’s eyes, gaining a fresh perspective, and being reminded of their unique beauty.

For me, each portrait drew me deeper into an understanding of my own identity. I was unraveling the knot that had formed in my childhood and early adulthood in New York City and was finally seeing the threads of who I truly am for the first time.

I began to show my work at local galleries and shops and was astonished and humbled when the work began to find an audience. I won the Columbia County Artist Award for Best in Show and was selected as one of the first NYFA Mark artists exhibiting in Hudson and New York City – a rewarding homecoming of sorts. Since then I've shown in several galleries, have been published in Italian Vogue and Vice Magazine and have sold my work to patrons from around the world.

This book, and the show connected with it, will be a celebration of my journey as an artist, and the individuals I’ve had the pleasure of photographing along the way. It will also be the first official collection of my work as one complete story.


YOUR DONATION WILL HELP COVER

> The final round of photo shoots that will be featured in the book.

> Designing the book, editing images, developing the written story.

> Producing and printing the Limited Edition run, which will serve as the package I'll be submitting to publishers to secure a retail publishing deal.

> Producing and printing the perks listed on this page.

> Producing the museum quality archival work for the gallery shows in Hudson and New York City – as well as the costs involved with the shows themselves.

THANK YOU

Your donations are invaluable for making this book a reality. I am truly grateful for your help and to finally be able to share this book and these images with you and the rest of the world.

SPECIAL THANKS TO

Sparrow Hall, Roi Baron, Brian O'Donnell, Timothy Dunleavy, Mona Coade-Wingate, Ferol Barton-Blake, Jeffrey Means and David McDonald – and to all of the beautiful individuals that fill the pages of this book, without whom none of this would have been able to happen.  Also, a huge thanks to all of my friends who have donated their skills, advice, guidance and continuing support along the way.

xoxoxo

Giovanni

www.giovannidimola.com

All photographs by Giovanni di Mola. Copyright 2015. All rights reserved.

story:
My book "Quattro Passi" is a compilation of images taken from many visits to Florence, where photography began for me as a student. The Historic Center of Florence is designated a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its unrivaled concentration of art treasures, in such a small geographic area.  With this project I want to also represent Il Centro Storico as a pleasant, and inspirational, place for a walk - strolling through history in the heart of a proud city, very accepting and tolerant of people from all over the world. 

     The fascination I have with this 'street-shooting' style of photography is for its randomness and spontaneity, which I also used effectively in my first work "Street Fare" about San Francisco.  The money I raise for this project will be used for printing and delivery costs, plus a photo exhibit/book signing event in SF, and eventual marketing both locally and in Florence, where it will sell well and meet with great success.

     Any help you may contribute to this project - be it financial, sharing on other social media, or just talking it up with friends - will be of help.  Thanks very much.

 Mike Nelsen   

 

       "...the perceptive and affectionate eye that characterizes his work, employed with conciseness - not to mention his lighthearted irony - is evident in his images...for a Florentine like me, being also a professional photographer, it was a great pleasure to look through these images and rediscover my own experiences and a freshness brought back to me...For lots of these images I'd like to be able to say it was me who took that one!"                                                         

 Maurizio Berlincioni  -  Photographer                                                   

                                                                                                              "...In Michael Nelsen's photographs...one will find an assortment of classic moments and candid tableaus...of a world now 'gone with the wind'...palaces and paupers, broad boulevards and forgotten passageways...these pictures create a fragile and delicate looking-glass that draws the viewer into a conversation with humanity."   

Winston Smith  -  Artist

story:
Short Summary

Floods cause damage to towns, homes and businesses every year. Pensacola Florida had such a flood just one year ago. On April 29th 2014 my small  photography studio was flooded and I was not insured. FEMA would not help because my studio was NOT attached to my home so I did not meet the qualifications of a home based business. It was 50ft behind my home! I had to laugh to keep from crying. My photography career was wiped out over Night. 

My Name is Frank Cotton and I have been a photographer for over 30 years, I began operating as a Professional Photographer / full time 16 years ago. When I was 49 years old I returned to college and finished a degree in photography. I love what I do, and its how I make a living to support my family.  I am seeking funding so I can replace my photo equipment  then I can at least work on location. Now at this point ! I truly hope you will try to understand what I am trying to accomplish.

The flood is the reason I lost everything and I need to replace the equipment of course. So what is the reason for needing to act so quickly right now ,well I have been given a tremendous photographic opportunity that could boost my career however I desperately need the right tools so that can  work (ie) the "professional photo equipment". On May 14th- 20th I will be attending The Annual IBMS competition for Photographers and Models..  All I have to do now is come up the photo equipment needed.  I will be show casing my photographic talents to over 20 Major Magazines . This opportunity will have a major impact on my career. I believe the old saying give a person a fish, feed them for a day, or give them a fishing pole and feed them for a lifetime. It maybe corny but the point is with the proper tools and enough ambition you can accomplish anything. In my case the proper tools are photo equipment. This is what I will be purchasing with the funds : A portable lighting system which includes x3 of the The Vagabond Lithium Extreme battery pack , x3 - Alien bees 800B flash heads, x3 - of the 18" reflectors with triple layer diffusion sock, x3 - 3ft power cords , x1 - Nikon D 810 camera body w/accessories , x3 SD/flash cards , x1- Laptop computer for downloading and viewing photographs on location, x1- 1TB hard drive for storage, x1 Monfrotto camera backpack , x1 -Nikon/sigma 70-200mm lens. This is my dream to make it as a professional photographer on a national and International. I am so excited this is a once in a lifetime opportunity for me.  Over 90% of the photographers and models that attended the event have been published nationally and internationally. That means I get to work and support my family.

I always knew from an early age that I would be a photographer, sort of like a sixth sense there was  something deep inside my soul that knew that my destiny was to be a professional photographer.  I hope you will be apart of making that dream come true. I would like to thank you in advance for your generosity and remember NEVER GIVE UP on your dreams.

What We Need & What You Get

I am seeking funding to continue my journey as a photographer.

• $12,000 needed to accomplish this goal

Perks:

$25 - 1- 8x10 gallery print

$100 - 1- 11x17 gallery print signed

$500 - 1 - 11x17 gallery signed plus t-shirt


 

The Impact

This will have lasting impact on many aspiring photographers and artist as well as my family and eventually a book of my work.

•  If you have ever had a dream and had struggles reaching the goal maybe you will understand. I have faced many challenges. After the death of my first wife I found solace and hope in my art. To inspire my children to never give up. 

•  Testimonials of Photgraphees; Tanisha Fate; "Frank Cotton you are magician and the camera is your wand”, Howard Maines; "Frank you are the best photographer I know", Desi Cecali; "Wow! Frank you are the bomb"  "Frank your photos have so much life"

•  Feel free to visit my FB page and website my life is an open book

Risks & Challenges

There are no guarantees in life. If you get knocked down, get back up even if you have to crawl half way.

•  What qualifies me to over come the hurdles? Well I’m not a quitter. 

•  Risks? Yes there are risks. Competition of photographers. I could have a heart attack and die. They may not like my work. 

Look!  Life is here and Now  stop worrying and LIVE!  

•  Describe your plan for solving these challenges. LOL, I have always faced each challenge Head on!  I was a widower and single parent at age 30, had my face crushed at 17, shot in the chest and survived age 26, raised 6 kids. 

•  No challenge is so big that you can't at least try. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some people just can't contribute, but you can still help:

•  Just get the word out and make some noise, tell others about my campaign.

•  Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks a lot folks
story_txt:
Short Summary
Floods cause damage to towns, homes and businesses every year. Pensacola Florida had such a flood just one year ago. On April 29th 2014 my small  photography studio was flooded and I was not insured. FEMA would not help because my studio was NOT attached to my home so I did not meet the qualifications of a home based business. It was 50ft behind my home! I had to laugh to keep from crying. My photography career was wiped out over Night. My Name is Frank Cotton and I have been a photographer for over 30 years, I began operating as a Professional Photographer / full time 16 years ago. When I was 49 years old I returned to college and finished a degree in photography. I love what I do, and its how I make a living to support my family.  I am seeking funding so I can replace my photo equipment  then I can at least work on location. Now at this point ! I truly hope you will try to understand what I am trying to accomplish.The flood is the reason I lost everything and I need to replace the equipment of course. So what is the reason for needing to act so quickly right now ,well I have been given a tremendous photographic opportunity that could boost my career however I desperately need the right tools so that can  work (ie) the "professional photo equipment". On May 14th- 20th I will be attending The Annual IBMS competition for Photographers and Models..  All I have to do now is come up the photo equipment needed.  I will be show casing my photographic talents to over 20 Major Magazines . This opportunity will have a major impact on my career. I believe the old saying give a person a fish, feed them for a day, or give them a fishing pole and feed them for a lifetime. It maybe corny but the point is with the proper tools and enough ambition you can accomplish anything. In my case the proper tools are photo equipment. This is what I will be purchasing with the funds : A portable lighting system which includes x3 of the The Vagabond Lithium Extreme battery pack , x3 - Alien bees 800B flash heads, x3 - of the 18" reflectors with triple layer diffusion sock, x3 - 3ft power cords , x1 - Nikon D 810 camera body w/accessories , x3 SD/flash cards , x1- Laptop computer for downloading and viewing photographs on location, x1- 1TB hard drive for storage, x1 Monfrotto camera backpack , x1 -Nikon/sigma 70-200mm lens. This is my dream to make it as a professional photographer on a national and International. I am so excited this is a once in a lifetime opportunity for me.  Over 90% of the photographers and models that attended the event have been published nationally and internationally. That means I get to work and support my family.I always knew from an early age that I would be a photographer, sort of like a sixth sense there was  something deep inside my soul that knew that my destiny was to be a professional photographer.  I hope you will be apart of making that dream come true. I would like to thank you in advance for your generosity and remember NEVER GIVE UP on your dreams.
What We Need & What You Get
I am seeking funding to continue my
journey as a photographer.
• $12,000 needed to accomplish this
goalPerks:$25 - 1- 8x10 gallery print$100 - 1- 11x17 gallery print signed$500 - 1 - 11x17 gallery signed plus t-shirt

story:
Hello and welcome to University of Westminster fundraiser for the BA Photographic Arts Graduates for 2015. We consist of students from a diverse range of backgrounds from England, Germany, Italy, US and Poland. Photography is a medium that has permeated modern cultural thinking and has become the most democratic form of visual expression available to the public’s art and commercial consumption. The degree show held at the Old Truman Brewery on Brick Lane in June is your chance to experience some of the most varied, talented and eclectic young practitioners currently working today.

The degree show is our opportunity to share our work with you and the general public in a professional context  which represents not only our dedication to our craft and the invaluable experience of participating in the real world as photographic practitioners but also our desire to share the work with a wider audience. This project will challenge us to liaise with companies and to meet with new people.

As a team we will design, set up and curate the exhibition space. It is extremely important to make this show happen for all us, as its an exciting platform to show our work to a large audience and many great future opportunities are born out of exhibitions like these. As part of our fundraising efforts we are asking for pledges in order to fund one of the most exciting and ambitious degree shows to date.

The reason for this crowdsourcing  campaign  is to aid 40 students in raising £10,000 that will help us in the acquisition of the space, printing and framing to the highest professional standard, and the tools needed to prepare it for its purpose. Your generosity will allow us to spend more time focusing on creating a high standard of work and make the whole display much more achievable and above all a success!

The impact of your patronage will not only enable our 3 years of solid and consistent hard work to reach a platform for which it deserves, but will also allow you to participate and own prints and other rewards from some of the most talented young practitioners to date. By donating, or even sharing our pitch you will be helping to further the exposure of one of the most exciting end of year shows to date as well as helping to further the careers and exposure of a remarkably ambitious cohort of photographers.

If you are unable to donate please feel free to come along to the exhibition regardless and enjoy a varied collection of photographic imagery. 

PS - Remember Sharing is Caring

story:
The money raised will be used for my tickets from New Delhi to LA and then to Mexico to cover the Baja Rally 3.0 www.bajarallymoto.com and my living expenses for a week in Mexico and USA. Photography and adventure are two things that I am most passionate about. Last year experience at Baja was all self funded where I invested all my savings. Need funds to cover it this year. I do not wish to discontinue the bond that I made with some of the awesome Rally riders , the organisers of the Baja Rally and the most amazing people of Baja California, Mexico. Worldwide the rallies have very tight budgets to afford a photographer from all the way to India. But it is my own love for the Motorcycle racing that took me 16000 kilometers from my home country into an absolute arid desert of Mexico. I will be grateful to each and every supporter. you can check out my last year's photographs of Baja Rally 2.0 at https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.77602...
Baja Rally Video : https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=382&v=6EpAp... 

Thanks
Nishant Verma
www.nishantvermaphotography.com

#BajaNishant #bringit
