story:
Viaggiare! perdere paesi!
Essere altro costantemente,
non avere radici, per l’anima,
da vivere soltanto di vedere!
Neanche a me appartenere!
Andare avanti, andare indietro
l’assenza di avere un fine,
e l’ansia di conseguirlo!
Viaggiare così è viaggio.
Ma lo faccio e non ho di mio
più del sogno del passaggio.
Il resto è solo terra e cielo.

(f.pessoa)

la prima volta che mi sono imbattuto in questa poesia, mi sono bloccato al primissimo verso: “viaggiare! perdere paesi!”.
non escludo, anzi, che fosse questo l’unico verso citato nella lettura che avevo tra le mani, in ogni caso è su questo che mi sono fermato, immobile nei miei pensieri, ad assaporare ciò che mi stava dicendo, a scoprire quel che avevo dentro.
il mio “perdere paesi” è qualcosa di molto diverso da quello che intende pessoa.
devo dire che la poesia intera, una volta letta, assaporata, compresa e poi riletta, mi appartiene profondamente, è qualcosa di più di una teoria del viaggio, è altro dal “si fa così”.
è qualcosa che si ha dentro, che si sente d’istinto e si mette a fuoco solo quando qualcuno o qualcosa d’altro ci fa notare quel che siamo e che abbiamo.
i pensieri che mi hanno assalito alla prima lettura del primo capoverso riguardavano più il mio modo di pensare i miei viaggi, un pensare prima ed un pensare dopo averli realizzati.
il fatto stesso di progettare un viaggio in un certo paese, di informarmi su cose pratiche e su ciò che significa attraversarlo, conoscerne gli abitanti, impararne pochissime parole della lingua in uso, conoscerne un minimo di storia, di attualità, di usanze e tradizioni, tutto questo, dicevo, me lo fa “perdere”.
per non parlare del realizzarlo.
lo perdo come luogo mitico, di fantasia, luogo da conoscere assolutamente perché sicuramente sarà interessante.
diciamo pure: bello!
volutamente mi affido alla genericità del termine “bello”, all’eccessiva vaghezza della parola, che lascia spazio a sogni di inaspettata meraviglia ed improvvisi stupori.
avventure per l’anima.
dalla prima lettura di una cartina geografica, di una guida, di un romanzo ambientato nei luoghi, perfino, il paese (non necessariamente una nazione) inizia a passare dall’immaginario al reale, ad appartenere al novero delle mete raggiungibili, delle avventure fattibili, si trova, ora, a portata di mano.
in questo senso lo perdo, non fa più parte dei (miei) luoghi lontani, non posso più considerarlo parte di un mondo sconosciuto, poiché ora è parte del mio mondo.
non per questo passa la voglia di partire, di toccare con mano, di guardare negli occhi e di calpestare strade, non per questo non subentra la voglia di tornare, di confrontare il prima ed il poi, che non riguarda solo il luogo, ma anche e soprattutto, me stesso.
 

 

Travel! lose countries!
Being more constantly,
do not have roots, for the soul,
to live only to see!
Not even me to belong!
Go ahead, go back
the absence of having an end,
and the anxiety of achieving it!
Traveling like this is traveling.
But I do it and I do not have mine
more than the dream of passage.
The rest is only earth and sky.

(F.pessoa)

the first time I came across this poem, I stopped at the very first verse: "travel! lose countries! ".
I do not exclude, indeed, that this was the only verse mentioned in the reading I had in my hands, in any case it is on this that I stopped, motionless in my thoughts, to savor what he was telling me, to discover what I had inside.
my "losing countries" is something very different from what  Pessoa means .
I have to say that the whole poem, once read, savored, understood and then reread, belongs to me profoundly, it is something more than a theory of travel, it is something else from "yes".
it is something that is inside, that feels instinctively and focuses only when someone or something else makes us notice what we are and what we have.
the thoughts that assailed me at the first reading of the first paragraph related more to my way of thinking about my travels, thinking first and thinking after having realized them.
the very fact of planning a trip to a certain country, of informing me about practical things and about what it means to cross it, to know its inhabitants, to learn very few words of the language in use, to know a minimum of history, current events, customs and traditions, all this, I said, makes me "lose".
not to mention making it happen.
I lose it as a mythical place of fantasy, a place to be known absolutely because it will surely be interesting.
let's say well: nice!
deliberately I rely on the generality of the term "beautiful", the excessive vagueness of the word, which leaves room for dreams of unexpected wonder and sudden amazement.
adventures for the soul.
from the first reading of a map, a guide, a novel set in those places, even, the country (not necessarily a nation) begins to move from the imaginary to the real, to belong to the ranks of achievable destinations, feasible adventures, it is now within reach.
in this sense I lose it, it is no longer part of (my) distant places, I can no longer consider it part of an unknown world, since it is now part of my world.
this does not mean the desire to leave, to touch, to look into the eyes and to walk on the streets, not for this reason does not take the desire to return, to compare the first and the then, which is not only about the place, but also and above all, myself.

story:
Hi, everyone. I am ChengZhao.A photographer from China.


Many people say that Tibet is one of the places where they must go in their life. So I went to Tibet with my girlfriend by car in 2013. Because of the restrictions on the road to the car, we only got to Lhasa. The dream going to Tibet Ali has been burned in my heart all the time. 


It is said that there are two kind of people in the world, one has gone to Tibet, one has not gone to Tibet. Yes, only the people who has gone to Tibet can have this sentiment. There is no place can have the charm like Tibet in the world, although the natural conditions in Tibet is extremely bad.


Ali is the most western place in Tibet. This wildness land looks unfit to the human habitation, but there had the human activity in 20000 years ago. Through the Zhang zhung dynasty and the Guge dynasty, the ancient zhang zhung bon has been originated in Ali, including the national customs, astronomy, calendar calculation, the Tibetan medicine, philosophy, logic theory, forensics, art, dance, music and so on. It is the important spiritual belief of Tibetans before the rise of Tibetan Buddhism.


Finally, because of the heart on the road, I decide to go to Tibet Ali by motorbike from Beijing, with my camera, and by myself. I will go through this land which’s average altitude is more than 5000m, and the climate is dry and cold.

So, I need your help. And I will invite you to follow my view to look into the world which is thousands miles away, the mysterious Tibet Ali, and the real life.

Thank you for your support and encouragement.thank every donation made to the project. Without your help, this would not be possible.

story:
Short Summary

People Power Perspective Presence.

The world is filled with People who have powerful perspectives of their presence and the effect their presence in the world around us. People, largely flawed and easily distracted by shiny things that make noises, have become supremely misguided and blinded to the "beauty", the "ugliness", the "hurt" and the "joy" that takes place in their not so immediate spaces. We have come to a place in time where one perspectives of people who don't have the simple pleasures of being acknowledged as worthy of life let alone feeling the power that's radiating off of their melanated skin. It is that lack of perspective presence that allows centuries of generations to be over looked and ignored. Mistreated and mistaken. 

I am coming to you, as your sibling in the struggle, to present to you a passion of mine in hopes that you recognize your power to help show the silence perspectives of the people who live, and breathe and grow and play just the way, if not more magical, than the dominant perspective will allow the world to believe. I am humbly asking for your assistance to get to my goal, in hopes that I can get my first real camera and attend a few photography courses so that I can hone this skill because, People Matter, Power Matters, Perspectives Matter, Presence Matters but most of all, Black Dreams Matter.


Yours in the Struggle,

Bre

story:
Hello, from Haiti...

We are an international team--an American doctor, an English communication designer, a Greek photographer, an American photographer, and a Haitian breast cancer survivor and advocate -- who all give support to a cancer screening and treatment programme in Port-au-Prince, Haiti through the non-profit Innovating Health International. 


Dr. Vince DeGennaro, Grace Tillyard and Gerty Surena have been working in Haiti together for three years. In addition to the treatment programme, we are currently working with our patients to educate and raise awareness about cancer in Haiti and elsewhere. Our goal is to promote a supportive community where women seeking cancer care is encouraged and accepted. But we still have a long way to go...

Cancer is currently killing more people in the developing world than HIV/AIDS, tuberculosis and malaria combined. Our clinic in Port-au-Prince specialises in breast cancer care but also treats other forms of adult cancer. Since we opened our doors in 2013, we have treated over 400 patients in Haiti, over 300 with breast cancer. The programme is entirely run by Haitian doctors and nurses. 

More than 80% of our patients are poor and vulnerable women with advanced disease. Often they do not have a job and have been abandoned by their partners because of their illness. Many of the them are shunned by their families or their communities. Poverty and fear of abandonment mean that many women come to the clinic with advanced disease and some are immediately placed into palliative care. One half of our patients are under fifty years old and their illness hurts not just them but their young families, orphaning children who may be abandoned or forced into domestic servitude. Treating cancer in Haiti is not just clinically complicated, but is also woven into difficult structural realities and lack of education and engagement with the services provided.

Gerty Surena is a cancer survivor who was fortunate enough to have received treatment in Haiti for her breast cancer through the love and financial support of her friends and family more than a decade ago. Now she heads the Haitian Support Group Against Cancer, spreading the message of awareness on television, the radio, and through communities. Her organization helps poor women obtain the treatment that was previously unavailable. This year, the Haitian Support Group Against Cancer and IHI have started to involve more patients and family members in this mission and have worked with them to tell stories and experiences to promote understanding and awareness about the disease. 

Gerty Surena was fortunate enough to have received treatment in Haiti for her breast cancer through the love and financial support of her friends and family more than a decade ago. Now she heads the Haitian Support Group Against Cancer, spreading the message of awareness on television, the radio, and through communities. Her organization helps poor women obtain the treatment that was previously unavailable. 

Gerty talking to the Haitian media during Breast Cancer Awareness Month

We Need Your Help to Tell their Stories

Through our work we have a glimpse of the extreme bravery and suffering of the women we treat. Their stories are powerful, heart breaking and push the boundaries of the humanly possible. Together, we watch how women fight for their lives, their children's education and a dignified position in society against the most incredible odds. 

Last year, we teamed up with Greek photographer Nerris Markogiannis in Port-au-Prince, Haiti. He photographed women receiving cancer treatment and recorded their stories. Over the course of a few months, Nerris shot 15 women in the clinic and we asked them to tell their stories through their own photographs and their bodies.

The photos in the book tell the story of women living with breast cancer in Haiti, the good and the bad. The images are raw and honest, displaying the scars that the women carry. Since our patients come in with advanced disease, the photos are powerful reminders of our frailty but also of the ability of the human spirit to persevere. We recorded their thoughts on the pictures and living with breast cancer as a woman in Haiti, written down in both English and Haitian Creole.

Our Haitian partners and patients believe that these images will inspire more women to seek care for cancer at earlier stages, saving lives.

We need your help so that these women can share their stories with the world and shine a light on the devastating effects of cancer on people living in developing countries. 

The money raised from you through Indiegogo would help us finalise, format and print 600 copies of this photo book that we would distribute throughout Haiti in order to raise awareness about breast cancer and encourage women into treatment earlier. We would also share the final work with key international organisations and stakeholders working in global health. With your help and through the stories of these women, we can lobby for cancer care to be resourced adequately so that women don't have to die from an entirely treatable disease. 

What Our Patients will Give You in Return for Your Support...

We need $5500 to cover for cost of finalising, formatting and printing the photo book. Here is a more specific break down:

- $1000 for formatting and desktop publishing courtesy of our friend and fabulous photographer Nadia Todres!

- $4500 for printing 600 copies of the book locally. We will have these printed and bound in Haiti so that the money will benefit Haitian small business.

We asked our patients what perks they would like to give our supporters. They came up with this:

- For $35, you get a copy of the book, and we'll give a copy of the book to local clinics and grassroots organizations in Haiti to raise awareness.

-For $60, you get a copy of the book, a bracelet supporting the treatment program, and we distribute TWO copies through local clinics and grassroots organizations in Haiti to raise awareness.

-For $100, your name will be printed in the book as a sponsor! You'll also get a copy of the book, a bracelet supporting the treatment program, and we distribute THREE copies to local clinics and grassroots organizations in Haiti to raise awareness.

Thank You for Listening!

This project means a lot to us but it means even more to the women we work for. By supporting this project you are giving them a way to make their stories heard and be advocates for cancer care in their country. No one knows better then them the trials that face women with cancer all around the world. 

If you choose to support us, we will put our years of expertise in global cancer care and communication design to ensuring that these photo books reach the right the people and have an impact on the lives of those we serve. We believe that every woman around the world deserves the opportunity to fight cancer through proper treatment. We also know that in order for this to become a reality, we need to create empathy and understanding between policy makers, international funding bodies and patients. We also need to spread awareness in Haiti of breast cancer, it's symptoms and treatments. We hope that you will help get this ball rolling by supporting this project!

If you can't support this project please have a look at what we do in Haiti on our website. You can also donate here: 

http://www.innovatinghealthinternational.org/#!...

Check out Dr. Vince's Blog here and Grace's website here for more stories from Haiti. 

**501c3 is listed as Equal Health International but we are doing business as Innovating Health International due to recent name change**

story:
About Sighted Blessings

I am a self-taught photographer, and the founder of an online gallery called Sighted Blessings. 

Sighted Blessings needs funds in order to pay fees (site upgrades, advertisement, etc.), to pay for photography equipment, photography classes, and travel, and to continue to provide free services to individuals.

Sighted Blessings is a gallery of God's creations and blessings. I started SB to show my appreciation for the beauty in not only the gift of photography that has been given to me, but also what has been given to all of us in our surroundings. I encourage others to appreciate the same, which is why I do what I do; I want to bless others with SB.

Sighted Blessings began as a budding hobby in the Spring of 2012, when a long-distance friend of mine fell ill. With no way to offer my presence in the time of need, I tried to think of another way to be of comfort. Since flowers were blooming on the trees, and I was fully equipped with a cell phone camera, I decided to take a picture of the budding flowers and send them to my ill friend. That first picture was the beginning of a journey. Soon after, I started a Facebook photo album, entitled "Beauty In Nature", that was a big hit among my Facebook friends. Three years and a professional camera later, Beauty in Nature remained a hit. Since then I have taken countless photos and done multiple photoshoots for friends and acquaintances. I do my work for free (though some insist that they pay!). Sighted Blessings, started in 2015, came out of a desire to want to bless even more people in the same way.

Sighted Blessings runs on donations. You can help me continue to offer my work and services for free and bless many by offering a donation. Any size, small or big, will make a difference. 

Thank you and be blessed!

What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to build an online community of appreciation and praise for God's blessings. I strive to provide free services. 

  • Sighted Blessings needs funds in order to pay fees (site upgrades, advertisement, etc.), to pay for photography equipment, photography classes, and travel, and to continue to provide free services to individuals.
  • If Sighted Blessings does not achieve the entire funding goal, all of the funds will still go to the purpose of paying fees, paying for equipment, classes and travel, and providing free services.
  • See donor perks.

The Impact

Your contribution will make a difference. By donating any amount, you will:

  • Help build an online community of appreciation, praise, and support.
  • Enable the photographer to travel and take pictures to share God's blessings from all over the world.
  • Help keep the gallery up and running.
  • Enable the photographer to provide free services and pay for equipment to provide even better services.
  • Help spread God's blessings throughout the world and make His praise go viral!

Risks & Challenges

Already, Sighted Blessings has blessed individuals online (Facebook and Instagram) and off. SB is challenged to gather a greater following and community and secure additional funding, which will create a large positive impact and advance God's Kingdom.

Sighted Blessings will overcome these hurdles through fervent awareness-raising, as well as continued prayer and trust in God's plan.

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't donate money! You can still donate:

  • Your word - get the word out to others through face-to-face communication, social media, and Indiegogo's share tools!
  • Your participation - check out the Sighted Blessings gallery, leave positive comments, and subscribe for updates!
  • Your prayers - say a prayer for Sighted Blessings, or leave a prayer or prayer request on our website!

Thank you and be blessed!

story:
Concerts Across the Country is a simple Idea:


Something for everything...landscapes, and all types of music. Beautiful art meets deep feelings connected by sunsets accompanied by musical talents. Country, jazz, blues, rock, hip hop, classic, indie, whatever else we stumble upon. Local artist or big name? Who knows? 

An Idea that I am hoping sparks your interest, an idea that I am hoping draws you in. I am fascinated by a few simple points of life. Photography, Concerts, and Travel are three of the big ones for me. 

I have been shooting concert's for some time now, I have shot some amazingly talented artists, and I have seen some amazing venues. 

The crave and desire to see more venues, more music, more talent, to cover it, to share it with the world never ceases, and now, I am making it a possibility. The plan is simple: To take the same idea that bands do; Traveling from city to city playing shows, except instead of playing the shows, I will be shooting the shows. What shows? Well, all of them. I want to be at as many concerts as I can get access to and get a photo pass for. I have already shot a large number of bands, and I have a wide variety of contacts throughout the music industry that will allow me to pursue the opportunity to shoot even more shows. 

My plan is simple, and scary, very scary in fact. At the same time this scary plan is my dream. I currently own a 2007 Ford Focus, along with some furniture, some electronics, and some other smaller possessions. I plan to sell off the car, and the furniture, as well as some of the electronics to help fund this trip. These fund's will be turned around and put into a van purchase, as well as outfitting it to be a small home. This self made RV will be the mode of transportation in which I travel the country seeing and photographing as many shows as possible. For how long? well, who knows...

But Justin...that sounds...well, expensive?
It is, and it isn't. The concert photography world is surrounded with opportunities to make some money, selling images to a newspaper, or online site, or a good landscape photo you took while on the road for sale.

There's also freelance work. Side job's to earn money. This is how I have lived for the past few years as it stands now, and it is something that can be done wherever the music takes me. 

BUT, there is a catch: That initial start up. The initial "Get out there." and that is where I need YOUR help.

Any amount of donations help's, If it's a dollar, or a million dollars, all contributions will push this into action, and help get me on the road. 


But wait, that sound's like a dream...What is in it for me?

There are ton's of contribution perk's available. They start out at the lowest range of 2$ and go up to that million dollar mark, so please. Consider helping fund this crazy ride of an adventure.

There is another benefit to me traveling this way: I am cutting down on my environmental impact by leaving a very small footprint.**



**Please note I have no actual affiliation with any band's, all photo's used within are property of JSL Photography, Justin Landers.**

story:
Production is complete. Encantador Tenerife is ready to shipping.

How it's made:

 

The book

Album “Encantador Tenerife” was created when shooting from a helicopter, drone, airplane model, the observation deck in the mountains! The captured thousands of pictures traveled thousands of kilometers around the island. From the air shooting spent hundreds of hours. Using hundred kilograms photographic techniques.Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.

The specs:

  • Encantador Tenerife size is 297 mm x 221 mm
  • The book is 160 pages
  • The cover is debossed with the title
  • In the book you will find 13 amazing facts and stories about the island
  • Book texts are written in four languages: Spanish, English, German and Russian!
  • With includes a island map of our captured locations

The Book Details

  • Encantador Tenerife is amazing quality book
  • Full of breathtaking aerial photographs taken over one of the world most beautiful island Tenerife
  • Reveals the unseen beauty of the island
  • Designed with big love for all who love Tenerife
  • ... and finaly, it's not even a book, this is opportunity, to have an island in your home

About Authors

 

Who are we? Ein Armor is a team, the heart and soul of which are a husband and a wife keen on travelling, photography and expressing themselves, their emotions and feelings through their photographs. Our aim is to show the people how we see the world. The task is to remind the people that the world is our home and that we ought to love it, know it, and to protect it.

We are especially thankful to our fate, which has brought us to the Canary Islands and to Tenerife. Throughout our lives, we have seen many locations both beautiful and interesting. However, Tenerife has swayed our hearts with how much is packed into this small corner of the earth, which is eternally showered by the vast waters. It is a unique place—a place so beautiful, nobody could possibly doubt it and the subtle desire to return here again and again. It has taken over a sizeable part of our hearts and we would like to share it. This book is a part of Tenerife, a part of us, and we sincerely hope that it will become a part of you. We are certain that this book will touch your heart, will fill it with pleasant memories and sentiments, and perhaps will surprise your with some unseen sighs. We are greatly honoured to have had a chance to compose this book. It is a book that serves as the business card of Tenerife.

Sincerely, the Authors,

Darius and Simona

 

... and our little team member 

Please help to spread the word about this project by sharing this link with your contacts. Thank you for your support!

 

www.encantadortenerife.com

story:
The campaign has ended.

You can order The Women in Pantyhose Photo Book at our website:

[ORDER HERE]

 

=======

I am a self-taught professional photographer, born on November 10th 1981 in Moscow, currently based in New York and frequently getting around the World. My distinctive vision of photography is based on catching the priceless moments of women's natural beauty. The primary subject of my artistic research is femininity.
I've been doing that for over 10 years, and now want to share my findings to help my project grow further.

 

The Limited Edition Photo Book

This is a hand-made personal collection of photographs compiled from 2008 to early 2016.  

A4 size book
8.27" x 11.69" (210 x 297 mm)
296 pages
over 300 photos

only 200 copies
to be produced.


Simulated image. The Book prototype in production.

WARNING: This book contains depictions of the human body as it was created by Nature.
If you are offended by such depictions then simply go watch Disney movies, they're afraid of humans too.

Is it normal that I enjoy seeing women wearing pantyhose?

Why do pantyhose make women’s legs look so great?

Should I blame myself for wanting to peek under a pretty lady's skirt while she's in pantyhose?

And finally…
WHY SO MANY WOMEN AVIOD WEARING PANTYHOSE?

 

These are questions I've asked myself thousands of times, and I believe many men ask themselves these same questions.

I'm Anatoly, a photographer who believes that women wearing pantyhose is the most beautiful sight in life.
For more than 15 years I've been researching this alluring riddle, testing hundreds of pairs of pantyhose, learning the hosiery industry on all continents. Completed hundreds of interviews with women of different cultures and ages learning their attitude and wishes towards nylons. 

In 2008 my passion evolved and I started making photographs of women in pantyhose.
I'm sharing them with the world  at pro-kolgotki.com.
I've cataloged over 17,000 photographs and continue my research.

Today I'm discovering answers to these questions, and the most important answer is within the photographs.

 

High Quality Prints - for Timeless Value.

From the today's "single-use-joy" to Timeless Value.


Simulated image. The Book prototype in production.

How often do you look at the photos you've taken  5 years ago?
​I'd say 'never'. Sorry, but it's true.

In digital form photographs are easily forgotten. We save photos in numerous digital storage locations never to be seen again.

On paper these photographs will last. You can enjoy them anytime. Just pick up the book from your bookshelf and recall the emotions.

 

Real Women, Not Models.

The women in these photographs are EXCLUSIVE to our project. They're real girls from real life, not professionals.
You won't find their faces on the covers of fashion magazines.

These women are accountants, office managers, sales associates that I had a chance to meet in my life.
The concept is to explore real women. See how they treat pantyhose on their legs. Study what they think of their own femininity and how their perception changes during a photography session.

 

If you’d ask me “What are you doing under a woman’s skirt?”
I’d answer “this is my Temple, I live here”.
Anatoly Borodin, photographer.

 

"I must tell you that I think your photography is excellent, and the the models are beautiful, their poses, and the pantyhose are so very sexy! You do a great job! Long may you continue."
North-Yorkshire, UK 

 

“You have a natural talent in photography, and no one can take that away from you.“ Ventura, CA

 

“I just want you to know that I LOVE your style of pantyhose photography, IT IS THE BEST I'VE EVER SEEN (we are talking about nearly 2 decades of viewing experience). Looking forward to see your fabulous creation every month!” San-Diego, CA

 

What's Inside of the Book 

The high resolution photographs of women in pantyhose that I've been creating since 2008 till Feb 2016.

 

Want to explore MORE of my works?


You're welcome to enjoy my magazine: 

EXPLORE THE MAGAZINE

 $3 coupon:
INDIE3
use at checkout


FREE PREVIEWS are always on my Tumblr

FREE PREVIEWS

 

 

Order & Delivery 

This is a pre-order campaign. Delivery is planned for October 2017.

We need to collect funds, then send the book to the production, then get your copy packed and dispatched.

Here's the current Schedule:

June-July   - prototype production, quality checks, and collecting pre-orders;

August         - finishing the book design and submitting to the production;

September - quality checks, packing, scheduling the deliveries
(at this point we'll contact you to confirm the delivery date and address);

October        - dispatching the BOOK. The delivery will take from 7 to 14 days depending on your location.

 

About us

My passion helped me find great talented people who have joined the project and love the idea of making this world a better 'pantyhose place'.


Here's is our team:  


Constantine Kurbatov
Financial and Strategic Advisor
Moscow, RU

Kseniya Khmel
Post-Production Designer
St.Petersburg, RU
Steven Blaine
Language Advisor
Detroit, MI
Anatoly Borodin
founder and producer
New York, NY

 

This campaign is important to us because it will:

  • give you a chance to explore the new angle of seeing femininity and pantyhose;
  • help you explore 'What's Under a Woman's Skirt' (that's my favorite, can't get enough);
  • get you a timeless piece of a unique photographic research. For life;
  • help us improve the quality of our work by upgrading the equipment and expanding our team;

Your support will bring us one step closer to our Big Dream: to inspire women to wear pantyhose in everyday life that will make this world a more exciting place to live.

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Every project has it's difficult parts. Here are the risks that we think of:

  • COLOURS. The colour reproduction in printing is always a big challenge. Although we do our best to make the perfect prints, the actual prints might not have the same colour shades that you see on your screen;
     
  • PRODUCTION DELAYS. Depending on the printing facility's workload, the printing may get delayed by several days or a week. We will keep you informed about any changes of our schedule;
     
  • DELIVERY DELAYS. It happens that parcels get lost or severely delayed. To solve that we will have a tracking umber for your order. And if you don't get your order and the tracking information confirms that, we will do a full refund (minus Indiegogo fees).

 

If we don't hit the funding the target, no worries:)

The goal is challenging indeed, and even if we don't hit the target you will anyways get your copy of the BOOK!

 

Can't Support Financially?

It's okay. We aren't billionaires too.

You can help us by:

1. following our pages at social networks

    

 

2. Sharing the link to this campaign your friends and communities.

Send us a link to your post(s) and we'll add you to the Hall of Fame!

 

MEDIA PARTNERS


http://www.pantyhoseshareclub.net
 


https://jenysmith.net
 


http://meinmypantyhose.com

 


fb: Nylons, High Heels & Sexy Legs

 

Do you own a popular blog on art/fashion/pinup theme?

You can get the Pantyhose Book FOR FREE in exchange for posts and/or articles about this campaign.
Drop me a message: anatoly@pro-kolgotki.com 
Conditions apply.

 

Disclaimers

All models on the photographs displayed on this page and on the photographs included in the The Women in Pantyhose Photo Book were over 18 years old at the moment of shooting.

All photographs displayed on this page, and all photographs included in the The Women in Pantyhose Photo Book are produced by Anatoly Borodin. Contact: anatoly@pro-kolgotki.com
 facebook.com/anatoly.borodin.1
